that went viral was when the seven-time Super Bowl champion got off of his seat to whisper something to Jeff Ross.\n\nAs the \"Roastmaster General,\" Ross came on stage to roast Brady, and one particular joke seemingly ticked off the former football player.\n\nRELATED: 'The Roast Of Tom Brady' Photos: Best", "spa": "INGLEWOOD -- Tres meses antes de que Tom Brady sea criticado como analista principal de la NFL en Fox Sports, recibi\u00f3 su cuota de cr\u00edticas de comediantes, ex compa\u00f1eros y el entrenador que lo dirigi\u00f3 durante la mayor parte de su carrera el domingo por la noche durante un evento de comedia transmitido en vivo en Netflix.\n\nY es seguro decir que despu\u00e9s de las frases y bromas que escuch\u00f3 Tom Brady durante las tres horas de \"The Greatest Roast of All Time\" en The Forum, que le ir\u00e1 bien.\n\n\"Es c", "deu": "Tom Brady (46) musste am Sonntag gewaltig einstecken. Der Ex-Footballer stand im Fokus des Live-Events \"The Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady\" von Netflix. Komiker und Weggef\u00e4hrten des Sportlers grillten Brady mit deftigen Gags. Die meisten Witze zielten dabei \u00fcber Bradys Trennung von Gisele B\u00fcndchen (43). Der Super-Bowl-Rekordsieger und das Model hatten im Oktober 2022 ihre Scheidung nach 13 Jahren Ehe bekannt gegeben.\n\nKevin Hart (44) er\u00f6ffnete den Roast und adressierte schon bald die C"}, "location": {"type": "place", "label": {"eng": "Los Angeles"}, "country": {"type": "country", "label": {"eng": "United States"}}}, "categories": [{"uri": "dmoz/Recreation/Humor/Advice", "label": "dmoz/Recreation/Humor/Advice", "wgt": 100}, {"uri": "dmoz/Society/Transgendered/Coming_Out", "label": "dmoz/Society/Transgendered/Coming Out", "wgt": 100}, {"uri": "dmoz/Sports/Bowling/Instructors", "label": "dmoz/Sports/Bowling/Instructors", "wgt": 89}, {"uri": "news/Arts_and_Entertainment", "label": "news/Arts and Entertainment", "wgt": 85}], "articleCounts": {"eng": 342, "spa": 32, "deu": 10}, "sentiment": 0.2078431372549019}
{"uri": "8113271957", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "06:42:57", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T06:42:57Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T06:42:32Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8392156958580017, "url": "https://www.devdiscourse.com/article/sports-games/2928685-tom-bradys-netflix-roast-humor-kraft-belichick-reunion-steal-the-show", "title": "Tom Brady's Netflix Roast: Humor, Kraft-Belichick Reunion Steal the Show | Sports-Games", "body": "Tom Brady faced jokes and barbs at a Netflix roast event ahead of his NFL analyst debut. Comedians, ex-teammates, and coaches roasted Brady, who took it in stride. Despite a joke about Brady's ex-wife, Kraft and Belichick showed support with a shared shot. Brady poked fun at Belichick's lack of Super Bowl wins since his departure. Brady's preparedness and willingness to laugh at himself were praised. The roast was seen as a testament to his greatness and a celebration of it in a lighter vein.\n\nThree months before Tom Brady gets roasted by critics as Fox Sports' top NFL analyst, he took his share of barbs from comedians, former teammates and his longtime coach Sunday night during a made-for-streaming comedy live event on Netflix.\n\nAnd it is safe to say after the one liners and jokes Brady heard during three hours of \"The Greatest Roast of All Time\" at The Forum, he will do just fine.\n\n\"It's like a football game. You run with a game plan, and then you get to see kind of how the strategy goes, and then you adjust on the fly,\" Brady said before the event. \"This is what a locker room has been like for me for all these years. So it's not like I'm used to people not making fun of me.\" Comedian Nikki Glaser, whose monologue was among the funniest of the night, termed the roast as \"the comedians' Super Bowl\" and how the competition level was ramped up because everyone wanted to one-up each other.\n\nBrady sustained more blitzes and pressure than he did during an average NFL game as an impressive lineup of comedians, former teammates and opponents took the stage . Host Kevin Hart said before the event that no topic was off limits, and Hart went on the offensive early with jokes about Brady's ex-wife, Gisele B\u00fcndchen.\n\n\"Gisele gave you an ultimatum. She said you retire or we're done. When you got a chance to go 8-9 and all it will cost you is your wife and your kids, you've got to do what you've got to do,\" Hart said, referring to Brady coming out of a brief retirement in 2022 for one more season.\n\nThe only time Brady objected to a joke was when Jeff Ross made a reference to Patriots owner Robert Kraft and massages. In 2019, Kraft received a misdemeanor charge that he paid for sex at a Florida massage parlor.\n\nBrady walked up to Ross and said in his ear \"don't say that (stuff) again\", but it was caught on the microphone.\n\nLater, Kraft and former Patriots coach Bill Belichick did a shot together on stage after some coaxing from Hart.\n\nBelichick was fired in January after 24 seasons with the Patriots, and a lot has been written about friction between the six-time winning Super Bowl coach and owner over the past couple years.\n\nAfter joking about this being like a reunion and \"unlike many family reunions there are some people I am desperately trying to avoid\", Kraft praised Belichick for what the two accomplished.\n\n\"I want to say this is the greatest coach in the history of the game that did what no one else has done. And having Tom Brady and him was the greatest honor the good Lord gave me,\" Kraft said.\n\nIt wasn't the first shot (of alcohol) that Belichick took. Rob Gronkowski got Belichick and Brady to do a shot together after his monologue. Gronkowski celebrated by spiking his shot glass.\n\nBelichick appeared at the beginning of the roast during a pre-taped segment when he told Brady that he was \"starting the roast\" instead of Drew Bledsoe. Brady replaced Bledsoe in 2001 when Bledsoe was injured in a Week 2 game against the Jets and led the Patriots to their first Super Bowl title that season.\n\n\"For all of you out there who think about who's responsible for the Patriots' success during the time Tom and I were together -- was it Tom or me -- in reality the truth of the matter was it was both of us because of me,\" Belichick said.\n\nBrady did have some fun at Belichick's expense though near the end of the show.\n\n\"I've been out of the game for a minute, so I'm curious, how many Super Bowl rings have you won since I left?,\" Brady said. \"Maybe it's not just the guy on the sideline. When I go to the Indy 500, I don't ask the winning driver, 'Hey, you gassed up your car?\" Hart said before the show that he thought Brady was in a great mindset going into the event. Brady did come in well prepared, going over his monologue with a group of people, including those at Fox Sports.\n\n\"You have to be able to laugh at yourself and I love what he is doing in this forum,'' Hart said. ''I love that he is embracing the things that some people think he runs away from. It is a celebration of greatness and we are doing it in a fun way.\" Bledsoe also said that Brady has had a sense of humor, but that this was a different stage.\n\n\"I thought he was very brave. There's plenty of material to make fun of him,'' Bledsoe said. ''The truth is when you're a professional athlete, roasting each other is kind of what we do every day in the locker room. And so, you better have thick skin going in. Now, people laugh along with it.\"\n\n(This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)", "source": {"uri": "devdiscourse.com", "dataType": "news", You run with a game plan, and then you get to see kind of how the strategy goes, and then you adjust on the fly,\" Brady said before the event. \"This is what a locker room has been like for me for all these years. So it's not like I'm used to people not making fun of me.\"\n\nComedian Nikki Glaser, whose monologue was among the funniest of the night, termed the roast as \"the comedians' Super Bowl\" and how the competition level was ramped up because everyone wanted to one-up each other.\n\nBrady sustained more blitzes and pressure than he did during an average NFL game as an impressive lineup of comedians, former teammates and opponents took the stage. Host Kevin Hart said before the event that no topic was off limits, and Hart went on the offensive early with jokes about Brady's ex-wife, Gisele B\u00fcndchen.\n\n\"Gisele gave you an ultimatum. She said you retire or we're done. When you got a chance to go 8-9 and all it will cost you is your wife and your kids, you've got to do what you've got to do,\" Hart said, referring to Brady coming out of a brief retirement in 2022 for one more season.\n\nThe only time Brady objected to a joke was when Jeff Ross made a reference to Patriots owner Robert Kraft and massages. In 2019, Kraft received a misdemeanor charge that he paid for sex at a Florida massage parlor.\n\nBrady walked up to Ross and said in his ear \"don't say that (stuff) again,\" but it was caught on the microphone.\n\nLater, Kraft and former Patriots coach Bill Belichick did a shot together on stage after some coaxing from Hart.\n\nBelichick left the Patriots in January after 24 seasons with the team, and there has been reported friction between the six-time winning Super Bowl coach and owner over the past couple years.\n\nAfter joking about this being like a reunion and \"unlike many family reunions there are some people I am desperately trying to avoid,\" Kraft praised Belichick for what the two accomplished.\n\n\"I want to say this is the greatest coach in the history of the game that did what no one else has done. And having Tom Brady and him was the greatest honor the good Lord gave me,\" Kraft said.\n\nIt wasn't the first shot (of alcohol) that Belichick took. Rob Gronkowski got Belichick and Brady to do a shot together after his monologue. Gronkowski celebrated by spiking his shot glass.\n\nEven Peyton Manning got in on the action, coming out late in the show and throwing some tight spirals at his longtime rival.\n\n\"Honesty, it is great to be here with a bunch of people sitting around talking smack about Tom Brady,\" Manning said. \"Or as we call that in the Manning family: Thanksgiving.\"\n\nBelichick appeared at the beginning of the roast during a pre-taped segment when he told Brady that he was \"starting the roast\" instead of Drew Bledsoe. Brady replaced Bledsoe in 2001 when Bledsoe was injured in a Week 2 game against the Jets and led the Patriots to their first Super Bowl title that season.\n\n\"I want to say this is the greatest coach in the history of the game that did what no one else has done. And having Tom Brady and him was the greatest honor the good Lord gave me.\"\n\n\"For all of you out there who think about who's responsible for the Patriots success during the time Tom and I was together -- was it Tom or me -- in reality the truth of the matter was it was both of us because of me,\" Belichick said.\n\nBrady did have some fun at Belichick's expense though near the end of the show.\n\n\"I've been out of the game for a minute, so I'm curious, how many Super Bowl rings have you won since I left?,\" Brady said. \"Maybe it's not just the guy on the sideline. When I go to the Indy 500, I don't ask the winning driver, 'Hey, you gassed up your car?;\"\n\nHart said before the show that he thought Brady was in a great mindset going into the event. Brady did come in well prepared, going over his monologue with a group of people, including those at Fox Sports.\n\n\"You have to be able to laugh at yourself and I love that he is doing in this forum,\" Hart said. \"I love that he is embracing the things that some people think he runs away from. It is a celebration of greatness and we are doing it in a fun way.\"\n\nBledsoe also said that Brady has had a sense of humor, but that this was a different stage.\n\n\"I thought he was very brave. There's plenty of material to make fun of him on,\" Bledsoe said. \"The truth is when you're a professional athlete, roasting each other is kind of what we do every day in the locker room. {"uri": "2024-05-346453125", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "12:10:44", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T12:10:44Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T04:39:35Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8196078538894653, "url": "https://tribtown.com/2024/05/06/tom-bradys-netflix-roast-features-lots-of-humor-reunion-between-robert-kraft-and-bill-belichick/", "title": "Tom Brady's Netflix roast features lots of humor, reunion between Robert Kraft and Bill Belichick", "body": "INGLEWOOD, Calif. (AP) -- Three months before Tom Brady gets roasted by critics as Fox Sports' top NFL analyst, he took his share of barbs from comedians, former teammates and his longtime coach Sunday night during a made-for-streaming comedy live event on Netflix.\n\nAnd it is safe to say after the one liners and jokes Brady heard during three hours of \"The Greatest Roast of All Time\" at The Forum, he will do just fine.\n\n\"It's like a football game. You run with a game plan, and then you get to see kind of how the strategy goes, and then you adjust on the fly,\" Brady said before the event. \"This is what a locker room has been like for me for all these years. So it's not like I'm used to people not making fun of me.\"\n\nComedian Nikki Glaser, whose monologue was among the funniest of the night, termed the roast as \"the comedians' Super Bowl\" and how the competition level was ramped up because everyone wanted to one-up each other.\n\nBrady sustained more blitzes and pressure than he did during an average NFL game as an impressive lineup of comedians, former teammates and opponents took the stage . Host Kevin Hart said before the event that no topic was off limits, and Hart went on the offensive early with jokes about Brady's ex-wife, Gisele B\u00fcndchen.\n\n\"Gisele gave you an ultimatum. She said you retire or we're done. When you got a chance to go 8-9 and all it will cost you is your wife and your kids, you've got to do what you've got to do,\" Hart said, referring to Brady coming out of a brief retirement in 2022 for one more season.\n\nThe only time Brady objected to a joke was when Jeff Ross made a reference to Patriots owner Robert Kraft and massages. In 2019, Kraft originally received a misdemeanor charge that he paid for sex at a Florida massage parlor. Prosecutors later dropped the charge after courts blocked the use of video from cameras installed by police inside the massage parlors.\n\nBrady walked up to Ross and said in his ear \"don't say that (stuff) again\", but it was clearly caught on the microphone and heard by those watching the roast at home. It was not heard by those in attendance.\n\nLater, Kraft and former Patriots coach Bill Belichick did a shot together on stage after some coaxing from Hart.\n\nBelichick was fired in January after 24 seasons with the Patriots, and a lot has been written about friction between the six-time winning Super Bowl coach and owner over the past couple years.\n\nAfter joking about this being like a reunion and \"unlike many family reunions there are some people I am desperately trying to avoid\", Kraft praised Belichick for what the two accomplished.\n\n\"I want to say this is the greatest coach in the history of the game that did what no one else has done. And having Tom Brady and him was the greatest honor the good Lord gave me,\" Kraft said.\n\nIt wasn't the first shot (of alcohol) that Belichick took. Rob Gronkowski got Belichick and Brady to do a shot together after his monologue. Gronkowski celebrated by spiking his shot glass.\n\nBelichick appeared at the beginning of the roast during a pre-taped segment when he told Brady that he was \"starting the roast\" instead of Drew Bledsoe. Brady replaced Bledsoe in 2001 when Bledsoe was injured in a Week 2 game against the Jets and led the Patriots to their first Super Bowl title that season.\n\n\"For all of you out there who think about who's responsible for the Patriots success during the time Tom and I was together -- was it Tom or me -- in reality the truth of the matter was it was both of us because of me,\" Belichick said.\n\nBrady did have some fun at Belichick's expense though near the end of the show.\n\n\"I've been out of the game for a minute, so I'm curious, how many Super Bowl rings have you won since I left?,\" Brady said. \"Maybe it's not just the guy on the sideline. When I go to the Indy 500, I don't ask the winning driver, 'Hey, you gassed up your car?;\"\n\nHart said before the show that he thought Brady was in a great mindset going into the event. Brady did come in well prepared, going over his monologue with a group of people, including those at Fox Sports.\n\n\"You have to be able to laugh at yourself and I love that he is doing in this forum,\" Hart said. \"I love that he is embracing the things that some people think he runs away from. It is a celebration of greatness and we are doing it in a fun way.\"\n\nBledsoe also said that Brady has had a sense of humor, but that this was a different stage.\n\n\"I thought he was very brave. There's plenty of material to make fun of him on,\" Bledsoe said. \"The truth is when you're a professional athlete, roasting each other is kind of what we do every day in the locker room. And so, you better have thick skin going in. Now, people get to laugh along with it.\"", "source": {"uri": "tribtown.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "The Tribune"}, "authors": [{"uri": "associated_press@tribtown.com", "name": "Associated {"uri": "8113733261", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "11:57:05", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T11:57:05Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T11:56:51Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8117647171020508, "url": "https://www.theguardian.com/sport/article/2024/may/06/jokes-about-massages-oj-and-gisele-divorce-fly-in-tom-brady-comedy-roast", "title": "Jokes about massages, OJ and Gisele divorce fly in Tom Brady comedy roast", "body": "Former teammates and comedians round on quarterbackBrady appears to object to joke after Robert Kraft\n\nTom Brady took his share of barbs from comedians, former teammates and his longtime coach on Sunday night during a comedy roast on Netflix.\n\n\"It's like a football game. You run with a game plan, and then you get to see kind of how the strategy goes, and then you adjust on the fly,\" Brady said before the three-hour event. \"This is what a locker room has been like for me for all these years. So it's not like I'm used to people not making fun of me.\"\n\nAn impressive lineup of comedians, former teammates and opponents took the stage. Host Kevin Hart said before the event that no topic was off limits, and Hart went on the offensive early with jokes about Brady's ex-wife, Gisele B\u00fcndchen.\n\n\"Gisele gave you an ultimatum. She said you retire or we're done. When you got a chance to go 8-9 and all it will cost you is your wife and your kids, you've got to do what you've got to do,\" Hart said, referring to Brady coming out of a brief retirement in 2022 for one more season.\n\nThe only time Brady objected to a joke was when Jeff Ross made a reference to Patriots owner Robert Kraft and massages. In 2019, Kraft originally received a misdemeanor charge that he paid for sex at a Florida massage parlor. Prosecutors later dropped the charge after courts blocked the use of video from cameras installed by police inside the massage parlors.\n\nIn the sketch, Ross joked about Kraft offering Brady a massage when he first joined the Patriots. On Sunday, Brady walked up to Ross and said in his ear \"don't say that shit again\", but it was clearly caught on the microphone and heard by those watching the roast at home. It was not heard by those in attendance.\n\nLater, Kraft and former Patriots coach Bill Belichick did a shot together on stage after some coaxing from Hart.\n\nBelichick was fired in January after 24 seasons with the Patriots, and a lot has been written about friction between the six-time winning Super Bowl coach and owner over the past couple years.\n\nAfter joking about this being like a reunion and \"unlike many family reunions there are some people I am desperately trying to avoid\", Kraft praised Belichick for what the two accomplished.\n\n\"I want to say this is the greatest coach in the history of the game that did what no one else has done. And having Tom Brady and him was the greatest honor the good Lord gave me,\" Kraft said.\n\nRob Gronkowski got Belichick and Brady to do a shot together after his monologue. Gronkowski celebrated by spiking his glass.\n\nBelichick appeared at the beginning of the roast during a pre-taped segment when he told Brady that he was \"starting the roast\" instead of Drew Bledsoe. Brady replaced Bledsoe in 2001 when Bledsoe was injured against the Jets and led the Patriots to their first Super Bowl title that season.\n\n\"For all of you out there who think about who's responsible for the Patriots success during the time Tom and I was together - was it Tom or me - in reality the truth of the matter was it was both of us because of me,\" Belichick said.\n\nBelichick also took a jab at Gronkowski. \"A lot people connect me with the saying 'Do Your Job' and some people do their job. Gronk, I've been watching you on Fox NFL Sunday, and I'm begging you, please, stop doing your job,\" Belichick said.\n\nBrady did have some fun at Belichick's expense though near the end of the show.\n\n\"I've been out of the game for a minute, so I'm curious, how many Super Bowl rings have you won since I left?,\" Brady said. \"Maybe it's not just the guy on the sideline. When I go to the Indy 500, I don't ask the winning driver, 'Hey, you gassed up your car?'\"\n\nBledsoe was given his own line to jab at his successor, with another reference to Brady's divorce.\n\n\"Look, buddy, you have more rings than I do,\" Bledsoe said. \"But I've experienced a couple of things that you will never experience: The feeling of being the No 1 overall draft pick in the NFL and a 28th wedding anniversary. It was yesterday.\"\n\nBrady countered with a joke that touched one of the most painful moments in US history.\n\n\"Like the rest of America, I will always remember where I was that fateful day in September 2001 when, tragically, those two Jets slammed into Drew Bledsoe,\" Brady said.\n\nBrady came in well prepared, going over his monologue with a group of people, including those at Fox Sports, where he will take up a role as a pundit. He referenced OJ Simpson, who died last month, as he took aim at his long-time rival Peyton Manning, who ended his career with the Denver Broncos.\n\n\"When I heard there was a slow, white Bronco heading down the 405 to come here tonight, I thought we might actually see a real football legend,\" Brady said.\n\nHart said he thought Brady had performed well.\n\n\"You have to be able to laugh at yourself and I love that he is doing in this forum,\" Hart said. \"I love that he is embracing the things that some people think he runs away from. It is a celebration of greatness and we are doing it in a fun way.\"\n\nBledsoe also said that Brady has had a sense of humor, but that this was a different stage.\n\n\"I thought he was very brave. There's plenty of material to make fun of him on,\" Bledsoe said. \"The truth is when you're a professional athlete, roasting each other is kind of what we do every day in the locker room. And so, you better have thick skin going in. Now, people get to laugh along with it.\"", "source": {"uri": "theguardian.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "The Guardian"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": {"uri": "2024-05-346525141", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "13:16:50", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T13:16:50Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T12:56:00Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7921568751335144, "url": "https://www.wmur.com/article/tom-brady-netflix-roast/60699575", "title": "Tom Brady's Netflix roast features lots of laughs, reunion between Kraft, Belichick", "body": "Three months before Tom Brady gets roasted by critics as Fox Sports' top NFL analyst, he took his share of barbs from comedians, former teammates and his longtime coach Sunday night during a made-for-streaming comedy live event on Netflix.And it is safe to say after the one liners and jokes Brady heard during three hours of \"The Greatest Roast of All Time\" at The Forum, he will do just fine.\"It's like a football game. You run with a game plan, and then you get to see kind of how the strategy goes, and then you adjust on the fly,\" Brady said before the event. \"This is what a locker room has been like for me for all these years. So it's not like I'm used to people not making fun of me.\"Comedian Nikki Glaser, whose monologue was among the funniest of the night, termed the roast as \"the comedians' Super Bowl\" and how the competition level was ramped up because everyone wanted to one-up each other.Brady sustained more blitzes and pressure than he did during an average NFL game as an impressive lineup of comedians, former teammates and opponents took the stage . Host Kevin Hart said before the event that no topic was off limits, and Hart went on the offensive early with jokes about Brady's ex-wife, Gisele B\u00fcndchen.\"Gisele gave you an ultimatum. She said you retire or we're done. When you got a chance to go 8-9 and all it will cost you is your wife and your kids, you've got to do what you've got to do,\" Hart said, referring to Brady coming out of a brief retirement in 2022 for one more season.The only time Brady objected to a joke was when Jeff Ross made a reference to Patriots owner Robert Kraft and massages. In 2019, Kraft originally received a misdemeanor charge that he paid for sex at a Florida massage parlor. Prosecutors later dropped the charge after courts blocked the use of video from cameras installed by police inside the massage parlors.Brady walked up to Ross and said in his ear \"don't say that (stuff) again\", but it was clearly caught on the microphone and heard by those watching the roast at home. It was not heard by those in attendance.Later, Kraft and former Patriots coach Bill Belichick did a shot together on stage after some coaxing from Hart.Belichick and the team parted ways in January after 24 seasons, and a lot has been written about friction between the six-time winning Super Bowl coach and owner over the past couple years.After joking about this being like a reunion and \"unlike many family reunions there are some people I am desperately trying to avoid,\" Kraft praised Belichick for what the two accomplished.\"I want to say this is the greatest coach in the history of the game that did what no one else has done. And having Tom Brady and him was the greatest honor the good Lord gave me,\" Kraft said.It wasn't the first shot (of alcohol) that Belichick took. Rob Gronkowski got Belichick and Brady to do a shot together after his monologue. Gronkowski celebrated by spiking his shot glass.Belichick appeared at the beginning of the roast during a pre-taped segment when he told Brady that he was \"starting the roast\" instead of Drew Bledsoe. Brady replaced Bledsoe in 2001 when Bledsoe was injured in a Week 2 game against the Jets and led the Patriots to their first Super Bowl title that season.\"For all of you out there who think about who's responsible for the Patriots success during the time Tom and I was together -- was it Tom or me -- in reality the truth of the matter was it was both of us because of me,\" Belichick said.Brady did have some fun at Belichick's expense though near the end of the show.\"I've been out of the game for a minute, so I'm curious, how many Super Bowl rings have you won since I left?,\" Brady said. \"Maybe it's not just the guy on the sideline. When I go to the Indy 500, I don't ask the winning driver, 'Hey, you gassed up your car?\"Hart said before the show that he thought Brady was in a great mindset going into the event. Brady did come in well-prepared, going over his monologue with a group of people, including those at Fox Sports.\"You have to be able to laugh at yourself and I love that he is doing in this forum,\" Hart said. \"I love that he is embracing the things that some people think he runs away from. It is a celebration of greatness and we are doing it in a fun way.\"Bledsoe also said that Brady has had a sense of humor, but that this was a different stage.\"I thought he was very brave. There's plenty of material to make fun of him on,\" Bledsoe said. \"The truth is when you're a professional athlete, roasting each other is kind of what we do every day in the locker room. And so, you better have thick skin going in. Now, people get to laugh along with it.\"\n\nThree months before Tom Brady gets roasted by critics as Fox Sports' top NFL analyst, he took his share of barbs from comedians, former teammates and his longtime coach Sunday night during a made-for-streaming comedy live event on Netflix.\n\nAnd it is safe to say after the one liners and jokes Brady heard during three hours of \"The Greatest Roast of All Time\" at The Forum, he will do just fine.\n\n\"It's like a football game. You run with a game plan, and then you get to see kind of how the strategy goes, and then you adjust on the fly,\" Brady said before the event. \"This is what a locker room has been like for me for all these years. So it's not like I'm used to people not making fun of me.\"\n\nComedian Nikki Glaser, whose monologue was among the funniest of the night, termed the roast as \"the comedians' Super Bowl\" and how the competition level was ramped up because everyone wanted to one-up each other.\n\nBrady sustained more blitzes and pressure than he did during an average NFL game as an impressive lineup of comedians, former teammates and opponents took the stage . Host Kevin Hart said before the event that no topic was off limits, and Hart went on the offensive early with jokes about Brady's ex-wife, Gisele B\u00fcndchen.\n\n\"Gisele gave you an ultimatum. She said you retire or we're done. When you got a chance to go 8-9 and all it will cost you is your wife and your kids, you've got to do what you've got to do,\" Hart said, referring to Brady coming out of a brief retirement in 2022 for one more season.\n\nThe only time Brady objected to a joke was when Jeff Ross made a reference to Patriots owner Robert Kraft and massages. In 2019, Kraft originally received a misdemeanor charge that he paid for sex at a Florida massage parlor. Prosecutors later dropped the charge after courts blocked the use of video from cameras installed by police inside the massage parlors.\n\nBrady walked up to Ross and said in his ear \"don't say that (stuff) again\", but it was clearly caught on the microphone and heard by those watching the roast at home. It was not heard by those in attendance.\n\nLater, Kraft and former Patriots coach Bill Belichick did a shot together on stage after some coaxing from Hart.\n\nBelichick and the team parted ways in January after 24 seasons, and a lot has been written about friction between the six-time winning Super Bowl coach and owner over the past couple years.\n\nAfter joking about this being like a reunion and \"unlike many family reunions there are some people I am desperately trying to avoid,\" Kraft praised Belichick for what the two accomplished.\n\n\"I want to say this is the greatest coach in the history of the game that did what no one else has done. And having Tom Brady and him was the greatest honor the good Lord gave me,\" Kraft said.\n\nIt wasn't the first shot (of alcohol) that Belichick took. Rob Gronkowski got Belichick and Brady to do a shot together after his monologue. Gronkowski celebrated by spiking his shot glass.\n\nBelichick appeared at the beginning of the roast during a pre-taped segment when he told Brady that he was \"starting the roast\" instead of Drew Bledsoe. Brady replaced Bledsoe in 2001 when Bledsoe was injured in a Week 2 game against the Jets and led the Patriots to their first Super Bowl title that season.\n\n\"For all of you out there who think about who's responsible for the Patriots success during the time Tom and I was together -- was it Tom or me -- in reality the truth of the matter was it was both of us because of me,\" Belichick said.\n\nBrady did have some fun at Belichick's expense though near the end of the show.\n\n\"I've been out of the game for a minute, so I'm curious, how many Super Bowl rings have you won since I left?,\" Brady said. \"Maybe it's not just the guy on the sideline. When I go to the Indy 500, I don't ask the winning driver, 'Hey, you gassed up your car?\"\n\nHart said before the show that he thought Brady was in a great mindset going into the event. Brady did come in well-prepared, going over his monologue with a group of people, including those at Fox Sports.\n\n\"You have to be able to laugh at yourself and I love that he is doing in this forum,\" Hart said. \"I love that he is embracing the things that some people think he runs away from. It is a celebration of greatness and we are doing it in a fun way.\"\n\nBledsoe also said that Brady has had a sense of humor, but that this was a different stage.\n\n\"I thought he was very brave. There's plenty of material to make fun of him on,\" Bledsoe said. \"The truth is when you're a professional athlete, roasting each other is kind of what we do every day in the locker room. And so, you better have thick skin going in. Now, people get to laugh along with it.\"", "source": {"uri": "wmur.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "WMUR9"}, "authors": [{"uri": "associated_press@wmur.com", "name": "Associated Press", "type": {"uri": "2024-05-346160476", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "07:48:24", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T07:48:24Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T03:45:07Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7882353067398071, "url": "https://www.profootballnetwork.com/best-of-the-roast-of-tom-brady/", "title": "Best of The Roast of Tom Brady: Most Hilarious Moments Include Legendary QB Admitting to 'Deflategate'", "body": "Netflix's 'The Greatest Roast of All Time' was a chance for celebrities to say whatever they wanted to about Tom Brady. What were the most hilarious moments?\n\nAfter torturing opposing fans on Sundays for over two decades, former New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady was finally on the receiving end of some torture on Sunday night. Brady was the target of Netflix's live special, 'The Greatest Roast of All Time.'\n\nThe night started off with a hilarious moment, as former Patriots head coach Bill Belichick informed Drew Bledsoe that it wasn't his night, since he was essentially being benched for Brady once again. That kicked off what would turn out to be an R-rated night, as there was arguably as much profanity thrown about as there were jokes.\n\nHowever, Brady might have immediately regretted his decision to volunteer as the target of Netflix's live roast.\n\nMost Hilarious Moments From The Roast of Tom Brady\n\nBrady was roasted by several comedians, former teammates, and other famous celebrities. Will Ferrell turned back the clocks and appeared as Ron Burgundy from 'Anchorman' to remind Brady that he lost twice to former New York Giants quarterback Eli Manning.\n\nEven Kim Kardashian made an appearance for Brady's roast. Kardashian hurled several jokes at Brady, and most notable was her refusal to defend Brady from the other's jokes.\n\nKardashian hilariously cited her own family's history of defending former football players, in a call back to her father, Robert Kardashian's, defense of O.J. Simpson.\n\nOne of Brady's biggest rivals during his playing career was former Indianapolis Colts quarterback Peyton Manning. While they traded touchdowns on the field, the legendary quarterback rivals traded jokes on Sunday night.\n\nManning took the stage to once again remind Brady how he lost twice in the Super Bowl to Peyton's brother, Eli. Peyton threw several jabs at Brady, including a hilarious reference to what his own children now call their trips to the bathroom.\n\nPeyton finished his segment by introducing Brady to the stage, announcing him as a \"three-time Super Bowl loser.\"\n\nBill Belichick Steals the Show\n\nBefore Brady took the stage to close out the event, his former head coach stole the show. Despite being notably stoic during press conferences, Belichick let loose while roasting Brady and several of his former players in New England.\n\nBelichick seemed to focus more on other former Patriots players, most notably legendary tight end Rob Gronkowski. The greatest head coach in the history of the NFL was relentless with his jokes targeting Gronkowski.\n\nHe mentioned how he has watched Gronkowski on 'Fox NFL Sunday' and hilariously begged him to \"stop doing your job.\" That naturally goes directly against Belichick's famous team slogan of \"do your job\" in New England.\n\nPatriots owner Robert Kraft also held the microphone on Sunday night, cracking a few jokes and eventually praising Brady. It was refreshing to see Brady, Belichick, and Kraft all together on Sunday night, considering the amount of chaos surrounding the franchise since the trio went their separate ways.\n\nOnce Kraft wrapped up his speech, he was asked by Hart to share a toast with Belichick. At first, it seemed like the moment wasn't going to actually happen. Yet Kraft and Belichick put their reported differences aside and cheered together on stage.\n\nIt was a shocking moment to witness, given reports that Kraft potentially blocked Belichick from landing another head coaching job in the NFL this offseason. While we may never know what truly happened, Kraft and Belichick may have stolen the show on Sunday night.\n\nYet Brady wasn't going to go down without a fight. In typical fashion, he didn't let the opposition win, seemingly mounted a late-game comeback with a hilarious barrage of his own jokes and firing back at all of his critics to close out the show.\n\nBrady Pulls Off Another Comeback, 'Admits' to Deflategate\n\nBrady quickly recovered once he finally took the stage. He fired back at nearly everyone who roasted him throughout the event, including Peyton, who he quickly reminded will always live in Brady's shadow.\n\n\"I know sometimes you live in Denver, and sometimes you live in Louisiana,\" Brady said. \"But you will always live in my shadow.\"\n\nAfter hitting Peyton with a few more jokes, Brady shifted topics and asked where NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell was. Brady was bashed several times during the roast about his controversial involvement in the 'Deflategate' controversy.\n\nYet Brady joked about the NFL's costly investigation, even stating that they could have paid him $20 million and he would have admitted to deflating footballs.\n\nWhile we'll never likely know how serious Brady was about admitting to these allegations, it was a hilarious response. After being on the receiving end of several jokes throughout the night, Brady bounced back in the typical fashion that we've all become far too familiar with over the last two decades.\n\nIt wouldn't be an event involving Brady if it didn't include an impressive comeback. While Brady took most of the jokes on Sunday night in stride, he did seem to take offense to a shot from comedian Jeff Ross.\n\nDespite all of that, Brady stole back the show with his final words. Netflix's live special was an overall success filled with memorable moments.\n\nHowever, after seeing the jokes that Brady was targeted with, it will be interesting to see who the next volunteer for Here's what Tom Brady couldn't handle during his Netflix roast", "body": "No Brady Rule. No Pads. No Mercy. \"The Greatest Roast of All Time: The Roast of Tom Brady\" airs on Netflix in May.\n\nThe roast of Tom Brady happened Sunday night and it was as funny, offensive and foul as many of us expected. It was a roast. This is what happens. They are not for the easily offended.\n\nBut out of all the moments from the night, from all of the tawdry jokes and one liners, there was one moment that was extremely telling. It said a lot about the relationship between Brady and someone he's extremely close to: Patriots owner Robert Kraft.\n\n\"The Greatest Roast of All Time: The Roast of Tom Brady\" was part of the annual \"Netflix is a Joke\" festival. It aired live on the site and as someone who is a roast geek, it was one of the better ones you'll see. Everyone caught strays. Poor Rob Gronkowski was absolutely brutalized.\n\nThere were a number of former Brady teammates, coaches and others in attendance including Bill Belichick, Peyton Manning, Randy Moss, Drew Bledsoe, Julian Edelman, Rodney Harrison, Willie McGinest, Matt Light and Nate Solder.\n\nOut of all the moments in the show it was one involving Kraft that was the most interesting.\n\nComedian Jeff Ross would be on the Mount Rushmore of offensive roast comedians. At roasts in general, no one is untouchable. To Ross, the more uncomfortable he makes people, the better. He started off one of his jokes by telling the story of how Brady, at the time a rookie, and a sixth-round pick, had the audacity to tell Kraft that drafting him was the best decision the organization had ever made.\n\nRoss then joked that Brady added, \"Would you like a massage?\"\n\nOh. Man.\n\nThe joke was referring to Kraft's 2019 arrest for soliciting prostitution at a massage parlor - charges that were dropped in 2020.\n\nAfter the joke, Brady immediately stood, approached Ross at the lectern, and said, \"Don't say that (expletive) again.\" His remark was caught on the microphone and could clearly be heard by the home audience.\n\nIt's possible this was part of the act and Brady was acting. Maybe that will be what Brady says at some point. But it didn't seem that way. It looked like Brady wasn't joking. He seemed deadly serious.\n\nRoss then said, \"OK, OK.\" Ross next pointed to Kraft in the audience: \"He's having fun, look at him.\"\n\nBrady looked unmoved.\n\nThere's a simple reason why Brady was irritated. While Brady and Belichick's relationship has been at times frayed, Brady and Kraft have been close for decades. They have remained good friends and that description might be understating the true nature of how close they are.\n\nAs the Patriots won Super Bowls, and then fractured, Brady and Kraft stayed close. At every opportunity, Kraft has publicly supported Brady, and recently, Brady did the same. Last year, when Kraft was up for the Hall of Fame, Brady publicly jumped in to support him.\n\n\"In my mind, this is a no-brainer,\" Brady said of Kraft's candidacy. \"I want this bad for him because he deserves it.\"\n\n\"When it comes to the league, nobody, in my opinion, has contributed - since I've been in the league - the way he has,\" Brady said. \"As an owner on all the important committees, he successfully navigated multiple labor agreements. I know in the 2011 agreement, he was instrumental in the success of it.\n\n\"I remember that picture of him and Jeff Saturday, with their arms around each other, bringing everyone back to football, which was great. You can care about that on a team level, but you can also look at that from a league level.\"\n\nTo Brady, you don't mess with Kraft. You can take all the shots you want at Belichick or Gronk. Jokes were made about Aaron Hernandez being a murderer and a bevy of a number of other tasteless quips.\n\nBrady even made fun of himself.\n\n\"The NFL spent $20 million and found it was 'more probable than not' that I was 'generally aware' that someone may have deflated my footballs,\" Brady said. \"You could have just given me the $20 million and I would just told you I (expletive) did it.\"\n\nMost of the jokes on the night were funny and inappropriate and even terrible. To Brady, all these were legit. {"uri": "8113570998", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "10:09:55", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T10:09:55Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T10:09:33Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7843137383460999, "url": "https://toronto.citynews.ca/2024/05/06/tom-brady-roast-netflix-special/", "title": "Tom Brady's roast features lots of humour, reunion between Kraft and Belichick", "body": "INGLEWOOD, Calif. -- Three months before Tom Brady gets roasted by critics as Fox Sports' top NFL analyst, he took his share of barbs from comedians, former teammates and his longtime coach Sunday night during a made-for-streaming comedy live event on Netflix.\n\nAnd it is safe to say after the one liners and jokes Brady heard during three hours of \"The Greatest Roast of All Time\" at The Forum, he will do just fine.\n\n\"It's like a football game. You run with a game plan, and then you get to see kind of how the strategy goes, and then you adjust on the fly,\" Brady said before the event. \"This is what a locker room has been like for me for all these years. So it's not like I'm used to people not making fun of me.\"\n\nComedian Nikki Glaser, whose monologue was among the funniest of the night, termed the roast as \"the comedians' Super Bowl\" and how the competition level was ramped up because everyone wanted to one-up each other.\n\nBrady sustained more blitzes and pressure than he did during an average NFL game as an impressive lineup of comedians, former teammates and opponents took the stage. Host Kevin Hart said before the event that no topic was off limits, and Hart went on the offensive early with jokes about Brady's ex-wife, Gisele B\u00fcndchen.\n\n\"Gisele gave you an ultimatum. She said you retire or we're done. When you got a chance to go 8-9 and all it will cost you is your wife and your kids, you've got to do what you've got to do,\" Hart said, referring to Brady coming out of a brief retirement in 2022 for one more season.\n\nThe night also featured Patriots owner Robert Kraft and former Patriots coach Bill Belichick doing a shot together on stage after some coaxing from Hart.\n\nBelichick was fired in January after 24 seasons with the Patriots, and a lot has been written about friction between the six-time winning Super Bowl coach and owner over the past couple years.\n\nAfter joking about this being like a reunion and \"unlike many family reunions there are some people I am desperately trying to avoid,\" Kraft praised Belichick for what the two accomplished.\n\n\"I want to say this is the greatest coach in the history of the game that did what no one else has done. And having Tom Brady and him was the greatest honour the good Lord gave me,\" Kraft said.\n\nIt wasn't the first shot (of alcohol) that Belichick took. Rob Gronkowski got Belichick and Brady to do a shot together after his monologue. Gronkowski celebrated by spiking his shot glass.\n\nBelichick appeared at the beginning of the roast during a pre-taped segment when he told Brady that he was \"starting the roast\" instead of Drew Bledsoe. Brady replaced Bledsoe in 2001 when Bledsoe was injured in a Week 2 game against the Jets and led the Patriots to their first Super Bowl title that season.\n\n\"For all of you out there who think about who's responsible for the Patriots success during the time Tom and I was together -- was it Tom or me -- in reality the truth of the matter was it was both of us because of me,\" Belichick said.\n\nBrady did have some fun at Belichick's expense though near the end of the show.\n\n\"I've been out of the game for a minute, so I'm curious, how many Super Bowl rings have you won since I left?,\" Brady said. \"Maybe it's not just the guy on the sideline. When I go to the Indy 500, I don't ask the winning driver, 'Hey, you gassed up your car?;\"\n\nHart said before the show that he thought Brady was in a great mindset going into the event. Brady did come in well prepared, going over his monologue with a group of people, including those at Fox Sports.\n\n\"You have to be able to laugh at yourself and I love that he is doing in this forum,\" Hart said. \"I love that he is embracing the things that some people think he runs away from. It is a celebration of greatness and we are doing it in a fun way.\"\n\nBledsoe also said that Brady has had a sense of humour, but that this was a different stage.\n\n\"I thought he was very brave. There's plenty of material to make fun of him on,\" Bledsoe said. \"The truth is when you're a professional athlete, roasting each other is kind of what we do every day in the locker room. And so, you better have thick skin going in. Now, people get to laugh along with it.\"", "source": {"uri": "toronto.citynews.ca", "dataType": "news", "title": "CityNews Toronto"}, "authors": [{"uri": "lucas_casaletto@toronto.citynews.ca", {"uri": "8113047696", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "03:02:20", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T03:02:20Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T03:01:54Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7764706015586853, "url": "https://www.nbcboston.com/news/local/stars-turn-out-to-roast-tom-brady-in-netflix-special-bill-belichick-steals-the-show/3360132/", "title": "Stars turn out to roast Tom Brady in Netflix special, Bill Belichick steals the show", "body": "More than four years after Tom Brady parted ways with Bill Belichick and the New England Patriots, the legendary quarterback-head coach duo reunited for the Greatest Roast of All Time.\n\nThe star-studded roast of Brady hosted by Kevin Hart did not disappoint Sunday night.\n\nThere were the expected jokes about Brady's ex-wife Gisele B\u00fcndchen, and how much money he lost in cryptocurrency, but the real surprise was that Belichick stole the show, absolutely crushing it with his jokes -- not only about Brady, but about Rob Gronkowski, and Danny Amendola and the recent Apple TV+ documentary The Dynasty.\n\nIt had been reported in recent days that Belichick would be one of the roasters, but it was still a surprise to see the normally gruff, former head coach who had well-documented differences with Brady at the end of their time together, poke fun at his former QB.\n\nBelichick was introduced by none other than Will Ferrell in character as Ron Burgundy. The former head coach, notorious for his interaction with the media, took the stage to thunderous applause and wasted no time taking his first crack, saying Burgundy is the only member of the media he respects.\n\nBelichick then took aim at the recent documentary on the Patriots dynasty that criticized him heavily, painting him as somewhat of the villain in the downfall of Pats historic run.\n\n\"I'm so honored to be here for the roast of Tom Brady on Netflix. It's not to be confused with the roast of Bill Belichick on the 10-part Apple TV series,\" Belichick quipped.\n\nHe went on to allude to how he was perceived to be hard on Brady, saying, \"A lot of mean things being said about Tom tonight. Wonder why they invited me?\"\n\n\"Really Tom, why are all these people so hard on you? Do you miss me?\"\n\nHe turned his attention toward Gronkowski next. Belichick, who became associated with the \"Do your job\" mantra, said to the former tight end, \"Gronk I've been watching you on Fox NFL Sunday and I'm begging you, please, stop doing your job.\"\n\nOthers to take the stage included Ben Affleck, Nikki Glaser, Edelman, Jeff Ross and Kim Kardashian.\n\nThe reality TV star delivered a few jokes after being welcomed to the stage with audible boos from the crowd. She playfully mocked dating rumors involving her and Brady.\n\nThere were some crude jokes, as well, including from Glaser about B\u00fcndchen's new boyfriend.\n\nOne joke from Ross about Robert Kraft's massage parlor controversy seemed to trigger Brady.\n\n\"So Tom became a Patriot and moved up to New England, and on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said, 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made. Would you like a massage?'\" Ross joked.\n\n\"I love Robert Kraft, I....,\" Ross started to say before Brady approached him and said in his ear, \"Never say that sh** again.\"\n\nRoss pointed out that Kraft was \"having fun\" during the roast.\n\nLater, Kraft was back on stage for some brief comments and a joke or two, saying to Brady, \"Tom, good luck buying the Raiders. They did your favorite thing already -- they got rid of Jimmy Garoppolo.\"\n\nHart then invited Kraft and Belichick to the stage to take a shot together because they're \"so far apart\" -- and yes, it was as awkward as it sounds.\n\n\"Bill, Bill, this is a big moment, Bill,\" Hart said as he encouraged Belichick to meet Kraft on stage.\n\nAs he made his way there, Kraft interrupted to say, \"I want to say this is the greatest coach in the history of the game that did what no one else has done, and having Tom Brady and him was the greatest honor the good Lord game me, so cheers.\"\n\nBelichick for his part seemed to have a somewhat pained smile plastered on his face, with no affection shown towards his former employer as they downed their shots.", "source": {"uri": "nbcboston.com", "eventUri": "eng-9541551", "location": null, "extractedDates": null, "sentiment": 0.08235294117647052, "wgt": 198, "relevance": 1}
{"uri": "8114469512", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "21:28:34", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T21:28:34Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T21:27:28Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7764706015586853, "url": "https://gazette.com/ap/sports/heres-the-joke-that-crossed-the-line-for-tom-brady-during-his-netflix-roast/article_0083ace9-bdd2-5951-8753-a5397163e363.html", "title": "Here's the joke that crossed the line for Tom Brady during his Netflix roast", "body": "Tom Brady was a great sport Sunday night.\n\nHe endured jokes about his divorce, his business decisions, his love life, his multiple retirements, his former teammates, his ex-wife, his healthy lifestyle and much more -- all with a smile on his face.\n\nAnd that was just in the first 20 minutes of \" The Roast of Tom Brady \" at the Kia Forum that was streamed live on Netflix.\n\nOne gag, however, apparently crossed the line as far as Brady was concerned -- and the seven-time Super Bowl champion wasn't even the butt of that particular joke. The target was New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft, the man who signed Brady's paychecks for the first 20 years of his 23-year NFL career.\n\nAfter host Kevin Hart opened the show with a blistering monologue -- \"Why didn't we go to the Crypto.com Arena downtown? Well, the reason why we didn't go there is because we didn't want to remind Tom's fans of how much money he owes them \" -- comedian and celebrity roast staple Jeff Ross kept the hits coming. He talked about how Brady was drafted in the sixth round with the 199th pick of the 2000 NFL draft \"when Bill Belichick 's dog stepped on the keyboard by accident.\"\n\n\"So Tom became a Patriot,\" Ross said, \"moved up to New England and on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said, 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made. Would you like a massage?'\"\n\nThe joke was a reference to Kraft being arrested in 2019 on charges of soliciting sex from a prostitute during an encounter at a Florida day spa. Kraft pleaded not guilty, and the charges were dropped the following year after his lawyers prevented video and audio footage from being used as evidence in court.\n\nAs the crowd laughed and Ross blew a kiss in Kraft's direction, Brady could be seen shifting in his seat behind and to the right of the comedian. The camera cut to a close shot of Ross, who said \"I love Robert Kraft.\"\n\nBrady then approached Ross. The NFL's all-time leader in passing yards and touchdown passes had a bit of a smile on his face, but his tone was dead serious when he leaned in and said to Ross, \" Don't say that s -- again.\"\n\nAs Brady returned to his seat, Ross laughed, put his hands up and said, \"OK, OK!\" He pointed in Kraft's direction and said, \"He's having fun, look at him.\" As Ross added some sincere words of praise for Kraft, the Patriots owner was shown smiling in the crowd.\n\nBrady didn't appear to hold a grudge and could be seen laughing during the rest of Ross' set. The two men embraced and spoke after Ross' performance -- a scene Hart mocked by implying Ross was kissing up to the GOAT. \"I heard you over there,\" Hart said. \"'Tom, you all right? Yeah? Your hair's so straight.'\"\n\nBrady absorbed many more barbs throughout the evening without feeling the need to step in again.\n\nMany others came out to take their best shots at Brady and often one another.\n\nKim Kardashian recovered from being booed for about 15 seconds upon taking the podium to receiving big laughs and applause for some of her quips.\n\nFeatured Local Savings\n\n\"Honestly, it's hard for me to watch people roast you, but I think enough of my family members have helped defend former football players,\" said the daughter of Robert Kardashian, who was a member of O.J. Simpson's legal team during the former USC and NFL star's murder trial in the 1990s.\n\nShe also got a big laugh from Brady when she told him, \"I think it's so great the way you're showing everyone that even after winning seven Super Bowls, you can still have a midlife crisis.\"\n\nBelichick and several of Brady's former teammates -- including Rob Gronkowski, Julian Edelman, Randy Moss and Drew Bledsoe, whom Brady famously replaced at the Patriots' starting quarterback in 2001 -- all had their turns at the podium, as did his former on-field rival Peyton Manning.\n\n\"Honestly, it is great to be here with a bunch of people sitting around talking smack about Tom Brady,\" Manning said. \"Or as we call that in the Manning family: Thanksgiving.\"\n\nPeyton's brother Eli Manning, who led the New York Giants to two Super Bowl wins over Brady and the Patriots, was not present for the show but offered a jab of his own on X the next morning.\n\n\"I thought about attending the Roast of Tom Brady last night,\" Manning wrote, \"but I did not want to Roast him for a 3rd time!!\"\n\nOthers who joined in the roast Sunday included stand-up comic Nikki Glaser, UFC president Dana White and actor Will Ferrell in character as Ron Burgundy from the \" Anchorman \" movies.\n\nAs is custom at these events, Brady got his chance at the podium -- and he didn't hold back. He said to Belichick, \"I've been out of the game for a minute, so I'm curious, how many Super Bowl rings have you won since I left? Maybe it's not just the guy on the sideline. When I go to the Indy 500, I don't ask the winning driver, 'Hey, who gassed up your car?'\"\n\nHe even (jokingly) admitted to Deflategate. \"The NFL spent $20 million and found that it was 'more probable than not' that I was 'generally aware' that someone may have deflated my footballs. You should've just given me the 20 million and I would've told you I f -- did it.\"\n\nBrady was also one of several speakers who made jokes at the expense of Aaron Hernandez, the former Patriots tight end who hanged himself in a prison cell in 2017 while serving a life sentence for first-degree murder. Hernandez, whose death was ruled a suicide, was later determined to have had CTE and early brain atrophy.\n\nTMZ reports that Hernandez's former fiance, Shayanna Jenkins Hernandez, the mother of their now 11-year-old daughter, thinks those jokes went too far.\n\n\"It's sad that I'm trying to raise my children in such a cruel world,\" she told the website.\n\n\u00a92024 Los Angeles Times. Visit at latimes.com. {"uri": "8113951239", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "14:19:18", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T14:19:18Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T14:18:53Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.772549033164978, "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/jeff-ross-drew-bledsoe-nikki-132636134.html", "title": "What Jeff Ross, Drew Bledsoe, Nikki Glaser and more said during Tom Brady roast on Netflix", "body": "Deemed at \"The Greatest Roast of All Time,\" the roast of former New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady. took place live on Sunday night at 8 p.m., airing on Netflix. It was hosted by comedian Kevin Hart.\n\nIt was a night filled with comedians and other celebrities spewing filthy insults at the Kia Forum in Los Angeles, and the brunt of the the joke was Brady.\n\nFor more than three hours, different comics took turns taking shots - some of them cheap at - Brady, while the all-time quarterback sat there and took it in good humor.\n\nThat is, until the end of the night, when Brady was allowed to fire back for a few minutes, and that's exactly what he did - and he proceeded to speak words you most likely have never heard Brady utter.\n\nThe roasters, which has not been released prior to airing, included:\n\nThere was only one joke that drew a rise out of Brady.\n\nRoss made a joke about Kraft and massage parlors.\n\n\"Tom became a Patriot, moved up to New England, and on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said, 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made.' Would you like a massage?\" Ross said.\n\nAfter that joke, Brady stood up and told Ross that during his monologue, \"don't say that (expletive) again.\"\n\nIt seemed to be the only joke that Brady didn't like.\n\nIf you have a Netflix account, you can still see the roast on that streaming service.\n\nHow to watch: 'The Greatest Roast of All Time': Tom Brady will be roasted live on Netflix.\n\nHere are some of the best one-liners from the three hour roast.\n\nBrady was drafted to the New England Patriots by Belichick in 2000. He was the 199th pick in the 2000 draft, being taken late in the sixth round of that draft.\n\nBrady played 23 seasons in the NFL, winning seven Super Bowls. He won six of those with the New England Patriots and one of them with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.\n\nBrady has the most Super Bowl appearances than any other quarterback in history, with 10 trips to the big game. {"uri": "8113065637", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "03:22:22", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T03:22:22Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T03:21:51Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.772549033164978, "url": "https://sports.yahoo.com/tom-brady-roast-top-highlights-from-the-raunchy-netflix-special-031802413.html", "title": "Tom Brady roast: Top highlights from the raunchy Netflix special", "body": "NFL fans are accustomed to seeing Tom Brady involved in a big Sunday night event. However, after retiring two years ago, the seven-time Super Bowl champion is no longer playing any football games.\n\nPreviously, Brady was targeted by opposing defenders on a Sunday night. But for Netflix's live event, \"The Roast of Tom Brady, AKA The Greatest Roast of All Time,\" the quarterback was under attack by a variety of former teammates and comedians including Rob Gronkowski, host Kevin Hart, Julian Edelman, Bert Kreischer, Tom Segura, Randy Moss and Jeff Ross.\n\nBut the program started with a gag likely more familiar to football fans than celebrity culture followers. Bill Belichick appeared on camera, telling someone, \"The fans want you. Everyone wants you. But it's not your night. Sorry, Drew.\"\n\nWe then see he's talking to Drew Bledsoe, former New England Patriots quarterback and Brady's predecessor at the position before getting injured. And the man of the night walks into frame.\n\nThat basically set the tone for the night. Easy jokes and plenty of f-bombs.\n\nAs could be expected at a celebrity roast, Brady's divorce from Gisele B\u00fcndchen was a frequent subject of jokes. Also as could be expected, many of them are unsuitable for documenting here.\n\nOne of the best was during Hart's opening. Mocking Brady for apparently choosing his football career over his marriage, Hart said, \"When you got a chance to go 8-9 and all it will cost you is your wife and your kids, you gotta do it.\"\n\nThere can't be a celebrity roast without Jeff Ross. The \"Roastmaster General\" has been insulting celebrities on television for 20 years. Coming out to the stage in a jersey that said \"Roast J Simpson\" on the back, Ross eventually poked fun at a key part of Tom Brady's legend.\n\n\"Tom was eventually 199th in the NFL Draft,\" Ross said. \"He sat there for days, waiting and waiting, and then you were finally picked in the 6th round when Bill Belichick's dog stepped on the keyboard by accident.\"\n\nHowever, Ross may have crossed a line with Brady when he referenced Patriots owner Robert Kraft and the massage parlor scandal he was involved with in 2019.\n\n\"Don't do that s*** again,\" Brady said in Ross' ear after that joke.\n\nBledsoe earning a place in football history by losing his starting quarterback job was the subject of many quips. But after joking that he hated Brady for taking his position, Bledsoe took a shot at Belichick, a now unemployed NFL coach.\n\n\"Who's more hateable than the most successful quarterback of all time? I mean, except maybe Belichick,\" Bledsoe said. \"There were rumors that coach Belichick was going to be here tonight. Turns out he has some time on his hands. Look, at least when I got fired, someone else wanted me.\"\n\nAs mentioned, Brady's divorce and low NFL Draft status were two constant objects of ridicule. Bledsoe took down both of them with one throw.\n\n\"Look, buddy, you have more rings than I do,\" Bledsoe said. \"But I've experienced a couple of things that you will never experience: The feeling of being the No. 1 overall draft pick in the NFL and a 28th wedding anniversary. It was yesterday.\"\n\nRob Gronkowski was the second-most popular target for jokes after Brady on Sunday night. Most of the wisecracks focused on Gronk's intelligence. The best of them came from comedian Nikki Glaser, who probably had the best material of the show.\n\nTom lost $30 million in crypto. Tom, how did you fall for that?\" Glaser said. \"Even Gronk was like, 'Me know that not real money.'\"\n\nGronk got his turn on the stage and took his share of shots at Brady, Hart, Belichick and Edeleman. He ended his set by sharing a shot with Brady and Belichick followed by, of course, a spike of the shot glass.\n\nThat preceded another surprise moment featuring a round of shots. Patriots owner Robert Kraft took the stage alongside Belichick and praised him as \"the greatest coach in the history of the game\" then shared a shot with his former head coach.\n\nWhen it was nearly done after three-plus hours, Brady was introduced by a surprise guest -- his biggest NFL rival, Peyton Manning.\n\n\"It is great to see the greatest coach in NFL history, Bill Belichick, here,\" Manning said. \"For those that don't know, coach is going to be doing some work on Eli and my 'Monday Night Football' show this year.\n\n\"I gotta tell you, it's gonna be awesome. Eli and I are super excited, and it's gonna give coach Belichick something he hasn't had in a while: The chance to be around quarterbacks he respects.\"\n\nThen Brady finally had his turn. And he set his sights immediately on Manning.\n\n\"I know sometimes you live in Denver,\" Brady said. \"And sometimes you live in Louisiana. But you'll always live in my shadow.\"\n\nHe wasn't done.\n\n\"When I heard there was a slow, white Bronco heading down the 405 to come here tonight, I thought we might actually see a real football legend,\" Brady continued.\n\nHe soon set his sights on most everyone on stage including Gronkowski and Moss. He saved one of the edgiest jokes of the night for Bledsoe.\n\n\"Like the rest of America, I will always remember where I was that fateful day in September 2001 when, tragically, those two Jets slammed into Drew Bledsoe,\" Brady said.\n\nHe gave a sly nod to Roger Goodell and deflategate.\n\n\"The NFL spent $20 million and found that it was more 'probable' than not, that I was 'generally' aware that someone may have deflated my footballs. You could've just given me the 20 mil and I would've just told you I f***ing did it.\"\n\nAnd he closed with, of course, with jokes at Belichick's expense.\n\n\"You are a true coaching genius,\" Brady said. \"You had to choose between an aging, injured, overpaid Drew Bledsoe and a young healthy minimum-wage superstar. I could have got a f***ing coach from Foxboro f***ing high school to make that decision. ...\n\n\"I've been out of the game for a minute, so I'm curious. How many Super Bowl rings have you won since I left? Maybe it's not just the guy on the sideline. When I go to the Indy 500, I don't ask the winning driver 'hey, who gassed up your car?\"\n\nBrady compiled a 251-82 regular season record and 35-13 postseason mark during his 23-year NFL career. Whether he took another win or loss being roasted depends on how funny viewers thought those jokes were. Whether those viewers won or lost by watching \"The Greatest Roast of All Time\" is another question worth asking.", "source": {"uri": "sports.yahoo.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Yahoo Sports"}, {"uri": "8113962873", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "14:26:42", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T14:26:42Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T14:26:25Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7686274647712708, "url": "https://www.nbclosangeles.com/news/local/stars-turn-out-to-roast-tom-brady-in-netflix-special-bill-belichick-steals-the-show/3405607/", "title": "Stars turn out to roast Tom Brady in Netflix special, Bill Belichick steals the show", "body": "Bill Belichick and Robert Kraft awkwardly took a shot together towards the end of the Netflix special roasting Tom Brady\n\nMore than four years after Tom Brady parted ways with Bill Belichick and the Patriots, the legendary quarterback-head coach duo reunited for \"The Greatest Roast of All Time\" -- and many in New England would agree that it did not disappoint.\n\nHost Kevin Hart opened up the live Netflix special saying he was just there for a good time and acknowledged that some things may get a little awkward given all that's transpired since Brady opted to leave New England.\n\n\"Before you can get comfortable, you gotta get uncomfortable. I'm removing the discomfort from this room. Speaking of discomfort, let's talk about Bill Belichick for a second,\" Hart said to Brady. \"The world knows that you left Bill Belichick high and dry, you left him and then you went to Tampa and won a championship. Holy s---! Holy s---! You left Bill Belichick with Mac Jones.\"\n\nThe star-studded roast featured the expected jokes about Brady's ex-wife Gisele B\u00fcndchen, as well as her jiu-jitsu instructor turned new boyfriend, Brady's close relationship with Alex Guerrero, and even how much money Brady lost in cryptocurrency and walking away from Bridget Moynahan when she was pregnant with their child, but the real surprise was that Belichick stole the show.\n\nBelichick, not exactly known for his sparkly personality, absolutely crushed it with his jokes -- not only about Brady, but about Rob Gronkowski, Danny Amendola and the recent Apple TV+ documentary \"The Dynasty.\"\n\nIt had been reported in recent days that Belichick would be one of the roasters, but it was still a surprise to see the normally gruff, former head coach, who had well-documented differences with Brady at the end of their time together, poke fun at his former QB.\n\nBelichick was introduced by none other than Will Ferrell in character as Ron Burgundy from \"Anchorman.\" The former head coach, notorious for his interaction with the media, took the stage to thunderous applause and wasted no time taking his first crack, saying Burgundy is the only member of the media he respects.\n\nBelichick then took aim at the recent documentary on the Patriots dynasty that criticized him heavily, painting him as somewhat of the villain in the downfall of Pats historic run.\n\n\"I'm so honored to be here for the roast of Tom Brady on Netflix. It's not to be confused with the roast of Bill Belichick on the 10-part Apple TV series,\" Belichick quipped.\n\nHe went on to allude to how he was perceived to be hard on Brady, saying, \"A lot of mean things being said about Tom tonight. Wonder why they invited me?\"\n\n\"Really Tom, why are all these people so hard on you? Do you miss me?\"\n\nHe turned his attention toward Gronkowski next. Belichick, who became associated with the \"Do your job\" mantra, said to the former tight end, \"Gronk I've been watching you on Fox NFL Sunday and I'm begging you, please, stop doing your job.\"\n\nGronk also spoke during the special event, talking about how much Edelman sucked up to Brady, and comparing the quarterback to avocados. Gronk later took a shot with Edelman, Brady and Belichick, spiking his shot glass onto the stage -- it's possible he didn't think that one through considering glass appeared to go flying into the first row of the audience.\n\nHart joked on stage afterwards about Gronk's stunt, saying, \"We're live so there's no way to hide the fact that Gronk might be on a little more than alcohol. Yeah, no, it's okay, yeah, no, Gronk we'll get it. Yeah, no we'll clean it up, Gronk. Yeah just sit down when you get a chance bro. Jesus Christ. Just lay down. Just lay down.\"\n\n\"I'm gonna say what everybody else is saying ... this is just my truth,\" Hart continued. \"Gronk scares me. He scares me. Gronk is, he's the unsafe white drunk guy.\"\n\nWhen it was his turn, Edelman had some great digs at Belichick, saying his only employment offer came from Foxborough High School, and at Brady, whose \"wife\" is Guerrero -- \"the snake oil salesman who transformed Brady into a weirdo.\"\n\nOther roasters to take the stage Sunday night included Drew Bledsoe, Randy Moss, Ben Affleck, Nikki Glaser, Jeff Ross and Kim Kardashian, who delivered a few jokes and playfully mocked dating rumors involving her and Brady after she was welcomed with audible boos from the crowd.\n\nThere were several crude jokes from Glaser including about B\u00fcndchen's new boyfriend, and Ross had a slew of jokes that could have hit a nerve -- from one about the Boston Marathon bombings to allegations that Brady cheated.\n\n\"Tom, I really wanted you to be our first GOAT to be roasted because you're an example to future generations that if you work hard, eat right, film the other teams' practices, deflate the balls and have the NFL make new rules just for you, then you, too, can be the third most famous guy in a Dunkin' Donuts commercial.\"\n\nBut it was actually a joke about Robert Kraft's massage parlor controversy that really seemed to trigger Brady.\n\n\"Tom became a Patriot and moved up to New England, and on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said, 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made. Would you like a massage?'\" Ross joked.\n\n\"I love Robert Kraft, I ...,\" Ross started to say before Brady approached him at the podium and said in his ear, \"Don't say that s--- again.\"\n\nRoss pointed out that it appeared Kraft was \"having fun\" during the roast and commended him on all he does for the Jewish community before he got back to his bit.\n\nLater, Kraft was on stage himself for some brief comments and a joke or two, saying to Brady, \"Tommy, thank you for having me here for this unique experience. I thought I'd seen it all but this is special. But you know the Patriots are more than a football team for me. They are family. And guys, it's so good to see all of you here again. Thank you so much for everything you did for us.\"\n\nThe Patriots owner also had a joke or two, speaking about Belichick when he said: \"And like many family reunions, there are some people I'm desperately trying to avoid ... Coach Belichick, good to see you. You really look debonair in sleeves.\"\n\nAnd to Brady, touching on his long-suspected negative feelings about Jimmy G being drafted so highly by the Pats, Kraft said, \"Tom, good luck buying the Raiders. They did your favorite thing already -- they got rid of Jimmy Garoppolo.\"\n\nKraft raised a glass to Brady, telling him he'd always be special to him before telling Vladimir Putin to give him his ring back.\n\nThings took another strange turn when Hart invited Kraft and Belichick to the stage to take a shot together because they're \"so far apart from each other\" -- and yes, it was as awkward as it sounds.\n\n\"Robert wants to do it. Bill? Let's make the uncomfortable comfortable ... Bill, Bill, this is a big moment, Bill,\" Hart said as he tried to encourage Belichick to meet Kraft on stage.\n\nAs he made his way there, Kraft interrupted to say, \"I want to say this is the greatest coach in the history of the game that did what no one else has done, and having Tom Brady and him was the greatest honor the good Lord game me, so cheers.\"\n\nBelichick for his part seemed to have a somewhat pained smile plastered on his face, with no affection shown towards his former employer -- in fact Belichick's arm was around Hart as Kraft spoke, and he didn't down the entire shot.\n\nHart went on to introduce one of his great friends who he called a very special guest and one of the most famous guys from Boston: \"Seriously, one of THE most, I would say there are only about two or three but this guy here in my opinion is the one.\"\n\nBen Affleck then walked out, saying, \"Hi you may know me as an extra from Tom's Dunkin' boy band commercial.\"\n\nThe night ended with the man of the hour at the podium, taking shots at Peyton Manning, who was the last to speak on stage calling Brady a 3x Super Bowl loser, as well as jabs at league commissioner Roger Goodell, and other NFL teams like the Kansas City Chiefs, Indianapolis Colts and Buffalo Bills.\n\n\"Kansas City, you say your stadium is the loudest. It helps when all your fans are 14-year-old girls,\" Brady said referencing the Swifties who are bandwagon Chiefs fans after Taylor Swift started dating Travis Kelce. \"And in honor of Tay Tay, let's take a look at the Chiefs Eras -- terrible for 50 years, good for five. Shake it off!\"\n\n\"Remember Deflategate? The NFL spent $20 million and found that it was more probable than not that I was generally aware that someone may have deflated my footballs. You could have just given me the $20 million and I would have just told you I f------ did it.\"\n\n\"But I don't wanna get the NFL too upset, I'm trying to buy a piece of the Raiders, I'm tired of owning just the Colts and the Bills.\"\n\nBrady's best shot at Belichick came when he pointed out how he fared without him in his finals years as the Patriots head coach: \"I've been out of the game for a minute, so I'm curious -- how many Super Bowl rings have you won since I left?\"\n\nIn the end, it really was like a family reunion Sunday night, as Gronk said. So while Brady may have spent his last three seasons in Tampa Bay, this roast was for Pats fans.
