{"uri": "8114202527", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "17:21:50", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T17:21:50Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T17:20:26Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7686274647712708, "url": "https://www.givemesport.com/tom-brady-roasted-by-teammates-coach-old-rivals-and-anchorman/", "title": "Comics, Teammates and Movie Characters Roasted Tom Brady Last Night", "body": "Netflix held its roast of Tom Brady on Sunday night and several top comics were in attendance. There were familiar faces from Brady's NFL days, too.\n\nHighlights Netflix debuted Tom Brady's roast series, featuring big names in comedy and Patriots stars. Brady will executive produce more roasts while gearing up for a lead announcer role at Fox. The roast featured teammates and opponents taking hilarious jabs at Brady's legacy.\n\nSince entering the streaming game, Netflix has become the home of several major comedy specials and now the service is focusing on roasts as well. On Sunday night, Netflix debuted The Greatest Roast of All-Time: Tom Brady.\n\nIt was one of the first times that Netflix has done a live event, and while it went smoothly, at about three hours of run time, it nearly tripled the length of the previous longest Comedy Central roast of all-time.\n\nSome of the biggest names in comedy were in attendance, such as Kevin Hart, Bert Kreischer, and the 'Roastmaster General' Jeff Ross. Of course, many famous New England Patriots figures were there too, like Rob Gronkowski, Robert Kraft, and Bill Belichick, the latter two of whom somewhat buried the hatchet with a little help from Hart.\n\nBrady retired following the 2022 campaign and spent the 2023 football season largely out of the public eye. But he will be taking to the booth for the 2024 season as a lead announcer for FOX's football broadcasts. He also made a deal with Netflix to executive produce several more roasts, the first of which was last night.\n\nRelated Tom Brady Open To NFL Return With Raiders, Patriots Tom Brady has been retired for just over a year, but the GOAT hasn't ruled out an MJ-esque return to the league. Brady's Teammates Were More Than Willing to Have Fun With Him Opponents like Peyton Manning were there as well\n\nBill Belichick was one of the first non-comedians to hit the stage, and he wanted to answer the question of who was responsible for the Patriots Dynasty. \"Was it Brady,\" he asked. \"Was it me? Was it Brady? Was it me? In reality, the truth of the matter is it was both of us. Because of me.\"\n\nJulian Edelman also took to the stage and made some jokes about his famous bromance with his former quarterback. The former wide receiver also got in one of the best jokes of the night when he noted that Brady was, \"Leonardo DiCaprio's ex-girlfriend's ex-husband.\"\n\nWill Ferrell, as he did previously for the Justin Bieber roast in 2015, was there in character as Ron Burgundy from the Anchorman films. He said of the quarterback:\n\nI never liked you Tom in all my years of watching professional football. I never saw a more boring quarterback. He actually made me look forward to all the fun and laughter of a Bill Belichick postgame interview.\n\nThe comedian also delivered one of the most succinct and punchy jokes about a subject everyone was expecting to get more traction during the roast: Eli Manning.\n\nPeyton Manning, Eli's older brother and Brady's most iconic rival, was also in attendance. Brady got a great shot in at Manning, saying, \"Thank you so much for coming out to L.A. to do this. I know sometimes you live in Denver, and sometimes you live in Louisiana, but you'll always live in my shadow.\"\n\nRandy Moss also had a funny bit asking Tom Brady why he didn't try to cheat while the Hall of Fame wideout was there from 2007-2010. And Gronkowski played into the whole \"big dummy\" persona that the other roasters placed on him perfectly. Here's a full list of the people who got a word in at the roast:\n\nRich Eisen (Intro) Kevin Hart (Host) Jeff Ross Nikki Glaser Sam Jay Andrew Schulz Tom Segura & Bert Kreischer Tony Hinchcliffe Kim Kardashian Dana White Ben Affleck Will Ferrell as Ron Burgundy Bill Belichick Drew Bledsoe Julian Edelman Rob Gronkowski Randy Moss Peyton Manning Robert Kraft\n\nBrady also sat a handful of his former teammates on stage in a row behind the roasters as a nod to their impact on his career. Some of these included Rodney Harrison, Willie McGinest, Matt Light, and LaVonte David.\n\nThe Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady is currently available to watch on Netflix.\n\nRelated Top 5 New "https://static0.givemesportimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/mixcollage-06-may-2024-12-56-pm-8885.jpg", "originalArticle": null, "storyUri": "eng-9541551", "eventUri": "eng-9541551", {"uri": "8113911007", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "13:52:53", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T13:52:53Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T13:52:28Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7686274647712708, "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/stars-turn-roast-tom-brady-130633037.html", "title": "Stars turn out to roast Tom Brady in Netflix special; Bill Belichick steals the show", "body": "Stars turn out to roast Tom Brady in Netflix special; Bill Belichick steals the show originally appeared on NBC Sports Boston\n\nMore than four years after Tom Brady parted ways with Bill Belichick and the Patriots, the legendary quarterback-head coach duo reunited for The Greatest Roast of All Time -- and many in New England would agree that it did not disappoint.\n\nHost Kevin Hart opened up the live Netflix special saying he was just there for a good time and acknowledged that some things may get a little awkward given all that's transpired since Brady opted to leave New England.\n\n\"Before you can get comfortable, you gotta get uncomfortable. I'm removing the discomfort from this room. Speaking of discomfort, let's talk about Bill Belichick for a second,\" Hart said to Brady. \"The world knows that you left Bill Belichick high and dry, you left him and then you went to Tampa and won a championship. Holy sh--! Holy sh--! You left Bill Belichick with Mac Jones.\"\n\nThe star-studded roast featured the expected jokes about Brady's ex-wife Gisele B\u00fcndchen (as well as her jiu-jitsu instructor turned new boyfriend), Brady's close relationship with Alex Guerrero, and even how much money Brady lost in cryptocurrency and walking away from Bridget Moynahan when she was pregnant with their child, but the real surprise was that Belichick stole the show.\n\nBelichick, not exactly known for his sparkly personality, absolutely crushed it with his jokes -- not only about Brady, but about Rob Gronkowski, and Danny Amendola and the recent Apple TV+ documentary The Dynasty.\n\nIt had been reported in recent days that Belichick would be one of the roasters, but it was still a surprise to see the normally gruff former head coach, who had well-documented differences with Brady at the end of their time together, poke fun at his former QB.\n\nBelichick was introduced by none other than Will Ferrell in character as Ron Burgundy from \"Anchorman.\" The former head coach, notorious for his interaction with the media, took the stage to thunderous applause and wasted no time taking his first crack, saying Burgundy is the only member of the media he respects.\n\nBelichick then took aim at the recent Apple TV+ documentary on the Patriots dynasty that criticized him heavily, painting him as somewhat of the villain in the downfall of Pats historic run.\n\n\"I'm so honored to be here for the roast of Tom Brady on Netflix. It's not to be confused with the roast of Bill Belichick on the 10-part Apple TV series,\" Belichick quipped.\n\nHe went on to allude to how he was perceived to be hard on Brady, saying, \"A lot of mean things being said about Tom tonight. Wonder why they invited me?\"\n\n\"Really Tom, why are all these people so hard on you? Do you miss me?\"\n\nHe turned his attention toward Gronkowski next. Belichick, who became associated with the \"Do your job\" mantra, said to the former tight end, \"Gronk, I've been watching you on Fox NFL Sunday and I'm begging you, please, stop doing your job.\"\n\nGronk also spoke during the special event, talking about how much Edelman sucked up to Brady, and comparing the quarterback to avocados. Gronk later took a shot with Edelman, Brady and Belichick, spiking his shot glass onto the stage -- it's possible he didn't think that one through, considering glass appeared to go flying into the first row of the audience.\n\nHart joked on stage afterwards about Gronk's stunt, saying, \"We're live so there's no way to hide the fact that Gronk might be on a little more than alcohol. Yeah, no, it's okay, yeah, no, Gronk we'll get it. Yeah, no we'll clean it up, Gronk. Yeah just sit down when you get a chance bro. Jesus Christ. Just lay down. Just lay down.\"\n\n\"I'm gonna say what everybody else is saying...this is just my truth,\" Hart continued. \"Gronk scares me. He scares me. Gronk is, he's the unsafe white drunk guy.\"\n\nWhen it was his turn, Edelman had some great digs at Belichick, saying his only employment offer came from Foxborough High School, and at Brady, whose \"wife\" is Guerrero -- \"the snake oil salesman who transformed Brady into a weirdo.\"\n\nOther roasters to take the stage Sunday night included Drew Bledsoe, Randy Moss, Ben Affleck, Nikki Glaser, Jeff Ross and Kim Kardashian, who delivered a few jokes and playfully mocked dating rumors involving her and Brady after she was welcomed with audible boos from the crowd.\n\nThere were several crude jokes from Glaser including about B\u00fcndchen's new boyfriend, and Ross had a slew of jokes that could have hit a nerve -- from one about the Boston Marathon bombings to allegations that Brady cheated.\n\n\"Tom, I really wanted you to be our first GOAT to be roasted because you're an example to future generations that if you work hard, eat right, film the other teams' practices, deflate the balls and have the NFL make new rules just for you, then you, too, can be the third most famous guy in a Dunkin' Donuts commercial.\"\n\nBut it was actually a joke about Robert Kraft's massage parlor controversy that really seemed to trigger Brady.\n\n\"Tom became a Patriot and moved up to New England, and on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said, 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made. Would you like a massage?'\" Ross joked.\n\n\"I love Robert Kraft, I....,\" Ross started to say before Brady approached him at the podium and said in his ear, \"Don't say that sh-- again.\"\n\nRoss pointed out that it appeared Kraft was \"having fun\" during the roast and commended him on all he does for the Jewish community before he got back to his bit.\n\nLater, Kraft was on stage himself for some brief comments and a joke or two, saying to Brady, \"Tommy, thank you for having me here for this unique experience. I thought I'd seen it all but this is special. But you know the Patriots are more than a football team for me. They are family. And guys, it's so good to see all of you here again. Thank you so much for everything you did for us.\"\n\nThe Patriots owner also had a joke or two, speaking about Belichick when he said: \"And like many family reunions, there are some people I'm desperately trying to avoid... Coach Belichick, good to see you. You really look debonair in sleeves.\"\n\nAnd to Brady, touching on his long-suspected negative feelings about Jimmy G being drafted so highly by the Pats, Kraft said, \"Tom, good luck buying the Raiders. They did your favorite thing already -- they got rid of Jimmy Garoppolo.\"\n\nKraft raised a glass to Brady, telling him he'd always be special to him before telling Vladimir Putin to give him his ring back.\n\nThings took another strange turn when Hart invited Kraft and Belichick to the stage to take a shot together because they're \"so far apart from each other\" -- and yes, it was as awkward as it sounds.\n\n\"Robert wants to do it. Bill? Let's make the uncomfortable comfortable....Bill, Bill, this is a big moment, Bill,\" Hart said as he tried to encourage Belichick to meet Kraft on stage.\n\nAs he made his way there, Kraft interrupted to say, \"I want to say this is the greatest coach in the history of the game that did what no one else has done, and having Tom Brady and him was the greatest honor the good Lord game me, so cheers.\"\n\nBelichick, for his part, seemed to have a somewhat pained smile plastered on his face, with no affection shown towards his former employer -- in fact Belichick's arm was around Hart as Kraft spoke, and he didn't down the entire shot.\n\nHart went on to introduce one of his great friends who he called a very special guest and one of the most famous guys from Boston: \"Seriously, one of THE most, I would say there are only about two or three but this guy here in my opinion is the one.\"\n\nBen Affleck then walked out, saying, \"Hi you may know me as an extra from Tom's Dunkin' boy band commercial.\"\n\nThe night ended with the man of the hour at the podium, taking shots at Peyton Manning, who was the last to speak on stage calling Brady a 3x Super Bowl loser, as well as jabs at league commissioner Roger Goodell, and other NFL teams like the Kansas City Chiefs, Indianapolis Colts and Buffalo Bills.\n\n\"Kansas City, you say your stadium is the loudest. It helps when all your fans are 14-year-old girls,\" Brady said referencing the Swifties who are bandwagon Chiefs fans after Taylor Swift started dating Travis Kelce. \"And in honor of Tay Tay, let's take a look at the Chiefs Eras -- terrible for 50 years, good for five. Shake it off!\"\n\n\"Remember Deflategate? The NFL spent $20 million and found that it was more probable than not that I was generally aware that someone may have deflated my footballs. You could have just given me the $20 million and I would have just told you I f-----g did it.\"\n\n\"But I don't wanna get the NFL too upset, I'm trying to buy a piece of the Raiders, I'm tired of owning just the Colts and the Bills.\"\n\nBrady's best shot at Belichick came when he pointed out how he fared without him in his finals years as the Patriots head coach: \"I've been out of the game for a minute, so I'm curious -- how many Super Bowl rings have you won since I left?\"\n\nIn the end, it really was like a family reunion Sunday night, as Gronk said. So while Brady may have spent his last three seasons in Tampa Bay, this roast was for Pats fans.", "source": {"uri": "yahoo.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Yahoo"}, "authors": [], "concepts": {"uri": "8113314140", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "07:14:49", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T07:14:49Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T07:14:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7647058963775635, "url": "https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/web-series/news/english/tom-bradys-netflix-roast-delivers-plenty-of-laughs-reunion-with-robert-kraft-and-bill-belichick/articleshow/109876638.cms", "title": "Tom Brady Roast: Tom Brady's Netflix roast delivers plenty of laughs, reunion with Robert Kraft and Bill Belichick | - Times of India", "body": "Tom Brady, the legendary NFL quarterback, took a lot of ribbing during a live comedy event on one of the popular OTT channels, \"The Greatest Roast of All Time,\" at The Forum in Inglewood, California. The three-hour roast featured comedians, former teammates, and even his longtime coach, Bill Belichick, who took aim at Brady with a barrage of jokes and one-liners.\n\nThe roast was hosted by comedian Kevin Hart, who set the tone by stating that nothing was off-limits. He wasted no time poking fun at Brady's personal life, including his recent divorce from Gisele B\u00fcndchen. Hart joked, \"Gisele gave you an ultimatum. She said you retire or we're done. When you got a chance to go 8-9 and all it will cost you is your wife and your kids, you've got to do what you've got to do.\" This jab referred to Brady's brief retirement in 2022 and his subsequent return to play one more season.\n\n80 For Brady - Official Trailer\n\nAlthough Brady laughed off most of the jokes, he had one objection when Jeff Ross made a reference to Patriots owner Robert Kraft and massages. In 2019, Kraft faced a misdemeanor charge related to a Florida massage parlor.\n\nThe roast also featured a reunion between Kraft and Belichick, who did a shot together on stage after some encouragement from Hart. Despite past reports of tension between the Patriots owner and coach, Kraft praised Belichick, saying, \"I want to say this is the greatest coach in the history of the game that did what no one else has done. And having Tom Brady and him was the greatest honor the good Lord gave me.\"\n\nBrady had a few jokes of his own, asking Belichick how many Super Bowl rings he had won since Brady left the Patriots.\n\nKevin Hart said that he felt Brady was in a great mindset for the event and appreciated how he was willing to embrace humor, even if it meant laughing at himself. \"It is a celebration of greatness and we are doing it in a fun way,\" Hart noted.\n\nDrew Bledsoe, who Brady replaced as the Patriots' starting quarterback in 2001, also commended Brady for his courage in participating in the roast. He mentioned that in a locker room, athletes often roast each other, so Brady should be used to it, even if this event was on a larger stage.\n\nThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. It was hosted by comedian Kevin Hart.\n\nIt was a night filled with comedians and other celebrities spewing filthy insults at the Kia Forum in Los Angeles, and the brunt of the the joke was Brady.\n\nFor more than three hours, different comics took turns taking shots - some of them cheap at - Brady, while the all-time quarterback sat there and took it in good humor.\n\nThat is, until the end of the night, when Brady was allowed to fire back for a few minutes, and that's exactly what he did - and he proceeded to speak words you most likely have never heard Brady utter.\n\nWho 'roasted' Tom Brady at the show?\n\nThe roasters, which has not been released prior to airing, included:\n\nWhat joke got under Tom Brady's skin during the roast?\n\nThere was only one joke that drew a rise out of Brady.\n\nRoss made a joke about Kraft and massage parlors.\n\n\"Tom became a Patriot, moved up to New England, and on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said, 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made.' {"uri": "2024-05-346402732", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "11:26:40", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T11:26:40Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T11:00:00Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7607843279838562, "url": "https://www.sportskeeda.com/nfl/news-tom-brady-netflix-roast-highlights-listing-every-joke-made-nfl-icon-bill-belichick-debate-gisele-bundchen-dig", "title": "Tom Brady Netflix roast highlights: Listing every joke made by NFL icon from Bill Belichick debate to Gisele Bundchen dig", "body": "Tom Brady woke up and chose violence on Sunday night during the live Netflix special \"The Roast of Tom Brady.\"\n\nThe seven-time Super Bowl champion had shots ready. The 15-minute segment from Tom Brady was hilarous, and fans across the social media thoroughly enjoyed the roast.\n\nIn case you missed it, here's every joke Tom Brady mentioned, taking aim at every person in the room, from his former teammates to the comedians and actors.\n\nTom Brady settles Bill Belichick debate with hilarious analogy\n\nThe debate of \"Who was influential in Patriots dynasty - Tom Brady or Bill Belichick?\" will go on for ages. But the seven-time Super Bowl champion decided to play around with it and settled the debate.\n\n\"I've been out of the game for a minute. So I'm curious 'how many Super Bowl rings have you won since I left?' Maybe it's not just the guy on the sideline. When I go to the Indy 500, I don't ask the winning driver, 'hey, who gassed up your car?'\"\n\nTom Brady takes dig at Gisele Bundchen\n\nTom Brady had jokes for his ex-wife Gisele Bundchen. The duo divorced in October 2022, ending their 13-year marriage.\n\nIt was reported that Brady's desire to keep playing football was among the reasons that led to the decision. Brady retired in February 2022 but announced his unretirement six weeks later.\n\nBrady joked that he still misses the love of his life - football.\n\n\"There have been a lot of jokes tonight, but the truth is, I missed the love of my life - Football.\"\n\nTom Brady roasts Kim Kardashian and takes dig at Kanye West\n\nTom Brady didn't hold back in roasting Kim Kardashian and taking a job at Kanye West.\n\nHe said that she was terrified of being at the show because her kids were at home with her ex-husband Kanye West. The joke instatly went viral and took social media by storm.\n\n\"I know Kim was terrified to be here tonight ... not because of this but because her kids are at home with their dad.\"\n\nTom Brady drags Roger Goodell and seemingly admits role in Deflategate\n\nTom Brady looks like he has admitted his role in Deflategate. On Sunday, during Netflix's live show in Los Angeles, Brady joked about how Roger Goodell and the NFL handled the infamous saga.\n\n\"Remember Deflategate?\" Brady asked. \"The NFL spent $20 million and found that it was more probable than not that I was generally aware and someone may have deflated my footballs. You could have just given me the $20 million, and I would have just told you I f-king did it.\n\nTom Brady stunns Rob Gronkowski with Aaron Hernandez joke\n\nRob Gronkowski is regarded as the greatest tight end in the NFL by many. He spent nine out of his 11 seasons in NFL with the Patriots.\n\nBrady joked that Gronkowksi was good because of the low bar for TEs, among which not murdering people was a requirement. He made reference to Aaron Hernanzez, who was convicted for murder, which stunned Gronkowski.\n\n\"Despite everything we've seen here tonight. Gronk was actually useful on the field. Although the bar for Patriot tight ends was pretty low back then. Block. Catch. Don't Murder.\"\n\nJulian Edelman catches strays from Tom Brady\n\nJulian Edelman had one of the best chemistry with Tom Brady on the field. The NFL icon joked by calling Edelman a \"stalker.\"\n\n\"Bro you can live in my guest house. Swim in my pool; try on my f**king jogger, any other sick sh*t you do when I'm not around. But you're f**king stalker bro. You'll never be me. Ever.\"\n\nRandy Moss gets obliterated by Tom Brady\n\nRandy Moss played four seasons with the Patriots. He's one of the greatest wide receivers to never win a championship. Brady roasted Moss for asking him for a Super Bowl ring.\n\n\"Can you believe that guy up here begging me 'T-boy give me one of your rings.' Give you ring? B**ch please. You'd be lucky if I sent you a text.\"\n\nTom Brady roasts Bill Belichick for sneaking out of girl's house\n\nTom Brady poked fun at Bill Belichick for sneaking out of a girl's house at 6 am in the morning.\n\n\"Everybody asked me which ring is my favorite? I used to say that next one. But now that I'm retired, my favorite ring is the camera that Coach Belichick sneaking out of that poor girl's house at 6am a few months ago. Ayy you still got it. Respect baby.\"\n\nBill Belichick went viral recently when a camera recorded the former Patriots HC leaving the home.\n\nTom Brady roasts Peyton Manning, Brett Favre\n\nBrady started off his segment firing shots at his long-term rival and NFL icon Peyton Manning. The two have went head-to-head 17 times during their career. But with Brady holding the upper hand with 11 wins, he let Peyton know that.\n\n\"I know sometimes you live in Denver, and sometimes you live in Louisiana. But you will always live in my shadow.\"\n\nBrady also reminisced their long rivalry in taking dig at Brett Favre and Antonio Cromartie.\n\n\"When Peyton and I started playing, Brett Favre was still faxing his d**k pics. And Antonio Cromartie had only one kid.\"\n\nBrett Favre was once accused of sending his d**k pic to Jenn Sterger, who was a \"Playboy\" model and TV personality, before joining the New York Jets.\n\nTom Brady throws shade at late OJ Simpson\n\nBrady decided to also throw shade at the late OJ Simpson over his infamous white Ford Bronco police chase.\n\n\"When I heard there was a slow white Bronco heading down the 405 to come here tonight, I thought we might actually see a real football legend,\" Brady said.\n\nOJ Simpson died on April 10, 2023 due to prostate cancer.\n\nTom Brady makes wild 9/11 joke involving Drew Bledsoe\n\nIt's known that Tom Brady replaced an injured Drew Bledsoe as the starting quarterback for the New England Patriots.\n\nBledsoe suffered a freak injury on September 23, 2001, weeks after the infamous 9/11 attack. Brady, during his roast, made fun of Bledsoe.\n\n\"Like the rest of America, always remember where I was that fateful day in September of 2001 when tragically those two jets slammed into Drew Bledsoe,\" Brady joked.\n\nBrady flexes his Super Bowl victories and pokes fun of Peyton Manning\n\nTom Brady won seven Super Bowls in his NFL career, and Peyton Manning won two. The former Patriots quarterback poked fun at the Broncos legend for having fewer championships while also explaining why he decided to agree for the roast.\n\n\"People ask 'Tom, why would you do this roast now? It's simple. I can take all the hits. I would have done this earlier, but I've just been too busy winning championships, which explains why Peyton did this roast eight years ago.\"\n\nKevin Hart was another victim of Tom Brady's roast\n\nKevin Hart was next in line for Brady. The NFL icon missed the 2008 season due to a torn ACL and MCL on his left knee. Brady addressed his weak knees and said that it was because he requested Netflix to change the host to legendary comedian Dave Chappelle.\n\n\"I've heard some people talk about me having bad knees. You know my knees are so f**ked up Kevin, because I spent so many goddamn hours on the floor begging Netflix to get Chappelle to host this. F**k you Kevin.\"\n\nTom Brady rips Bills Mafia, Eagles, Colts and Giants fans\n\nTom Brady had a lot of time, so he took his time to settle scores. Brady took aim at the fans of Bills Mafia, Eagles, Colts and Giants.\n\n\"I'm trying to buy the Raiders. I'm tired of owning the Colts and the Bills.\"\n\n\"How can you call yourselves the (Bills) Mafia? At least the mafia has a ring you can kiss.\"\n\n\"Screw Colts fans! Colts are just Broncos who don't f***.\"\n\n\"Philly fans are a bunch of racist a**holes.\"\n\nTom Brady takes dig at Taylor Swift and Chiefs fans\n\nTaylor Swift and the Chiefs were also among the victims of Tom Brady's roast. The NFL icon threw shade at Chiefs Kindgom because of their fans being 14-year-old girls and brushed off their successful run in the recent years.\n\n\"Kansas City, you say your stadium is the loudest. It helps when your fans are 14-year-old girls ... in honor of TAY TAY (Taylor Swift). ... Let's take a look at the Chiefs Eras; Terrible for 50 years, good for 5. Shake it off.\"\n\nThe full episode of Tom Brady roast is available on Netflix.", "source": {"uri": "sportskeeda.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Sportskeeda"}, "authors": [{"uri": {"uri": "8113624977", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "10:45:12", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T10:45:12Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T10:44:41Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7607843279838562, "url": "https://www.patspulpit.com/2024/5/6/24149942/patriots-roast-of-tom-brady-best-moments-belichick-kraft-gronkowski", "title": "'The Roast of Tom Brady' was the Patriots reunion you didn't know you needed", "body": "The Roast of Tom Brady, a three-hour long Netflix special streamed live on Sunday night, saw the former New England Patriots quarterback take hits as if he was still playing.\n\nWhat made the show interesting, though, was not just what was said about Brady but who said what, both about him and other people in attendance and participating. Yes, it featured \"outsiders\" as well -- including, among others, host Kevin Hart, ex-NFL QB Peyton Manning, actor Ben Affleck, and comedian Nikki Glaser -- but the main event was Brady and his colleagues.\n\nAnd there were a lot of them besides the future Hall of Famer.\n\nBill Belichick and Robert Kraft participated, as did Drew Bledsoe, Randy Moss, Julian Edelman, and Rob Gronkowski. In addition, Rodney Harrison, Matt Light, Nate Solder, Dan Koppen, Danny Amendola, Willie McGinest and Lonie Paxton also were on stage. Bill O'Brien and Berj Najarian were spotted in the audience.\n\nIn a way, the special was a Patriots dynasty reunion.\n\nIt also had a much more upbeat vibe that the The Dynasty docuseries meant to chronicle the team's unprecedented two-decade run of success. If there was one show meant to bring closure to the dynasty, it was this one rather than the more serious product produced by Apple TV+.\n\nBesides the reunion aspect, here are some of our favorite moments from The Roast of Tom Brady.\n\nAs noted above, former Indianapolis Colts and Denver Broncos quarterback Peyton Manning -- whose rivalry with Brady remains one of the best in NFL history -- participated in the event as well. When Brady took the stage for a final rebuttal, though, he made sure not to let his former rival and good friend know about their place in league annals.\n\n\"I know sometimes you live in Denver, and sometimes you live in Louisiana,\" Brady said. \"But you will always live in my shadow.\"\n\nAt the beginning of the show, a brief clip was played that saw Bill Belichick, Drew Bledsoe and Tom Brady showcase their acting skills. Those are nothing to write home about, obviously, but the scene was still a fun reference to Brady overtaking Bledsoe as the Patriots' starter in 2000.\n\nBledsoe did get some jabs in himself when it was his time to roast. He spoke about experiencing two things Brady never will -- being the first overall draft pick and celebrating a 28th wedding anniversary -- and also took a dig at his former coach.\n\n\"At least when I got fired, somebody else wanted me,\" he said, addressing Belichick.\n\nEven before they announced their mutual split in January, there was plenty of chatter about the relationship between Bill Belichick and Patriots owner Robert Kraft. Both men took the stage on Sunday, with Kraft singing the praises of both his long-time coach and his long-time quarterback.\n\nIn fact, the two even did a shot together.\n\nThat was not the only time alcohol was involved. A group of ex-Patriots -- Brady, Belichick, Julian Edelman, Rob Gronkowski -- did a shot at one point, with Gronkowski spiking the glass on stage. The tight end in general had a wild night between smashing glasses, absorbing some jokes himself, and several references of male genitalia (and more) during his own set.\n\nThe debate about whether Brady or Belichick was more responsible for the Patriots' dynasty -- when the truth instead is that they were in a perfect situation they both actively helped build -- will continue for years to come. At least on Sunday, though, it was part of a playful back-and-forth between the two NFL legends.\n\n\"For all of you out there that think about who's responsible for the Patriots' success during the time Tom and I were there. Was it Brady? Was it me?\" Belichick said. \"Was it Brady? Was it me? In reality, the truth of the matter is it was both of us -- because of me.\"\n\nBrady countered by talking about his superior Super Bowl rings count after leaving New England, followed by an Indy 500 metaphor.\n\n\"Maybe it's not just the guy on the sideline,\" he said. \"When I go to the Indy 500, I don't ask the winning driver, 'Hey, who gassed up your car?'\"\n\nBelichick's set was one of the highlights of the special, showing a side of him few people actually get to experience on a regular. He even mentioned The Dynasty, a show criticized for its storytelling seemingly looking for negativity and controversy.\n\n\"It's an honor to be here at the roast of Tom Brady on Netflix,\" Belichick said. \"It's not to be confused with the roast of Bill Belichick on the 10-part Apple TV series.\"\n\nBrady and the others present were not the only ones to occasionally become the butt of jokes. In fact, a wide variety of people were caught up in the event as well.\n\nThe likes of Mac Jones, Nate Ebner, Jimmy Garoppolo, Aaron Hernandez, and Alex Guerrero were mentioned, too.\n\n\"Tommy, good luck buying the Raiders,\" said Robert Kraft, for example. \"They already did your favorite thing -- get rid of Jimmy Garoppolo.\"\n\nBelichick and Edelman went after Brady's personal trainer Guerrero, who was in attendance as well.\n\n\"It was hard to butt heads with Tom because he was so far up Alex Guerrero's a--,\" Belichick said.\n\n\"In case you didn't know, Alex Guerrero is the snake oil salesman who turned Tom Brady into a f---ing weirdo,\" Edelman noted.\n\nEven English soccer team Birmingham City was mentioned. The club, which has Brady as a minority owner, was recently relegated to the third tier and brought up by Belichick.\n\n\"Not so easy running a team. Is it, Tom?\" he asked.\n\nOther NFL clubs were also brought up, with Brady pointing to two in particular -- the Indianapolis Colts and Buffalo Bills.\n\n\"I don't want to get the NFL too upset. I'm trying to buy a piece of the Raiders,\" he said. \"I'm tired of owning just the Colts and the Bills.\"\n\nFormer Patriots wide receiver Julian Edelman can be referred to as a \"Belichick guy\" through and through, which is why he would not let the opportunity go to waste to also come after his former coach when it was his turn to take the podium.\n\n\"I've been waiting for this for so long: look a--hole, Foxboro High's the only job offer you f---ing had,\" Edelman said.\n\nBelichick seemed amused by the joke.\n\nWhile jokes were naturally the preferred method of communication on Sunday, Belichick had one of the best lines of the night when he spoke in a serious voice for a second. Talking about former Patriots safety Rodney Harrison, Belichick said that him not being in the Pro Football Hall of Fame \"might be the biggest joke of the night.\"", "source": {"uri": and the viewers watching at home.\n\nRoss then blew a kiss to Mr Kraft, who was seated in the audience, and said, \"I love Robert Kraft\", but was cut off when Brady approached the roast podium.\n\nThe NFL star whispered to Ross, which was also picked up by his microphone, \"Don't say that s*** again.\"\n\n\"OK, OK,\" Ross responded before he pointed to the Patriot's owner and said, \"He's having fun, look at him.\"\n\nKevin Hart, the night's host, then returned to the microphone and teased Ross: \"Wow, wow. It's not to be confused with the 10-part Bill Belichick roast during the Apple TV documentary,\" Mr Belichick said, referring to Apple TV's The Dynasty documentary that focused on the Patriots' reign under Mr Belichick and Brady that was released earlier this year.\n\nHowever, the coach did eventually turn his attention to Brady, giving him some advice after Birmingham City, the UK football team that Brady minority owns, was relegated from its league.\n\n\"Believe it or not, I've got a lot of nice things to say about Tom, but I'm running out of time here,\" Mr Belichick said during the roast. \"I see your soccer team, Birmingham City, got knocked down another tier in the English Football League.\n\n\"Not so easy running a team is it, Tom? {"uri": "8114201569", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "17:22:22", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T17:22:22Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T17:19:33Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7490196228027344, "url": "https://ca.news.yahoo.com/deflategate-admission-bill-belichick-slights-170456726.html", "title": "Deflategate admission, Bill Belichick slights among Tom Brady roast highlights", "body": "May 6 (UPI) -- Future Hall of Fame quarterback Tom Brady appeared to make an admission of guilt for his role in the Deflategate cheating scandal in one of many notable moments from his roast, which aired on Netflix.\n\nFormer coach Bill Belichick, New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft, several of Brady's former teammates, actors Kevin Hart and Will Ferrell, Kim Kardashian, NFL legend Peyton Manning and comedians were among the attendees of the live event Sunday at the Kia Forum in Los Angeles. The Roast of Tom Brady remains available on the streaming service.\n\nWhile the majority of the roast featured those celebrities making jabs at Brady, the longtime Patriots quarterback also took time for his own brief monologue. It was then when Brady, who was suspended for four games for his role in deflating footballs during the 2014-15 season, made his admission.\n\n\"Remember Deflategate?\" Brady asked. \"The NFL spent $20 million and found that it was more probable than not that I was generally aware that someone may have deflated my footballs.\n\n\"You could have just given me the $20 million and I would have just told you I [expletive] did it.\"\n\nBrady, who retired in 2023, sat on the stage and took most of the slights in stride. He appeared agitated when comedian Jeff Ross took a shot at Kraft, referencing charges of solicitation he faced in 2019. He was later cleared of those charges.\n\n\"Don't say that [expletive] again,\" Brady said in Ross' ear.\n\nSeveral of Brady's roasters joked about his divorce from Brazilian model Gisele Bundchen, who did not attend. Belichick referenced the long-had debate between sports fans about whether he or Brady deserves more credit for the Patriots' dynasty.\n\n\"For all of you out there that think who's responsible for the Patriots success during the time Tom and I were there,\" Belichick said. \"Was it Brady? Was it me? In reality, the truth of the matter is, it was both of us, because of me.\"\n\nBrady, who was drafted by Belichick in the sixth-round of the 2000 NFL Draft, also referenced the argument, but took another point of view.\n\n\"How many Super Bowl rings have you won since I left? Maybe it's not just the guy on the sideline,\" Brady said. \"When I go to the Indianapolis 500, I don't ask the winning driver: 'Hey, who gassed up your car?'\"\n\nBelichick also took a shot of alcohol with Kraft during the broadcast. The duo announced a parting of ways in January. The split ended their 24-year union, which reportedly turned tumultuous.\n\nBelichick, who failed to land a head coaching job this off-season, was the target of several jokes. Former Patriots wide receiver Julian Edelman was among those who issued the jabs.\n\n\"Remember when you used to yell at us, 'Look, [expletives], the [expletive] kids down at Foxboro High can make that [expletive] play,'\" Edelman said. \"Well, look, [expletive], Foxboro High is the only job offer you [expletive] had!\n\n\"Do your job? More like 'need a job,' coach.\"\n\nFerrell made a surprise appearance while portraying Anchorman star Ron Burgundy. He made fun of Brady by bringing up his two Super Bowl losses to former NFL quarterback Eli Manning and the New York Giants. He also triggered an Eli Manning chant from the crowd.\n\n\"I thought about attending the Roast of Tom Brady last night, but I did not want to roast him for a third time,\" Manning wrote Monday on {"uri": "8112963110", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "01:01:04", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T01:01:04Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T01:00:26Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7490196228027344, "url": "https://www.whiskeyriff.com/2024/05/05/dont-say-that-sht-again-tom-brady-was-not-happy-with-jeff-rosss-joke-about-robert-krafts-massage-during-netflix-roast/", "title": "\"Don't Say That Sh*t Again\" - Tom Brady Was NOT Happy With Jeff Ross's Joke About Robert Kraft's \"Massage\" During Netflix Roast", "body": "Former NFL superstar QB Tom Brady took center stage as Netflix hosted The Roast of Tom Brady, featuring names like Brady's former teammates Julian Edelman, Rob Gronkowski and Randy Moss, comedians like Kevin Hart, and even Brady's former coach Bill Belichick taking their shots at Brady.\n\nBut apparently one joke hit below the belt...no pun intended. (Ok, it was kind of intended).\n\nComedian Jeff Ross was taking his turn at roasting the GOAT when he joked about Brady first being drafted by the New England Patriots:\n\n\"On the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into Robert Kraft's office and said, 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made.\n\nWould you like a massage?\"\n\nThe joke was obviously a jab at Patriots owner Robert Kraft getting caught up in a prostitution scandal a few years ago, when he allegedly visited a Florida massage parlor for some...well, relief.\n\nAll of the charges against Kraft were eventually dropped, but apparently it's still a sore spot for Brady.\n\nAs Ross was telling Kraft how much he loved him after the jab, Brady stood up and the microphones picked up what he said in Ross's ear:\n\n\"Don't say that shit again.\"\n\nCome on Tom, chill out. Relax. Go get a mas...never mind, don't want to upset Brady.\n\nLuckily the roast had a happy ending (just like Bob Kraft) with Brady and Ross hugging it out while smiling at each other and chatting briefly once the comedian was done.", "source": {"uri": "whiskeyriff.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Whiskey Riff"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Brady", "type": {"uri": "8114391986", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "20:11:47", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T20:11:47Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T20:11:06Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7411764860153198, "url": "https://www.unionleader.com/news/back_page/all-the-best-burns-from-netflix-s-tom-brady-roast/article_37607a8e-0be0-11ef-9f40-cb0b5009ef7f.html", "title": "All the best burns from Netflix's Tom Brady roast", "body": "Comedians, former teammates, rivals and a Kardashian took their best shots at Tom Brady Sunday night in the live Netflix \"Roast of Tom Brady,\" spewing f-bombs and zingers over more than three hours in the Kia Forum in Inglewood, Calif.\n\nIn the end, Brady proved to be \"unroastable,\" as he had promised during a promo for the show, but it wasn't for a lack of trying by, among others, host Kevin Hart, Jeff Ross, Nikki Glaser, Kim Kardashian for some reason, Ben Affleck for obvious reasons, former coach Bill Belichick, and former teammates Rob Gronkowski, Julian Edelman and Randy Moss. Brady's decades-long NFL career offered a rich tableau of roastable nuggets - his divorce from Gisele B\u00fcndchen (and her jujitsu instructor), Spygate, Deflategate, his TB12 diet and relationship with his friend/\"body coach\" Alex Guerrero (\"the snake oil salesman that turned Tom into a complete weirdo,\" as Edelman put it).\n\nBrady's journey from 199th draft pick to Roast City began when he replaced injured New England Patriots quarterback Drew Bledsoe in 2001, so it seemed appropriate to let Bledsoe take the first shots. \"A lot of people assume I have a lot of animosity toward Tom Brady,\" he said, \"so I'm here tonight in front of millions of people to tell you -- they're correct.\"\n\nHere's a rundown of some of the best lines (minus most of the profanity):\n\nMoss, who never won a ring with Brady: \"I'll tell you what you deflated: my legacy. I want my ring ... Drew Bledsoe was in the freakin' hospital, and he has a Super Bowl ring. Nate Ebner - who the f--- is Nate Ebner? - he has three Super Bowl rings.\"\n\nGronkowski on Brady and Belichick, noting that both hate fun: \"You both live and breathe football. Neither of you are married anymore. You're both even divorced from football - and both of you take full credit for the dynasty.\"\n\nBelichick: \"Really, Tom, why are all these people so hard on you? Do you miss me?\"\n\nPatriots owner Robert Kraft spoke of Brady's interest in becoming part owner of the Las Vegas Raiders and his reported feelings about a former teammate: \"Tom, good luck buying the Raiders. They did your favorite thing for you already - they got rid of Jimmy Garoppolo.\"\n\nPeyton Manning, calling Brady a three-time Super Bowl loser: \"My [golf] handicap is 6.4, while Tom's handicap is blowing leads in the Super Bowl to my brother, Eli.\"\n\nEli Manning chimed in Monday morning on X: \"I thought about attending the Roast of Tom Brady last night, but I did not want to roast him for a 3rd time!!\"\n\nKraft: \"Vladimir Putin if you're watching, give me my f---ing [Super Bowl XXXIX] ring back.\"\n\nAs roasts do, this one turned into a free-for-all in which no one escaped unscathed, although Brady seemed to tell comedian Jeff Ross to back off the massage jokes concerning Kraft. But if you thought perhaps there would be no cracks about the late Aaron Hernandez and murder or CTE, you were sadly mistaken. And you probably didn't foresee the night's star turn by a smiling, laughing, relaxed ... Belichick, who seemed to enjoy taunts about his inability to find a coaching job since parting with New England in January.\n\nRoss, known as the \"Roastmaster General,\" kicked things off by acknowledging Brady's teammates in the audience, such as Gronkowski. \"Forum is how Rob Gronkowski counts to 5.'' And he continued several times in the show, telling the others, \"please explain that joke to Gronk.\"\n\nMost of the very filthy jokes were about Brady's time with the New England Patriots and his marriage to super model Gisele B\u00fcndchen, with teammate Julian Edelman calling him \"Leonardo DiCaprio's ex-girlfriend's ex-husband.\" And comedian Andrew Schulz told him, \"No matter how big you get, you end up as a twice-divorced supplement salesman in Tampa, Florida.\"\n\nKardashian took the stage to squash rumors she is dating Brady. \"An ex-athlete, high cheekbones, silky hair, you remind me too much of my stepdad now,\" Kardashian continued, referencing her mom Kris Jenner's former spouse, Caitlyn Jenner.\n\nThis roast, held during the Netflix is a Joke comedy festival, was the first time in history that a roast has aired live and unedited on television or streaming, according to Netflix.\n\nAmong the top burns:\n\n* \"Tom, I wanted you to be our first G.O.A.T. to be roasted, because you're an example to future generations. If you work hard, eat right, film the other team's practices, deflate the balls and have the NFL make new rules just for you, you too can be the third-most famous guy in a Dunkin' Donuts commercial.\" -- Jeff Ross\n\n* \"Tom Brady. Five-time Super Bowl MVP, most career wins, most career touchdowns. You have seven rings -- well, eight, now that Gisele gave hers back. The only thing dumber than saying yes to this roast was when you said, 'Hey babe, you should try jiu-jitsu.'\" -- Nikki Glaser\n\n* \"When we played together, Tom, you used to scream, 'Laser focus! Laser focus!' Now that's what he screams at his plastic surgeon. Who's laughing now Tom? Not you, because your face can't move and you don't have a sense of humor.\" -- Julian Edelman\n\n* \"Tom is making a donation to every one of his former teammates' charities that came here tonight. And I gotta tell you, Tom, that is first class. Hey fellas, don't let him pay you in crypto.\" -- Peyton Manning\n\n* \"Despite everything we've seen here tonight, Gronk was actually useful on the field. Although the bar for Patriots tight ends was pretty low back then: block, catch, don't murder.\" -- Tom Brady\n\nEdelman also took the opportunity to poke fun at his now-unemployed former coach, Belichick.\n\n\"Remember when you used to yell at us, 'Look, a------, the f---ing kids down at Foxborough High can make that f---ing play!\" Edelman recalled. \"Well ... Foxborough High is the only job offer you have! ... Do your job? More like need a job, coach.\"\n\nBledsoe had a rip for Belichick, too: \"Turns out he has some time on his hands. At least when I got fired, somebody else wanted me.\"\n\nBut Belichick didn't take it sitting down. \"It's an honor to be at the roast of Tom Brady on Netflix tonight,\" he said. \"It's not to be confused with the 10-part Bill Belichick roast during the Apple TV documentary.\" Known for his \"do your job\" mantra to players, he begged Gronk, who now appears on Fox's NFL broadcasts, to \"please stop doing your job.\"\n\nIt felt a little like a Patriots dynasty family reunion for Kraft and, he said, \"like many family reunions, there are some people I'm desperately trying to avoid - Coach Belichick, good to see you. You really look debonair in sleeves.\"\n\nBut the night, and the last words, belonged to Brady or Brady's writers:\n\nAbout those deflated balls: \"The NFL spent $20 million and found that it was more 'probable' than not, that I was 'generally' aware that someone may have deflated my footballs. You could've just given me the 20 mil and I would've just told you I f---ing did it.\"\n\nOn the Peyton Manning rivalry: \"I know sometimes you live in Denver, and sometimes you live in Louisiana. But you will always live in my shadow.\"\n\nOn his interest in being part owner of the Raiders: \"I'm tired of owning just the Colts and the Bills.\"\n\nOn the Chiefs and Taylor Swift: \"Kansas City, you say your stadium is the loudest. It helps when your fans are 14-year-old girls ... in honor of TAY TAY ... Let's take a look at the Chiefs' eras; Terrible for 50 years, good for five. SHAKE IT OFF.\"\n\nAnd to Belichick: \"I've been out of the game for a minute, so I'm curious. How many Super Bowls have you won since I left? ... When I go to the Indy 500 I don't ask, 'Hey, who gassed up your car?'\"\n\n(Material from the Tampa Bay Times was used in this report.)", "source": {"uri": "unionleader.com", "dataType": "news", {"uri": "8113070935", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "03:29:14", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T03:29:14Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T03:28:30Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7411764860153198, "url": "https://theathletic.com/5474066/2024/05/05/tom-brady-roast-netflix-takeaways/", "title": "Tom Brady ripped by Belichick, Kevin Hart, former teammates during roast", "body": "In a live show on Netflix that lasted over three hours, a roast of Tom Brady didn't spare any jokes at the expense of the seven-time Super Bowl winner. Everything from his divorce from Gisele B\u00fcndchen, Spygate, Deflategate and Brady's relationship with Alex Guerrero were all on the table.\n\n\"Before I got to the New England Patriots, we heard about Spygate. Then after I left, we heard about Deflategate,\" Randy Moss said. \"So I only got one question for you, Tom: 'Why the f -- didn't we cheat when I was there?! I wanted to cheat, too. My kids always ask me, 'Daddy, why does everyone have a ring but you?' You know how hard it is to look your kids in the eyes and say, 'They just don't trust me enough to cheat'?\"\n\nA wide array of former teammates and comedians spent a few hours trading barbs with each other -- but especially Brady.\n\n\"A lot of people assume I have a lot of animosity toward Tom Brady,\" Drew Bledsoe joked. \"So I'm here tonight in front of millions of people to tell you -- they're correct.\"\n\nAnd then, toward the end of the night, Bill Belichick, the uber-serious, seldom-joking former head coach of the Patriots, crushed with a 10-minute set.\n\n\"People have said it -- Tom and I butted heads a lot,\" Belichick said, setting up his joke. \"And in a way that was true. But it was hard to butt heads with Tom -- because he was so far up Alex Guerrero's ass.\"\n\nAt first, Brady sat in good spirits and tried to laugh off the relentless (and often ruthless) jokes -- even if there were some uncomfortable moments. Here are some of the highlights from the roast.\n\nMoss: \"Even though we didn't win it all, I still got everything that I wanted because I got to play with the greatest quarterback that ever lived. And for three years -- it was a short time -- we scared the entire National Football League. Tom, you're still my quarterback -- even though you did not want me to be your accomplice.\"\n\nBledsoe: \"There were rumors that coach (Bill) Belichick was going to be here tonight. Turns out he has some time on his hands. At least when I got fired, somebody else wanted me.\"\n\nBelichick: \"I'm honored to be here at the roast of Tom Brady on Netflix. Not to be confused with the roast of Bill Belichick on the 10-part Apple-TV series.\"\n\nJulian Edelman: \"Alex Guerrero is the snake oil salesman that turned Tom into a complete weirdo.\"\n\nRob Gronkowski on the similarities between Brady and Belichick: \"You're both hard asses that hate fun. You both live and breathe football. Neither of you are married anymore. You're both even divorced from football -- and both of you take full credit for the dynasty.\"\n\nComedian Jeff Ross: \"Tom was drafted 199th in the NFL draft. He sat there for days waiting and waiting and was finally picked in the sixth round when Bill Belichick's dog stepped on the keyboard by accident.\"\n\nNikki Glaser: \"You have seven rings -- well, eight now that Giselle gave hers back.\"\n\nIt wasn't all just laughs. It seemed Brady learned pretty quickly that this wasn't going to be some light-hearted, good-natured ribbing. That started with Kevin Hart's opening monologue which went heavy on jokes about B\u00fcndchen and her reported new boyfriend with a background in jiu-jitsu.\n\nBut the most awkward moment may have been after Ross made a joke about Robert Kraft and massages. Afterward, Brady stood up from his seat and seemed to say to Ross, \"Don't say that s -- again.\"\n\nThe best set of the night probably goes to Glaser, though Belichick's bit was great and hit on everyone from comedians (joking that Hart can't say no to an opportunity) to Danny Amendola's career highlights (that's \"what Randy would call a decent first half\") to, of course, Brady (\"Really, Tom, why are all these people so hard on you? Do you miss me?\" Belichick joked.)\n\nWith Belichick back in the fold, he opened himself up to ribbing, including from Edelman who noted that Belichick for several years used to say in team meetings that players at Foxboro High School could've done what the Patriots messed up.\n\n\"(Now) Foxboro High is the only job offer you have,\" Edelman said. \"... Do your job? More like need a job, coach.\"\n\nWith the rift between Kraft and Belichick well known, the Pats owner figured he'd quickly address it when he got the mic while Belichick was seated next to Edelman on stage.\n\n\"Like many family reunions, there's some people here I'm desperately trying to avoid -- coach Belichick, good to see you,\" Kraft joked.\n\nThen he turned toward Brady's impending purchase of a share of the Las Vegas Raiders.\n\n\"Tom, good luck buying the Raiders,\" he said. \"They did your favorite thing for you already -- they got rid of Jimmy Garoppolo.\"\n\nFinally, at the end of a long night with some brutal jokes, Brady cracked a few jokes of his own while displaying a cocky version of himself fitting of a roast.\n\nHe said that Gronkowski was a great tight for the Patriots -- \"Although the bar for Patriots tight ends was pretty low back then.\" He joked that the NFL could've saved the $20 million they spent on Deflategate \"and I would've just told you I f -- king did it.\" And Brady added that he's trying to buy a share of the Raiders because, \"I'm tired of owning just the Colts and the Bills.\"\n\nAt the end, Brady turned toward Belichick, the coach with whom {"uri": "8113917238", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "13:57:09", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T13:57:09Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T13:56:35Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7372549176216125, "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/tom-brady-roast-from-those-loud-kim-kardashian-boos-to-his-gisele-reactions-here-are-5-things-you-didnt-see-on-tv-135221005.html", "title": "Tom Brady roast: From those loud Kim Kardashian boos to his Gisele reactions, here are 5 things you didn't see on TV", "body": "Tom Brady agreed to be roasted for Netflix's The Greatest Roast of All Time, but there's no way he was prepared for some of the NSFW content that came out of the three-hour live special.\n\nHosted by Kevin Hart, the event was part of the Netflix is a Joke festival, and took place on Sunday at the Kia Forum in Inglewood, Calif. Bill Belichick, Ben Affleck and Kim Kardashian were among the famous roasters and no topic was off-limits -- OK, just one topic -- as Brady heard relentless jokes about his marriage to Gisele B\u00fcndchen, deflategate, his looks and much, much more.\n\nHere are five things you didn't see on TV from inside the Brady roast.\n\nKevin Hart made it clear from the outset that Brady's high-profile divorce from B\u00fcndchen was not going to be off-limits. Aside from Brady's relationship with former coach Bill Belichick, it was one of the topics most roasted.\n\n\"The world knows that you left Bill Belichick high and dry, man... You know who else f***ed that coach? Gisele,\" he said, referring to B\u00fcndchen's reported relationship with their children's jujitsu teacher, Joaquim Valente. \"She f***ed that karate man.\"\n\nBrady took a sip (OK, a lot of sips) out of whatever he was drinking during this particular joke.\n\n\"I mean, Jesus Christ, Tom. One of the smartest quarterbacks ever played a game,\" Hart continued. \"How did you not see this coming? Eight f***ing karate classes a day.\"\n\nThe comedian had some other jabs about Brady's 13-year marriage that ended, but clearly Hart didn't go too far in the quarterback's mind. After Hart introduced Jeff Ross, who kicked things off on Sunday night, Brady leaned over to Hart and gave him a \"no hard feelings\" pat on the back and whispered something in his ear.\n\nThe NSFW Gisele joke that had Brady mouth \"oh my God\" came courtesy of Ross. (\"You really put the j*** in Gisele.\")\n\nSpeaking of Ross, he's the only one who seemingly went too far in Brady's mind -- but it wasn't about the athlete's ex-wife. It was when Ross went after Patriots owner Robert Kraft.\n\n\"Tom became a Patriot, moved up to New England, and on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made. Would you like a massage?'\" Ross said, before turning to Kraft who was in the audience. (In 2019, Kraft was charged in a Florida sting aimed at breaking up prostitution rings at massage parlors.)\n\n\"I love Robert Kraft, I...\" Ross said before Brady got up and whispered something in his ear: \"Never say that shit again.\"\n\nThere was a dedicated camera inside the Kia Forum trained on Brady throughout the roast, and it was clear the seven-time Super Bowl champ thought the massage joke was off-limits. There were multiple teleprompter's set up for roasters, so there's a chance Brady caught a look at where Ross was about to go and didn't like it.\n\nThe boos inside the theater when Kardashian took the stage were even louder than you heard. But it was clear Brady wanted the audience to cool it, as he kept clapping for the reality star when she was up there. Kardashian seemed surprised by the prolonged negative reaction she received when she began her roast but ultimately powered through and won some people over as she poked fun at last year's dating rumors. But the audience was still pretty brutal whenever she was shown onscreen.\n\nWhen Brady took the podium at the end of the night, he had an opportunity to respond to everyone who roasted him, including Kardashian. When the camera flashed to her in the audience, the boos started up once again, but quickly turned to laughs as Brady delivered one of his biggest zingers of the night.\n\n\"I know Kim was terrified to be here tonight ... not because of this but because her kids are at home with their dad,\" he said.\n\nFifteen minutes before the show kicked off, comedian Alonzo Bodden got the audience warmed up. He also gave everyone fair warning the content was not going to be PG.\n\n\"At a roast, they are gonna go hard at Tom,\" he explained, telling everyone they were going to hear \"inappropriate shit\" and \"your job is to laugh.\"\n\n\"I don't want to hear none of that cancel culture bullshit,\" he added.\n\nIt's safe to say the audience was up for it -- for all three hours.\n\nThe comedian delivered a perfect roast, as Hart declared, even though she had Brady squirming at moments. Glaser was the first one to go after the quarterback for leaving Bridget Moynahan for B\u00fcndchen.\n\n\"Tom, you're the best to ever play for too long. I mean, you retired, then you came back and then you retired again. I mean, I get it. It's hard to walk away from something that's not your pregnant girlfriend [Bridget Moynahan],\" Glaser said. (Brady kept a somewhat serious look on his face for that one.) \"To be fair, he didn't know she was pregnant. He just thought she was getting fat and Tom hates fat.\"\n\nBrady hugged Glaser when she was done with her roast and the audience gave her an equally warm embrace as she the whole auditorium got to {"uri": "8113709549", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "11:41:11", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T11:41:11Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T11:40:52Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7372549176216125, "url": "https://www.etonline.com/tom-brady-steps-in-to-shut-down-this-one-off-limits-joke-during-his-roast-224759", "title": "Tom Brady Steps In to Shut Down This One Off-Limits Joke During Roast", "body": "The legendary QB told comedian Jeff Ross, 'Don't say that s**t again' at one point during the live Netflix special.\n\nTom Brady took his lumps with a smile during Netflix's live roast in his honor, but the celebrated athlete drew the line at one joke in particular.\n\nThe 46-year-old NFL alum stood up and issued a stern warning to roaster Jeff Ross at one point during the show, after the comic took a jab at New England Patriots CEO Robert Kraft. The comment came as Ross recounted Brady's humble start with the Pats, when he was selected as the 199th draft pick.\n\n\"He sat there for days, waiting and waiting, and then you were finally picked in the sixth round when Bill Belichick's dog stepped on the keyboard by accident,\" Ross quipped during the roast.\n\n\"On the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made,'\" he continued, pausing for the punchline: \"Would you like a massage?\"\n\nRoss' joke was in reference to a 2019 incident in which Kraft was charged with soliciting prostitution in a Florida massage parlor. He was cleared of all charges.\n\nBrady appeared visibly uncomfortable, shifting in his seat after the gag. He then stood up to approach Ross at the podium as the latter blew a kiss toward Kraft, who was seated in the audience.\n\nPlacing a hand up to Ross' ear, Brady could be heard on the hot mic saying, \"Don't say that s**t again.\"\n\nRoss placed his hands up in surrender and replied, \"OK, OK,\" before directing his attention back to the 82-year-old businessman.\n\n\"He's having fun, look at him,\" Ross said of Kraft. \"I love what you do for the Jews, Robert Kraft. You're incredible.\"\n\nCameras then cut to Kraft, who appeared to be smiling in response.\n\nAt the end of his set, Ross and Brady hugged and exchanged pleasantries on stage.\n\nNetflix's The Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady went down on Sunday at the Kia Forum in Inglewood, California, with Kevin Hart hosting. Kraft was among a handful of New England Patriots' alum on hand to support Brady, along with the team's former coach, Bill Belichick, and tight end, Rob Gronkowski.\n\nRoasters tackled a number of hot topics about Brady, including Deflategate and his failed marriage with Gisele B\u00fcndchen.\n\nJust before the event began, Hart spoke with ET on the red carpet and said that he was approaching the roast with a take-no-prisoners attitude and that nothing was off limits.\n\n\"I'm being mean today,\" Hart, 44, said. \"I'm not nice Kevin today... I'm expecting to lose the relationship with Tom after today. I've already come in with that.\"\n\nThe actor and comedian added, \"Tom knows I love him. He knows all my stuff is coming from a place of fun and good heart, but I do have a job to do. I have a job to do.\"\n\nThe roast also brought out famous faces and friends close to the former Tampa Bay Buccaneers star, including Kim Kardashian -- who was met with boos from the audience -- and Ben Affleck -- who recently starred in a Dunkin' commercial with Brady.\n\nOn the red carpet, the seven-time Super Bowl champion admitted to ET that he was \"not prepared\" for the jokes that were about to come his way -- but with teenagers at home, he has some thick skin.\n\n\"I'm just their dad, so everything I do is lame and, you know, there's nothing I do that's right,\" Brady said with a laugh. \"But it's fun being a dad. I've got some great kids.\"\n\nBrady shares 14-year-old son Benjamin and 11-year-old daughter Vivian with B\u00fcndchen. He's also dad to 16-year-old son Jack, from a previous relationship with Bridget Moynahan.\n\n\"I'm gonna obviously hope they don't tune in tonight because there's gonna be way too many things that are inappropriate,\" Brady added, \"but oh well! They'll learn it somehow.\"\n\nBrady also addressed comments he made last month when he said he \"wouldn't be opposed\" to someday making a comeback and playing in the NFL once more. The former NFL quarterback proved to be a good sport as he was roasted about his divorce from Gisele B\u00fcndchen, his appearance, his two retirements, \"deflategate\" and his FTX investment scandal, among many other sore topics.\n\nComedian and notorious \"Roastmaster General\" Jeff Ross served as a producer and kicked off the event, quipping that Brady is as an example to future generations that \"if you work hard, eat right, film the other team's practices, deflate the balls and have the NFL make new rules just for you, then you, too, can be the third most famous guy in a Dunkin Donuts commercial.\"\n\nIn a surprise appearance, Kardashian took to the dais to tease Brady about speculation the two briefly dated last year.\n\n\"I'd never say if we did or not, I'd just release the tape,\" she said, referring to many headlines inspired by recorded scenes in her life.\n\nBoston-native and Brady fan Ben Affleck revealed that while the two were filming a Super Bowl spot, Brady asked the actor and director to look at his social media comments.\n\n\"It was the most toxic thing that I have ever experienced - and that's saying something,\" Affleck joked.\n\n\"That doesn't make you a fan,\" he said to Brady's trolls. \"That makes you a b -- .\"\n\nWill Ferrell appeared as his \"Anchorman\" character Ron Burgundy, calling Brady a \"true Patriot until he was not, of course,\" and joking that it took B\u00fcndchen \"13 years to learn what we all know: Tom is boring.\"\n\nBrady and B\u00fcndchen's divorce was fodder for many bits throughout the night, with Brady frequently shown sipping his beverage whenever it was mentioned. The former couple jointly announced in October 2022 that they were parting ways.\n\nRob Gronkwoski, Julian Edelman, Randy Moss and Drew Bledsoe, who all played with Brady throughout his career, and former New England Patriots coach Bill Belichick took turns roasting the MVP. Peyton Manning and Patriots owner Robert Kraft also appeared.\n\nGronkowski talked about how \"psyched\" he was to have both Brady and Belichick together, saying, \"everyone thinks you guys hate each other but I saw it firsthand, you two are exactly alike. You're both hardasses that hate fun.\"\n\nComedians Bert Kreischer, Tom Segura, Nikki Glaser, Andrew Schulz, Tony Hinchcliffe and Sam Jay had fun taking their shots, with Glaser joking that Brady was \"the best to ever play for too long.\"\n\nBrady may have seen certain defeat on Sunday but his decades-long NFL career is nothing short of remarkable.\n\nOver the course of his 23-years as the league's leading quarterback, Brady won seven Super Rings - six with the Patriots and one with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers. He is also a five-time Super Bowl MVP and won three NFL MVP awards.\n\nHe first announced his retirement in February 2022. He ended up reversing his decision and returned to the field for one more season with the Buccs before officially retiring last year.\n\nAt the end of the roast, Brady finally had the chance to defend himself, saying that people had asked him why he agreed to do the event.\n\n\"It's simple,\" Brady said. \"I can take all the hits. {"uri": "2024-05-346849053", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "18:42:09", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T18:42:09Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T18:10:42Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7333333492279053, "url": "https://clutchpoints.com/why-was-robert-kraft-joke-the-one-thing-tom-brady-couldnt-handle-at-netflix-roast", "title": "Why was Robert Kraft joke the one thing Tom Brady couldn't handle at Netflix roast?", "body": "Of all the vicious jokes made at Tom Brady's expense in the Netflix roast on Sunday night, Jeff Ross' Robert Kraft jab cut the deepest.\n\nSo, so many things could have gone wrong during a live comedy roast of a notoriously volatile and competitive NFL superstar like Tom Brady that it's almost a letdown that only one moment in particular seemed to set him off. What's even more surprising is that it wasn't one of the vicious barbs made about Brady personally, his ex-wife Gisele B\u00fcndchen or his family that raised his ire -- it was a joke about Patriots owner Robert Kraft.\n\nIt did happen to come from the most savagely infamous roaster of the modern era, Jeff Ross, also known as the Roastmaster General for his many epic takedowns in previous roasts. But nonetheless it was rather stunning that this was the moment Brady felt crossed the line.\n\nFor those who missed it, the most viral clip of Netflix's first of its kind special, The Greatest Roast Of All Time: Tom Brady, centered on Brady getting up from the roastee chair in the middle of Jeff Ross' set to tell him \"Don't say that sh- again.\" Ross nervously laughed it off and said \"Ok, ok...\" before continuing gamely with his roast.\n\nSo what was the joke that caused Brady so much offense on Kraft's behalf? Possibly the easiest of targets from the numerous New England Patriots scandals over the years -- a reference to Robert Kraft's 2019 arrest as part of a prostitution ring in Florida in which he was captured on video paying for sex acts at a day spa.\n\nRoss had an elaborate build up to the joke, talking about Tom Brady confidently strolling into Robert Kraft's office after he was drafted in the sixth round, and telling the powerful businessman and New England Patriots owner, \"I'm the best decision your organization has ever made...\" to the applause of numerous Boston sports fans in attendance. Ross then added, \"Would you like a massage?\" Big audience laughs ensued, except for Brady, who shifted uncomfortably in his seat as he clearly debated whether or not to step in and say something.\n\nWhen Ross' next words after the laughter died down were \"I love Robert Kraft -\" Brady could take it no longer and quickly hopped up to the podium to tell Ross \"Don't say that sh- again,\" which was rather awkwardly picked up by the microphones for all to hear.\n\nWas this the best instant Brady meme since \"You mad bro?\"\n\nThis was instantly the best Brady sure-to-be-meme since his post-game \"You mad bro?\" run-in with Richard Sherman.\n\nThe question is -- why? Why was a joke about his former boss the thing that got under Brady's skin, when so many other cruel things were said about Tom Brady and his family over the course of the evening?\n\nThat's the million dollar question yet to be answered.\n\nBrady sat there patiently enduring vicious slams and references galore to his ex wife, Gisele B\u00fcndchen, and her new jiu-jitsu trainer beau, his past cheating scandals on the Patriots, being an absentee father, his pretty boy superficiality, his falling for a crypto investing fraud scheme, and numerous other biting jabs that might have set off even the most saintly of souls. But head scratchingly (and kind of hearteningly), it was his defense of Robert Kraft that was the one thing that made Tom Brady leave his seat in anger.\n\nMaybe Brady sees Kraft as a grandfather figure and didn't want the old man to get his feelings hurt. Maybe Brady assured Kraft that he wouldn't be subject to the roasters' material and Brady didn't want Kraft to view him as a liar (though that didn't seem to bother Brady during the deflategate scandal).\n\nWhatever the reasoning, Tom Brady felt the need so strongly to defend his former boss Robert Kraft that, for a moment, he broke with roast tradition and etiquette to tell revered roaster Jeff Ross not to \"say that sh- again.\" It was a rather shocking blip on an otherwise freewheeling and fun night. And perhaps if Brady doesn't want Kraft subjected to such jesting in the future, he should tell his wealthy friend to stay away from massage parlors (or at least live public roasts).", "source": {"uri": "8113925925", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "14:03:18", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T14:03:18Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T14:02:47Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7333333492279053, "url": "https://www.whiskeyriff.com/2024/05/06/i-miss-the-love-of-my-life-football-tom-bradys-response-to-his-own-roast-was-worthy-of-goat-status/", "title": "\"I Miss The Love Of My Life... Football\" - Tom Brady's Response To His Own Roast Was Worthy Of GOAT Status", "body": "Ladies and gentlemen... roasts are officially BACK.\n\nThe art of the roast has long been a part of comedy, but it went away for a while only to come storming back. Kind of like when Tom Brady retired, right? And ironically enough, Brady was the center of the live Netflix event \"The Greatest Roast of All Time,\" and it did not disappoint to say the least.\n\nWithout a doubt, it's the most shots that Tom Brady has taken in his entire storied career. Everyone from Kevin Hart to Peyton Manning (and even his own former coach Bill Belichick) took to the podium to tell Tom how they really felt. It was surely somewhat of a rough night for Brady, though he did agree to do it, and there was still plenty of praise for the seven-time Super Bowl winning QB during the roast.\n\nThere were plenty of highlights from the night, whether it was Tom trying to shut down a massage parlor joke early on to former New England Patriots wide receiver Julian Edelman making an unhinged joke about the late Aaron Hernandez. Nothing was off the table during the roast, and it was truly one of the better comedy events that I can remember.\n\nAnd it definitely became memorable when, at the end of the night, Tom Brady got to answer to all of the roasting he had to sit and take for three hours. For those that categorize Brady as lifeless and stiff when it comes to his personality, the NFL great proved people wrong with his own roasting monologue.\n\nHe first got things started with a killer (no pun intended) joke about Patriots tight ends:\n\nThat let people know he wasn't messing around.\n\nTom continued with one of his more bold jokes of the night: Poking the bear that is the \"Swifty\" community. Everyone knows you stay away from Taylor Swift and her fans, but Brady decided to dive right in with this joke about Swift and the Kansas City Chiefs:\n\nLooks like Swifties have a new public enemy number one.\n\nAnd in what could be the most shocking part of Brady's roast response, he seemingly admitted to Deflategate? It was a wild moment, and it garnered a standing ovation from the Kia Forum in Los Angeles, California. Even Bill Belichick stood up when Tom went scorched Earth on the NFL:\n\nObviously, a lot of the jokes through the night targets Tom's good looks (wow, how difficult that must have been), his failed crypto currency investments, and his ex-wife Gisele B\u00fcndchen. Brady pulled a fast one on everybody watching when he started out another of his jokes with this line:\n\n\"There have been a lot of jokes tonight, but I miss the love of my life...football.\"\n\nTom still has that quick release, I see.\n\nAnd before he wrapped things up, Tom even put his former head coach Bill Belichick in the crosshairs. Brady referenced a very \"chronically online\" meme that popped up in the past year, which was a Ring doorbell video that appeared to show Belichick doing a walk of shame:\n\nIt was a really fun night, and Tom Brady handled it with a lot of class... and a lot of nervous laughter. But when it came time for him to answer to everyone else, he did what Tom Brady does and proved that he's one of the best. His double bird exit off the stage paired with a parting shot to all of the haters was pretty tasteful as well:", "source": {"uri": "whiskeyriff.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Whiskey Riff"},
