{"uri": "8114013048", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "15:02:36", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T15:02:36Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T15:02:18Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.729411780834198, "url": "https://www.foxsports.com/stories/nfl/best-moments-from-tom-brady-roast", "title": "Bill Belichick, Peyton Manning and the best moments from Tom Brady's roast", "body": "After more than two decades of winning, it was Tom Brady's turn to take the hot seat.\n\nThe iconic quarterback and seven-time Super Bowl winner was roasted in a Netflix special Sunday night titled \"G.R.O.A.T. The Greatest Roast Of All Time: Tom Brady.\"\n\nUnlike many other televised roasts, Brady's roast was live and ran for more than three hours, giving the roasters plenty of time to throw quips at the former quarterback.\n\nSeveral notable names in the football and entertainment worlds made appearances on Sunday as well. Bill Belichick and former New England Patriots players, such as Rob Gronkowski, Julian Edelman, Randy Moss and Drew Bledsoe, were on one side of the dais. On the other side, comedians Jeff Ross, Nikki Glaser and Sam Jay were among those to make jokes at Brady's expense. There were also multiple special appearances, such as Will Ferrell as \"Anchorman\" character Ron Burgundy, Peyton Manning and with Kevin Hart serving as the roast master.\n\nLet's take a look at some of the best moments from Sunday's event.\n\nThe show opened in a similar fashion as Brady's career did. In a pre-taped segment, Belichick pulled Bledsoe aside and let Brady take center stage.\n\n\"It's great seeing you again,\" Belichick said. \"This is a big night. The fans want you. Everyone wants you. But it's not your night. Sorry, Drew.\n\n\"Brady ... You're in, let's go!\"\n\nBledsoe was the first former Patriots player to take the mic, firing off a joke at Belichick's employment status after the show opening.\n\n\"There were rumors Coach Belichick was gonna be here tonight,\" Bledsoe quipped. \"Turns out he has some time on his hands. Look, at least when I was fired somebody else wanted me.\"\n\nEdelman also made a jab at Belichick's inability to land a head coaching gig this offseason.\n\n\"Remember when you used to yell at us, 'Look ---holes, the ----ing kids at Foxborough High can make that ----ing play,'\" Edelman said. \"I've been waiting for this for so long: Look ---hole, Foxborough High is the only job offer you ----ing had.\n\n\"Do your job? More like, need a job, coach.\"\n\nEdelman's joke got a hearty laugh out of Belichick and some claps.\n\nPatriots owner Robert Kraft also made jokes on Sunday night even though he wasn't on the dais, taking the mic while in the audience. One of his jokes centered on the possible awkwardness between him and the former head coach of his football team.\n\n\"Like many family reunions, there's some people I'm desperately trying to avoid,\" Kraft said. \"Coach Belichick, good to see you. You really look debonair in sleeves.\"\n\nArguably the most memorable part of the roast didn't involve Brady at all. Shortly after Kraft made a handful of jokes, Hart called the Patriots owner to come up to the dais and take a shot with Belichick. While it looked awkward, the two eventually took a shot together, but not before Kraft shared a message.\n\n\"I want to say this is the greatest coach in the history of the game that did what no one else has done,\" Kraft said. \"And having Tom Brady and him was the greatest honor the good Lord gave me.\"\n\nBelichick and Kraft mutually agreed to end their working relationship after 24 seasons in January. While Belichick's tenure with the Patriots is arguably the best ever for a coach in NFL history with six Super Bowl titles, Kraft recommended the Atlanta Falcons not to hire his former head coach this offseason, according to a report from ESPN in April.\n\nThe former Patriots coach had jokes for nearly everyone involved in the roast, expressing how happy he was that he wasn't the center subject of the event.\n\n\"It's an honor to be here at the roast of Tom Brady on Netflix,\" Belichick said. \"It's not to be confused with the roast of Bill Belichick on the 10-part Apple TV series.\"\n\nBelichick also roasted former players.\n\n\"A lot of people connect me to the saying, 'Do your job,' and telling people to do their job,\" Belichick said. \"Gronk, I've been watching you on FOX NFL Sunday, and I'm begging you: Stop doing your job. Do another job. Do somebody else's job!\"\n\nHis roast of Gronkowski didn't end there.\n\n\"Rob landed some endorsement deals with some of his favorite foods,\" Belichick said. \"Campbell's soup, Dunkin Donuts, and don't forget Tide Pods. One-hundred percent true story: I used Rob's Tide Pod commercial to teach our team that this is when you say no. Just because somebody asks you to do something stupid, you don't have to do it. Say no!\"\n\nBelichick also took aim at a few other former Patriots players, including Danny Amendola.\n\n\"Danny Amendola up here on the stage, he came with us,\" Belichick said. \"Danny joined us in 2014 and got us 200 yards that year. Then in 2016, he picked up another 250. Or to put it another way, what Randy [Moss] would call a decent first half.\"\n\nBelichick also roasted the roast master.\n\n\"Whenever Kevin talks I go into a Cover 2 defense: Cover both ears.\"\n\nThe coach also made a self-deprecating joke about his demeanor.\n\n\"The fellas invited me up here to lighten the mood tonight.\"\n\nBelichick gave his take on who was more responsible for the Patriots' dynasty on Sunday.\n\n\"For all of you out there that think about who's responsible for the Patriots' success during the time when Tom and I were there, was it Brady? Was it me? Was it Brady? Was it me? In reality, the truth of the matter is, it was both of us -- because of me.\"\n\nBrady made sure to point out, though, that he won a Super Bowl after leaving the Patriots in 2020.\n\n\"I've been out of the game for a minute, so I'm curious, how many Super Bowl rings have you won since I left?\" Brady said, looking toward Belichick. \"Maybe it's not just the guy on the sideline. When I go to the Indy 500, I don't ask the winning driver, 'Hey, who gassed up your car?'\"\n\nThe rivalry between Brady and Manning went from the gridiron to the dais on Sunday, with each tossing a few jokes at each other.\n\n\"Honestly, it is great to be here with a bunch of people sitting around talking smack about Tom Brady,\" Manning said in one joke about Brady. \"Or as we call that in the Manning family: Thanksgiving.\"\n\n\"For those who don't know, Coach [Belichick is going to do some work on Eli [Manning] and my Monday Night Football show this year,\" Belichick added in another. \"Eli and I are super excited, and it's going to give Coach Belichick something he hasn't had in awhile: The chance to be around quarterbacks he respects.\"\n\nBrady's jokes at Manning focused on how the Hall of Fame quarterback typically played second fiddle to him.\n\n\"I know sometimes you live in Denver, and sometimes you live in Louisiana,\" Brady said in one joke. \"But you will always live in my shadow.\"\n\nHart opened the night by joking that Joe Montana was really the \"GOAT\" while Bledsoe made a pair of cracks at Brady's demeanor toward speaking with referees.\n\nMoss, meanwhile, was more upset that he wasn't able to win a ring with Brady during their time together in New England.\n\n\"Why the ---- didn't we cheat when I was there?\" Moss jokingly asked.\n\nEdelman made a crack at Brady's look.\n\n\"When we played together, Tom, you used to scream, 'Laser focus! Laser focus!' Now that's what he screams at his plastic surgeon,\" Edelman said. \"Who's laughing now Tom? Not you, because your face can't move and you don't have a sense of humor.\"\n\nGronkowski also made jokes about Brady, but celebrated afterward by getting Belichick and the former quarterback to take a shot with him. Of course, Gronkowski spiked his shot glass after.\n\nKraft made a joke about Brady's impending deal to become a part owner of the Las Vegas Raiders.\n\n\"Tommy, good luck buying the Raiders,\" Kraft said. \"They already did your favorite thing -- get rid of Jimmy Garoppolo.\"", "source": {"uri": "foxsports.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "FOX Sports"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": {"uri": "8113714464", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "11:44:33", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T11:44:33Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T11:44:13Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.729411780834198, "url": "https://www.boston.com/culture/entertainment/2024/05/06/tom-brady-roast-netflix-best-jokes/", "title": "The best jokes from Netflix's Tom Brady roast  --  that we can actually publish", "body": "Nothing was off limits during the three-hour roast of Tom Brady, which aired live on Netflix Sunday night, and featured appearances from Bill Belichick, Kevin Hart, Peyton Manning, Ben Affleck, Kim Kardashian, and more.\n\nLeading up to Netflix's roast of Tom Brady on Sunday night, there were a lot of unanswered questions. Which celebrities would show up to roast the G.O.A.T.? Would the panel of assembled comedians treat Brady with kid gloves, or would they unleash every weapon in their arsenal? And which of Brady's former teammates would actually be funny?\n\nAs it turns out, \"G.R.O.A.T. The Greatest Roast Of All Time: Tom Brady\" was a surprisingly profane, no-holds-barred roast featuring one-liners that would get most people fired from their jobs.\n\nClocking in at just over three hours, the roast was filled to the brim with jokes about Brady, his divorce, his ex-wife's new romance, his vanity, his awful business decisions, his complex relationship with Bill Belichick, and so much more.\n\nThe evening called to mind the ill-fated 2017 roast of David Ortiz, which was filmed at the House of Blues and was supposed to be televised on NESN but never aired -- likely because the material was deemed too inappropriate for basic cable.\n\nBut Netflix is not basic cable, which means viewers were treated to some truly outrageous moments, including:\n\n-- Julian Edelman talking in graphic detail about deflating Tom Brady's balls\n\n-- Rob Gronkowski setting a new record for genitalia jokes per minute\n\n-- Brady comparing Drew Bledsoe's injury to 9/11\n\n-- Nearly every roaster making an Aaron Hernandez joke, including several of his former teammates\n\n-- Will Ferrell, in character as Ron Burgundy from \"Anchorman,\" leading the crowd in a chant about Brady being Eli Manning's b****\n\n-- Brady, Belichick, and Robert Kraft taking a shot together (though Belichick looked considerably less happy than he did for much of the night)\n\nFollowing roast host Kevin Hart, who opened the ceremonies and kept things light throughout the evening with his cheerful frequent refrain of \"f*** you Tom,\" more than a dozen comedians, celebrities, and Patriots greats stood at the dais and took the G.O.A.T. to the woodshed.\n\nSome of the roasters were in top form, particularly comedians Nikki Glaser, Jeff Ross, and Boston native Sam Jay.\n\nOf the athletes who participated, Edelman, Bledsoe, and Peyton Manning probably acquitted themselves best. Others, like Randy Moss, didn't quite have the roast cadence down pat.\n\nOne of the bigger disappointments of the night was Ben Affleck. The Cambridge native seemed unclear on the fact that roasts are supposed to zing the people in the room, instead spending his five minutes ripping a faceless (and seemingly apocryphal) online commenter. Even Kim Kardashian, who was booed by many in the room when she initially took the stage, fired off more actual jokes than Affleck.\n\nThe most pleasant surprise of the night was undoubtedly Belichick. The famously dour coach not only delivered withering one-liners with a wry smile, but even addressed the Apple TV+ \"The Dynasty\" series, which many saw as an attack on his reputation. Not to be outdone, Robert Kraft fired off a few jokes from the audience, addressing the tension.\n\nFor all of its chaotic energy, the Netflix roast of Tom Brady is absolutely worth watching, and is already available streaming on Netflix for those who missed it.\n\nBut if you're stuck at work and aren't able to watch some of the more off-color bits, here are 19 of the best jokes from the Tom Brady roast that our editor will let us publish.\n\n\"Gisele gave you an ultimatum. Gisele said, 'You retire or we're done.' [...] Lemme tell you something: When you got a chance to go 8-9 and all it'll cost you is your wife and kids, you gotta do what the f*** you gotta do.\" -- Kevin Hart\n\n\"Give it up for the Lord of the Super Bowl Rings, my friend Tom Brady. A man who has so many rings he could melt them down and forge a sword to go on a quest to get Gisele back from that jiu-jitsu teacher.\" -- Jeff Ross\n\n\"Tom Brady. Five-time Super Bowl MVP, most career wins, most career touchdowns. You have seven rings -- well, eight, now that Gisele gave hers back. The only thing dumber than saying yes to this roast was when you said, 'Hey babe, you should try jiu-jitsu.'\" -- Nikki Glaser\n\n\"There's been a lot of jokes tonight, but the truth is I miss the love of my life -- football.\" -- Tom Brady\n\nTom, I wanted you to be our first G.O.A.T. to be roasted, because you're an example to future generations. if you work hard, eat right, film the other team's practices, deflate the balls and have the NFL make new rules just for you, you too can be the third-most famous guy in a Dunkin Donuts commercial.\" -- Jeff Ross\n\n\"I started a winery. It's called Doubleback. It's named after what Tom does every time he walks past a mirror.\" -- Drew Bledsoe\n\n\"You retired, then you came back, and then you retired again. I mean I get it, it's hard to walk away from something that's not your pregnant girlfriend.\" -- Nikki Glaser\n\n\"When we played together, Tom, you used to scream, 'Laser focus! Laser focus!' Now that's what he screams at his plastic surgeon. Who's laughing now Tom? Not you, because your face can't move and you don't have a sense of humor.\" -- Julian Edelman\n\n\"People said that Tom and I butted heads a lot. In a way that was true, but not really. It was hard to butt heads with Tom because his was so far up Alex Guerrero's a**.\" -- Bill Belichick\n\n\"Tom is making a donation to every one of his former teammates' charities that came here tonight. And I gotta tell you, Tom, that is first class. Hey fellas, don't let him pay you in crypto.\" -- Peyton Manning\n\n\"The fellas invited me up here to lighten the mood tonight.\" -- Bill Belichick\n\n\"I'm so honored to be here for the roast of Tom Brady on Netflix. That's not to be confused with The Roast of Bill Belichick, the ten-part Apple TV series.\" -- Bill Belichick\n\n\"A lot of people connect me to the saying, \"Do your job,' and telling people to do their job. Gronk, I've been watching you on FOX NFL Sunday, and I'm begging you: Stop doing your job. Do another job. Do somebody else's job!\" -- Bill Belichick\n\nFor those who don't know, Coach is going to do some work on Eli and my Monday Night Football show this year. [...] Eli and I are super excited, and it's going to give Coach Belichick something he hasn't had in awhile: The chance to be around quarterbacks he respects.\" -- Peyton Manning\n\n\"Like many family reunions, there's some people I'm desperately trying to avoid. Coach Belichick, good to see you. You really look debonair in sleeves.\" -- Robert Kraft\n\n\"Tom brought Boston with him tonight. Goddamn. I've never seen Inglewood so white. It's so f****** white in here. It looks like a Bruce Springsteen concert just let out.\" -- Kevin Hart\n\n\"This is pretty f****** ballsy of you. Is life too f****** good? You're like, you know what, I want somebody to kick my a** for three hours. This settles it: You won't see me volunteering for the Ben Affleck Roast. Or as I like to call it, Thursday.\" -- Ben Affleck\n\n\"Despite everything we've seen here tonight, Gronk was actually useful on the field. Although the bar for Patriots tight ends was pretty low back then: Block, catch, don't murder.\" -- Tom Brady\n\n\"People ask, 'Tom, why would you do this roast now?' It's simple: I can take the hits. I would've done this earlier, but I've just been too busy winning championships. Which explains why Peyton did this roast 8 years ago.\" -- Tom Brady", "source": {"uri": "boston.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Boston"}, "authors": [{"uri": "kevin_slane@boston.com", "name": {"uri": "8113251054", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "06:26:20", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T06:26:20Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T06:25:48Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.729411780834198, "url": "https://www.opinionnigeria.com/in-netflixs-the-greatest-roast-of-all-time-rob-gronkowski-kim-kardashian-and-others-roast-tom-brady/", "title": "In Netflix's \"The Greatest Roast of All Time,\" Rob Gronkowski, Kim Kardashian, and others roast Tom Brady - Opinion Nigeria", "body": "Ben Affleck, a Boston native and supporter of Brady, disclosed that during the Super Bowl production, Brady urged the director and actor to have a look at his remarks on social media.\n\nOn Sunday, Tom Brady was subjected to some serious criticism from comedians, his former teammates, and even Kim Kardashian at Netflix's \"The Greatest Roast of All Time.\"\n\nNetflix aired the \"GROAT\" special live, with Kevin Hart serving as host. The former NFL quarterback showed that he was a good sport when he was ridiculed for a variety of sensitive subjects, including his appearance, his two retirements, his divorce from Gisele B\u00fcndchen, \"deflategate,\" and his FTX investment controversy.\n\nAs the event's producer and comedian, Jeff Ross -- better known as the \"Roastmaster General\" -- kicked things off by saying that Brady should serve as an example to future generations of how, \"you too can be the third most famous guy in a Dunkin Donuts commercial if you work hard, eat right, film the other team's practices, deflate the balls, and have the NFL make new rules just for you.\"\n\nKardashian made an unexpected appearance on the dais and teased Brady about rumours that the two had a brief relationship last year.\n\nShe made reference to several headlines that were based on clips from her life, saying, \"I'd never say if we did or not, I'd just release the tape.\"\n\nBen Affleck, a Boston native and supporter of Brady, disclosed that during the Super Bowl production, Brady urged the director and actor to have a look at his remarks on social media.\n\n\"It was the most toxic thing that I have ever experienced - and that's saying something,\" Affleck joked.\n\n\"That doesn't make you a fan,\" he said to Brady's trolls. \"That makes you a b -- .\"\n\nWill Ferrell appeared as his \"Anchorman\" character Ron Burgundy, calling Brady a \"true Patriot until he was not, of course,\" and joking that it took B\u00fcndchen \"13 years to learn what we all know: Tom is boring.\"\n\nThroughout the evening, several jokes made reference to Brady and B\u00fcndchen's divorce, with Brady regularly seen drinking his drink. Together, the former couple declared their separation in October 2022.\n\nFormer New England Patriots coach Bill Belichick, along with teammates Rob Gronkowski, Julian Edelman, Randy Moss, and Drew Bledsoe, took turns making fun of the MVP. Robert Kraft, the owner of the Patriots, and Peyton Manning were also present.\n\nSpeaking on how \"psyched\" he was to having Brady and Belichick together, Gronkowski remarked, \"I witnessed firsthand how much you two are same, despite everyone's perceptions to the contrary. Both of you are jerks who detest having fun.\n\nComedians Nikki Glaser, Andrew Schulz, Tony Hinchcliffe, Tom Segura, Bert Kreischer, and Sam Jay enjoyed themselves while delivering their skits. Glaser made a joke about Brady being \"the best to ever play for too long.\"\n\nBrady's NFL career has been nothing short of extraordinary, despite the fact that he saw inevitable defeat on Sunday.\n\nBrady was the top quarterback in the NFL for 23 years, during which time he won seven Super Rings: six with the Patriots and one with the Tampa Bay Bucs. Moreover, he has won five Super Bowl MVP and won three NFL MVP awards.\n\nHe first announced his retirement in February 2022. He ended up reversing his decision and returned to the field for one more season with the Buccs before officially retiring last year.\n\nAt the end of the roast, Brady finally had the chance to defend himself, saying that people had asked him why he agreed to do the event.\n\n\"It's simple,\" Brady said. \"I can take all the hits. Kevin Hart and Drew Bledsoe completely destroy Tom Brady over Gisele Bundchen divorce: 'She f***ed that karate man'\n\nAfter coaching Tom Brady for the majority of his career, Bill Belichick probably felt he earned the right to take a few proverbial swings at his former quarterback after attending the Netflix show roasting the quarterback icon.\n\nAt the 'The Roast of Tom Brady', a series of comedians and people close to Brady stepped up onto the stage to mock the 46-year-old, with 'Deflategate' and his divorce from Gisele Bundchen some of the more sensitive topics joked about.\n\nBelichick, who together with Brady won the Super Bowl on six occasions during their 22-year spell at the Patriots, made a surprise appearance at the roast after being introduced by Will Ferrell, who was in character as Ron Burgundy.\n\nDuring their career, Brady and Belichick were notorious for being stubborn and the veteran boss admitted they sometimes \"butted heads\", referencing his close friendship with Alex Guerrero - a medical practitioner who Brady referred to as his \"body coach\" and \"body engineer\" - as a tense discussion topic.\n\n\"In a way that was true, but not really. It was hard to butt heads with Tom because he was so far up Alex Guerrero's ass,\" Belichick joked.\n\nThe former Patriots coach, 71, set the record straight in his 10-minute stint to decide once and for all who was responsible for leading their domination, before his exit at the end of the 2023 regular season.\n\n\"For all of you out there that think about who's responsible for the Patriots' success during the time that Tom and I were there,\" Belichick said. \"Was it Brady? Was it me? Was it Brady? Was it me? In reality, the truth of the matter is, it was both of us because of me.\"\n\nHis joke prompted laughter from the audience, before he served up another classic one-liner - mocking Brady's investment {"uri": "8113644405", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "10:58:20", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T10:58:20Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T10:57:59Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7254902124404907, "url": "https://whdh.com/entertainment/tom-brady-gets-roasted-by-rob-gronkowski-kim-kardashian-and-more-in-netflixs-the-greatest-roast-of-all-time/", "title": "Tom Brady gets roasted by Rob Gronkowski, Kim Kardashian and more in Netflix's 'The Greatest Roast of All Time' - Boston News, Weather, Sports | WHDH 7News", "body": "(CNN) -- Tom Brady took some major hits by his former teammates, comedians and even Kim Kardashian during Netflix's \"The Greatest Roast of All Time\" on Sunday.\n\nThe \"GROAT\" special was hosted by Kevin Hart and live-streamed on Netflix. The former NFL quarterback proved to be a good sport as he was roasted about his divorce from Gisele B\u00fcndchen, his appearance, his two retirements, \"deflategate\" and his FTX investment scandal, among many other sore topics.\n\nComedian and notorious \"Roastmaster General\" Jeff Ross served as a producer and kicked off the event, quipping that Brady is as an example to future generations that \"if you work hard, eat right, film the other team's practices, deflate the balls and have the NFL make new rules just for you, then you, too, can be the third most famous guy in a Dunkin Donuts commercial.\"\n\nIn a surprise appearance, Kardashian took to the dais to tease Brady about speculation the two briefly dated last year.\n\n\"I'd never say if we did or not, I'd just release the tape,\" she said, referring to many headlines inspired by recorded scenes in her life.\n\nBoston-native and Brady fan Ben Affleck revealed that while the two were filming a Super Bowl spot, Brady asked the actor and director to look at his social media comments.\n\n\"It was the most toxic thing that I have ever experienced - and that's saying something,\" Affleck joked.\n\n\"That doesn't make you a fan,\" he said to Brady's trolls. \"That makes you a b -- .\"\n\nWill Ferrell appeared as his \"Anchorman\" character Ron Burgundy, calling Brady a \"true Patriot until he was not, of course,\" and joking that it took B\u00fcndchen \"13 years to learn what we all know: Tom is boring.\"\n\nBrady and B\u00fcndchen's divorce was fodder for many bits throughout the night, with Brady frequently shown sipping his beverage whenever it was mentioned. The former couple jointly announced in October 2022 that they were parting ways.\n\nRob Gronkwoski, Julian Edelman, Randy Moss and Drew Bledsoe, who all played with Brady throughout his career, and former New England Patriots coach Bill Belichick took turns roasting the MVP. Peyton Manning and Patriots owner Robert Kraft also appeared.\n\nGronkowski talked about how \"psyched\" he was to have both Brady and Belichick together, saying, \"everyone thinks you guys hate each other but I saw it firsthand, you two are exactly alike. You're both hardasses that hate fun.\"\n\nComedians Bert Kreischer, Tom Segura, Nikki Glaser, Andrew Schulz, Tony Hinchcliffe and Sam Jay had fun taking their shots, with Glaser joking that Brady was \"the best to ever play for too long.\"\n\nBrady may have seen certain defeat on Sunday but his decades-long NFL career is nothing short of remarkable.\n\nOver the course of his 23-years as the league's leading quarterback, Brady won seven Super Rings - six with the Patriots and one with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers. He is also a five-time Super Bowl MVP and won three NFL MVP awards.\n\nHe first announced his retirement in February 2022. He ended up reversing his decision and returned to the field for one more season with the Buccs before officially retiring last year.\n\nAt the end of the roast, Brady finally had the chance to defend himself, saying that people had asked him why he agreed to do the event.\n\n\"It's simple,\" Brady said. \"I can take all the hits. I would have done this earlier but I've been too busy winning championships.\"\n\n(Copyright (c) 2024 CNN. All Rights Reserved. "https://whdh.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2024/05/DNR-tom.png", "originalArticle": null, "storyUri": "eng-9541551", "eventUri": "eng-9541551", "location": null, "extractedDates": null, "sentiment": {"uri": "8113993191", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "14:48:27", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T14:48:27Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T14:48:04Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7215686440467834, "url": "https://www.pajiba.com/tv_reviews/netflix-attempts-to-bring-back-the-roast-at-tom-bradys-expense.php", "title": "Netflix Attempts to Bring Back the Roast at Tom Brady's Expense", "body": "As alluded to earlier, Netflix held its first live roast this week, The Greatest Roast of All Time, a three-hour skewering of former New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady by his former teammates, professional comedians, and even his former coach Bill Belichick (interestingly, though he played for the Tampa Bay Bucs for three seasons at the end of his career and even won one Super Bowl, the Bucs were not even an afterthought).\n\nThere were apparently no jokes off limits during the roast, whether Tom Brady realized it going in or not. For instance, his divorce from Gisele B\u00fcndchen was a frequent subject of ridicule -- Kevin Hart and Nikki Glaser went particularly hard -- \"You have seven rings -- well, eight now that Giselle gave hers back,\" or \"the only thing dumber than you saying yes to this roast was saying yes to Gisele doing jiu-jitsu,\" a reference to the jiu-jitsu instructor with whom B\u00fcndchen is in a relationship. Even Drew Bledsoe, the quarterback Tom Brady replaced back in 2001, went there, joking, \"I have experienced a couple of things that you will never experience. The feeling of being the number one overall draft pick in the NFL and a 28th wedding anniversary.\"\n\nNikki Glaser even went where I suspect even Brady's closest friends would never go: His ex-girlfriend Bridget Moynahan, who was pregnant with Brady's child when he left her for B\u00fcndchen. \"Tom, you're the best to ever play for too long. You retired, then came back, then retired; I get it. It's hard to walk away from something that isn't your pregnant girlfriend. To be fair, he didn't know; he just thought she was getting fat.\"\n\nIn addition to jokes at the expense of Brady's divorce, there were a number of jokes made about former Patriot Aaron Hernandez, who hung himself in prison after being convicted of murder. \"Everyone always asks me how big [Rob Gronkowski's] dick is,\" Julian Edelman joked. \"Now don't get me wrong, it gets the job done. But there was this other Patriots tight end. Now he was hung.\"\n\nAmong others making appearances as roasters was Will Ferrell -- as his Anchorman character, Ron Burgundy -- who led the crowd into a chant of, \"Tom Brady is Eli Manning's bitch,\" and Brady's former coach, Bill Belichick, who delivered one of the colder jokes of the night. \"People have said it -- Tom and I butted heads a lot. And in a way that was true. But it was hard to butt heads with Tom -- because he was so far up Alex Guerrero's ass,\" he joked, referencing Brady's athletic trainer who turned him onto his bizarre diet. Belichick, famously, at one point had Guerrero banned from the locker room because of the negative influence he felt that the trainer was having on Brady, or as Edelman put it: \"Alex Guerrero is the snake oil salesman that turned Tom into a complete weirdo.\" (Guerrero was in the audience).\n\nRandy Moss took aim at the two scandals that plagued Brady and the Patriots dynasty, Spygate and Deflategate, which came before Moss arrived and after he departed, during a three-year period in which the Pats did not win a Super Bowl ring. \"I only got one question for you, Tom: 'Why the fuck didn't we cheat when I was there?! I wanted to cheat, too.\"\n\nBrady's friend, actor Ben Affleck, also appeared, though he did very little roasting of Brady, opting instead to defend him in what is being characterized as something of a manic speech that ended with Affleck mimicking the oral sex he would give Brady if he were lucky enough to be his coach. Peyton Manning was the last speaker, and while his jokes were successful, he did not hit below the belt, opting mostly to stick to football.\n\nAs is often the case with roasts, which have fallen out of fashion in recent years, there were also some dark jokes, such as when Julian Edelman joked about what he had in common with Jeff Ross: being Jewish. \"When people look at me, they think, 'Oh, he's Jewish?' But Jeff is the kind of Jew that makes you want to join Hamas.\" Brady also made a 9/11 joke at the expense of Drew Bledsoe, whose job Brady took after Bledsoe was badly injured during a game with the New York Jets. \"I'll always remember where I was on that fateful day in September 2001 when two Jets slammed into Drew Bledsoe.\"\n\nThe ceremony ultimately ended with Brady taking the dais to insult all those who came before him. Brady, who has never exhibited much of a sense of humor, delivered his insults with a mix of arrogance and cringe, essentially claiming to be immune from their jokes because he has been so successful in his career.\n\n\"I've been out of the game for a minute, so I'm curious,\" Brady said, turning to Belichick, \"how many Super Bowls have you won since I left? ... When I go to the Indy 500, I don't ask, 'Hey, who gassed up your car.'\" In a joke that's not likely to sit well with the NFL, Brady also joked that the league spent $20 million to investigate Deflategate, saying they could have saved the $20 million and given it to him \"and I would've just told you I fucking did it.\"\n\nThe roast's success, largely due to a few standout comedians such as Glaser and Sam Jay (but notably not Jeff Ross or Burt Kreischer), may prove difficult for Netflix to replicate in future attempts. Tom Brady was an ideal subject for roasting, given his long history of scandal and controversy that he has never publicly addressed in an honest manner. This dynamic created moments of uncomfortable viewing, which often contributes to the most successful aspects of roasts. It is difficult to envision another celebrity of Tom Brady's stature allowing their personal lives to be subjected to such vicious scrutiny. The caliber of stars roasted on Comedy Central for 14 seasons, primarily washed-up celebrities like Charlie Sheen and Roseanne Barr who presented as overly easy targets, would likely fail to attract a comparable audience or interest, which may mean the title of Brady's Roast may ultimately be befitting for Netflix: The Greatest Roast of All Time. It's hard to imagine anyone even wanting to compete.", "source": {"uri": "pajiba.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Pajiba"}, "authors": [{"uri": "dustin_rowles@pajiba.com", "name": "Dustin Rowles", {"uri": "8113086972", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "03:46:02", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T03:46:02Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T03:45:05Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7215686440467834, "url": "https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/other-sports/american-sports/furious-tom-brady-confronts-netflix-32742535", "title": "Furious Tom Brady confronts Netflix Roast presenter over joke that went too far", "body": "Tom Brady was the subject of a Netflix Roast, with the likes of Kevin Hart, Bill Belichick and Robert Kraft all in attendance, but one joke did not go down well with the quarterback\n\nFormer NFL quarterback Tom Brady was left fuming after a joke went too far during his Netflix Roast.\n\nThe seven-time Super Bowl champion was the star of what was dubbed as the 'Greatest Roast Of All Time', which kicked off with a bang thanks to host Kevin Hart. The actor and comedian didn't hold back, taking jabs at Brady's career and his well-publicised split from Gisele Bundchen.\n\nHowever, it was Jeff Ross who took things up a notch. One particular joke seemed to hit a nerve with Brady, prompting the ex-New England Patriots quarterback to stand up and warn Ross not to repeat it. The joke revolved around Brady's arrival at the Patriots in 2000.\n\nREAD MORE: New York Jets' NFL Draft pick makes bold Aaron Rodgers prediction after joining team\n\nREAD MORE: SNL presenter sends apology to Taylor Swift over sharing bed with Kansas City Chiefs' Travis Kelce\n\nRoss, discussing Brady's draft where he was famously picked at 199th, quipped: \"So, Tom became a Patriot, moved up to New England, and on the first day of training camp the scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said 'I'm the best decision your organisation has ever made...would you like a massage?'.\"\n\nBrady, breaking his silence, stood up and confronted Ross, warning: \"Don't say that ---- again. \" Ross immediately raised his hands in surrender and responded: \"OK, OK.\" He then added: \"He's [Kraft] having fun, look at him.\"\n\nKraft was indeed present at the Los Angeles Forum, taking the joke in stride. The evening wrapped up on a positive note with Ross and Brady hugging it out after his section, which Hart playfully mocked.\n\nTom Brady's Netflix Roast didn't hold back\n\nThe Patriots' legacy was well represented; Bill Belichick also attended and even joined in the fun, humorously 'benching' Drew Bledsoe in a skit. Belichick quipped to Bledsoe during the act, \"It's great seeing you again. This is a big night. The fans want you. Everyone wants you. But it's not your night. Sorry Drew. Brady, you're in!\"\n\nThe sketch paid homage to Brady's rise over Bledsoe as the Patriots' quarterback. However, Bledsoe had his moment for a witty comeback. On stage, he remarked: \"The last time I was up on stage before Tom Brady, I ended up in the hospital for five days and I lost my damn job.\"\n\nBledsoe continued with a mix of jest and earnest: \"Real talk, a lot of people just assumed that I have a lot of animosity toward Tom Brady. I'm here to tell you tonight in front of millions of people that you're correct. I hate him. But let's just be honest, a lot of you guys kind of hate him too. I mean, who is more hateable than the most successful quarterback of all time? {"uri": "2024-05-346914581", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "20:12:13", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T20:12:13Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T12:48:14Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7176470756530762, "url": "https://washingtonpost.com/sports/2024/05/06/tom-brady-roast-netflix/", "title": "All the best burns from Netflix's Tom Brady roast", "body": "Comedians, former teammates, rivals and a Kardashian took their best shots at Tom Brady Sunday night in the live Netflix \"Roast of Tom Brady,\" spewing zingers over more than three hours in the Kia Forum in Inglewood, Calif.\n\nIn the end, Brady proved to be \"unroastable,\" as he had promised during a promo for the show, but it wasn't for a lack of trying by, among others, host Kevin Hart, Jeff Ross, Nikki Glaser, Kim Kardashian for some reason, Ben Affleck for obvious reasons, former coach Bill Belichick, and former teammates Rob Gronkowski, Julian Edelman and Randy Moss. Brady's decades-long NFL career offered a rich tableau of roastable nuggets - his divorce from Gisele B\u00fcndchen (and her jujitsu instructor), Spygate, Deflategate, his TB12 diet and relationship with his friend/\"body coach\" Alex Guerrero (\"the snake oil salesman that turned Tom into a complete weirdo,\" as Edelman put it).\n\nBrady's journey from 199th draft pick to Roast City began when he replaced injured New England Patriots quarterback Drew Bledsoe in 2001, so it seemed appropriate to let Bledsoe - the former Washington State quarterback who was drafted No. 1 in 1993 - take the first shots. \"A lot of people assume I have a lot of animosity toward Tom Brady,\" he said, \"so I'm here tonight in front of millions of people to tell you - they're correct.\"\n\nHere's a rundown of some of the best lines (minus most of the profanity):\n\nMoss, who never won a ring with Brady: \"I'll tell you what you deflated: my legacy. I want my ring ... Drew Bledsoe was in the freakin' hospital, and he has a Super Bowl ring. Nate Ebner - who ... is Nate Ebner? - he has three Super Bowl rings.\"\n\nGronkowski on Brady and Belichick, noting that both hate fun: \"You both live and breathe football. Neither of you are married anymore. You're both even divorced from football - and both of you take full credit for the dynasty.\"\n\nBelichick: \"Really, Tom, why are all these people so hard on you? Do you miss me?\"\n\nPatriots owner Robert Kraft spoke of Brady's interest in becoming part owner of the Las Vegas Raiders and his reported feelings about a former teammate: \"Tom, good luck buying the Raiders. They did your favorite thing for you already - they got rid of Jimmy Garoppolo.\"\n\nPeyton Manning, calling Brady a three-time Super Bowl loser: \"My [golf] handicap is 6.4, while Tom's handicap is blowing leads in the Super Bowl to my brother, Eli.\"\n\nEli Manning chimed in Monday morning on X: \"I thought about attending the Roast of Tom Brady last night, but I did not want to roast him for a 3rd time!!\"\n\nKraft: \"Vladimir Putin if you're watching, give me my ... [Super Bowl XXXIX] ring back.\"\n\nAs roasts do, this one turned into a free-for-all in which no one escaped unscathed, although Brady seemed to tell comedian Jeff Ross to back off the massage jokes concerning Kraft. But if you thought perhaps there would be no cracks about the late Aaron Hernandez and murder or CTE, you were sadly mistaken. And you probably didn't foresee the night's star turn by a smiling, laughing, relaxed ... Belichick, who seemed to enjoy taunts about his inability to find a coaching job since parting with New England in January.\n\n\"Remember when you used to yell at us, 'Look ... the ... kids down at Foxboro High can make that ... play!\" Edelman recalled. \"Well ... Foxboro High is the only job offer you have! ... Do your job? More like need a job, coach.\"\n\nBledsoe had a rip for Belichick, too: \"Turns out he has some time on his hands. At least when I got fired, somebody else wanted me.\"\n\nBut Belichick didn't take it sitting down. \"It's an honor to be at the roast of Tom Brady on Netflix tonight,\" he said. \"It's not to be confused with the 10-part Bill Belichick roast during the Apple TV documentary.\" Known for his \"do your job\" mantra to players, he begged Gronk, who now appears on Fox's NFL broadcasts, to \"please stop doing your job.\"\n\nIt felt a little like a Patriots dynasty family reunion for Kraft and, he said, \"like many family reunions, there are some people I'm desperately trying to avoid - Coach Belichick, good to see you. You really look debonair in sleeves.\"\n\nBut the night, and the last words, belonged to Brady (or Brady's writers):\n\nAbout those deflated balls: \"The NFL spent $20 million and found that it was more 'probable' than not, that I was 'generally' aware that someone may have deflated my footballs. You could've just given me the $20 mil and I would've just told you I ... did it.\"\n\nOn the Peyton Manning rivalry: \"I know sometimes you live in Denver, and sometimes you live in Louisiana. But you will always live in my shadow.\"\n\nOn his interest in being part owner of the Raiders: \"I'm tired of owning just the Colts and the Bills.\"\n\nOn the Chiefs and Taylor Swift: \"Kansas City, you say your stadium is the loudest. It helps when your fans are 14-year-old girls ... in honor of TAY TAY ... Let's take a look at the Chiefs' eras; Terrible for 50 years, good for five. SHAKE IT OFF.\"\n\nAnd to Belichick: \"I've been out of the game for a minute, so I'm curious. How many Super Bowls have you won since I left? ... When I go to the Indy 500 I don't ask, 'Hey, who gassed up your car?'\"", "source": {"uri": "washingtonpost.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Washington Post"}, "authors": [{"uri": {"uri": "8113833126", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "13:03:17", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T13:03:17Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T13:02:32Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7176470756530762, "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/tom-brady-didnt-seem-thrilled-125732000.html", "title": "Tom Brady didn't seem thrilled about Robert Kraft joke during Netflix roast", "body": "Tom Brady didn't seem thrilled about Robert Kraft joke during Netflix roast originally appeared on NBC Sports Boston\n\nOne joke was not very funny to Tom Brady.\n\nThe future Hall of Fame quarterback sat through quips about himself, the end of his marriage to Gisele B\u00fcndchen, and many other topics on Sunday during Netflix's \"The Greatest Roast of All Time: The Roast of Tom Brady.\" But one subject was off limits, with Brady leaving his seat to put a stop to any other related punchlines.\n\nComedian Jeff Ross discussed Brady going into the office of New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft after being selected with the 199th overall pick in the 2000 NFL Draft.\n\n\"So Tom became a Patriot and moved up to New England, and on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said, 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made. Would you like a massage?'\" Ross joked.\n\nBrady smiled initially before squirming in his seat. He then got up and approached the lectern as Ross looked at Kraft in the crowd. Brady attempted to whisper into Ross' ear, telling him, \"Don't say that s--- again.\" His message, which may or may not have been scripted, was picked up by the microphone.\n\n\"OK, OK,\" Ross replied with a laugh before finishing his roast.\n\nThe joke was in reference to Kraft receiving a misdemeanor charge for soliciting prostitution at a Florida massage parlor in 2019. Kraft pleaded not guilty to two counts of solicitation and issued an apology.\n\n\"I am truly sorry,\" Kraft said in a statement at the time. \"I know I have hurt and disappointed my family, my close friends, my co-workers, our fans and many others who rightfully hold me to a higher standard.\"\n\nHe added, \"As I move forward, I hope to continue to use the platform with which I have been blessed to help others and to try to make a difference. I expect to be judged not by my words, but by my actions. And through those actions, I hope to regain your confidence and respect.\"\n\nThe solicitation charges were dropped by Florida prosecutors in September 2020, per NBC News.\n\nStill, Ross' joke made for one of the more uncomfortable moments of the three-hour roast.\n\nKraft later had his chance to take some shots of his own at Brady.\n\n\"Good luck buying the Raiders,\" Belichick told Brady, who has made a bid for a minority ownership stake in the Las Vegas Raiders. \"They did your favorite thing for you already, they got rid of Jimmy Garoppolo.\"\n\nGaroppolo, Brady's former backup in New England who the Patriots traded in 2017, was recently released by the Raiders.\n\nKraft also joked about his reunion with former Patriots head coach Bill Belichick, who parted ways with the team in January after 24 seasons.\n\n\"Unlike many family reunions, there are some people I am desperately trying to avoid,\" Kraft joked before acknowledging Belichick.\n\nKraft and Belichick then stopped taking shots at Brady...and starting doing shots of alcohol, with the help of comedian Kevin Hart.\n\n\"I want to say this is the greatest coach in the history of the game that did what no one else has done,\" Kraft said. \"And having Tom Brady and him was the greatest honor the good lord gave me. So, cheers!\"", "source": {"uri": "yahoo.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Yahoo"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Kraft", "type": "person", "score": 5, I used to say ''the next one'',' Brady said at first. 'But now that I am retired, my favorite Ring is the camera that caught Coach Belichick slinking out of that poor girl's house a few months ago...'\n\nThen, after pointing in his former coach's direction, Brady said: 'Hey, you still got it! Respect baby!!'\n\nStunned, Belichick lit up with an awkward smile but wasn't exactly tearing up like one of his former players - Julian Edelman - who had his arms wrapped around the six-time Super Bowl winning head coach.\n\nTom Brady delivered a few jabs during his Sunday roast, including one for his ex-head coach\n\nIn Nov., Ring doorbell footage of Bill Belichick went viral as he left a random home shirtless\n\nSpeaking of which, Brady said about Belichick's credentials: 'I've been out of the game for a minute, so I am curious how many Super Bowl have you won since I left.\n\n'Maybe it's not just the guy on the sidelines. {"uri": "8113148918", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "04:55:37", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T04:55:37Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T04:53:00Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7176470756530762, "url": "https://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/ap/article-13386215/Tom-Bradys-Netflix-roast-features-lots-humor-reunion-Robert-Kraft-Bill-Belichick.html", "title": "Tom Brady's Netflix roast features lots of humor, reunion between...", "body": "INGLEWOOD, Calif. (AP) - Three months before Tom Brady gets roasted by critics as Fox Sports' top NFL analyst, he took his share of barbs from comedians, former teammates and his longtime coach Sunday night during a made-for-streaming comedy live event on Netflix.\n\nAnd it is safe to say after the one liners and jokes Brady heard during three hours of \"The Greatest Roast of All Time\" at The Forum, he will do just fine.\n\n\"It\u00b4s like a football game. You run with a game plan, and then you get to see kind of how the strategy goes, and then you adjust on the fly,\" Brady said before the event. \"This is what a locker room has been like for me for all these years. So it\u00b4s not like I\u00b4m used to people not making fun of me.\"\n\nComedian Nikki Glaser, whose monologue was among the funniest of the night, termed the roast as \"the comedians' Super Bowl\" and how the competition level was ramped up because everyone wanted to one-up each other.\n\nBrady sustained more blitzes and pressure than he did during an average NFL game as an impressive lineup of comedians, former teammates and opponents took the stage . Host Kevin Hart said before the event that no topic was off limits, and Hart went on the offensive early with jokes about Brady's ex-wife, Gisele B\u00fcndchen.\n\n\"Gisele gave you an ultimatum. She said you retire or we're done. When you got a chance to go 8-9 and all it will cost you is your wife and your kids, you've got to do what you've got to do,\" Hart said, referring to Brady coming out of a brief retirement in 2022 for one more season.\n\nTom Brady poses at \"The Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady\" at the Kia Forum, Sunday, May 5, 2024, in Inglewood, Calif. (AP Photo/Chris Pizzello)\n\nThe only time Brady objected to a joke was when Jeff Ross made a reference to Patriots owner Robert Kraft and massages. In 2019, Kraft received a misdemeanor charge that he paid for sex at a Florida massage parlor.\n\nBrady walked up to Ross and said in his ear \"don't say that (stuff) again\", but it was caught on the microphone.\n\nLater, Kraft and former Patriots coach Bill Belichick did a shot together on stage after some coaxing from Hart.\n\nBelichick was fired in January after 24 seasons with the Patriots, and a lot has been written about friction between the six-time winning Super Bowl coach and owner over the past couple years.\n\nAfter joking about this being like a reunion and \"unlike many family reunions there are some people I am desperately trying to avoid\", Kraft praised Belichick for what the two accomplished.\n\n\"I want to say this is the greatest coach in the history of the game that did what no one else has done. And having Tom Brady and him was the greatest honor the good Lord gave me,\" Kraft said.\n\nIt wasn't the first shot (of alcohol) that Belichick took. Rob Gronkowski got Belichick and Brady to do a shot together after his monologue. Gronkowski celebrated by spiking his shot glass.\n\nBelichick appeared at the beginning of the roast during a pre-taped segment when he told Brady that he was \"starting the roast\" instead of Drew Bledsoe. Brady replaced Bledsoe in 2001 when Bledsoe was injured in a Week 2 game against the Jets and led the Patriots to their first Super Bowl title that season.\n\n\"For all of you out there who think about who's responsible for the Patriots success during the time Tom and I was together - was it Tom or me - in reality the truth of the matter was it was both of us because of me,\" Belichick said.\n\nBrady did have some fun at Belichick's expense though near the end of the show.\n\n\"I've been out of the game for a minute, so I\u00b4m curious, how many Super Bowl rings have you won since I left?,\" Brady said. \"Maybe it\u00b4s not just the guy on the sideline. When I go to the Indy 500, I don\u00b4t ask the winning driver, 'Hey, you gassed up your car?;\"\n\nHart said before the show that he thought Brady was in a great mindset going into the event. Brady did come in well prepared, going over his monologue with a group of people, including those at Fox Sports.\n\n\"You have to be able to laugh at yourself and I love that he is doing in this forum,\" Hart said. \"I love that he is embracing the things that some people think he runs away from. It is a celebration of greatness and we are doing it in a fun way.\"\n\nBledsoe also said that Brady has had a sense of humor, but that this was a different stage.\n\n\"I thought he was very brave. There\u00b4s plenty of material to make fun of him on,\" Bledsoe said. \"The truth is when you\u00b4re a professional athlete, roasting each other is kind of what we do every day in the locker room. And so, you better have thick skin going in. Now, people get to laugh along with it.\"\n\nAP NFL: https://apnews.com/hub/nfl\n\nHost Kevin Hart poses at \"The Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady\" at the Kia Forum, Sunday, May 5, 2024, in Inglewood, Calif. {"uri": "8114260475", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "18:10:27", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T18:10:27Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T18:10:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7176470756530762, "url": "https://www.totalprosports.com/nfl/fans-noticed-that-tom-brady-invited-the-most-random-player-to-be-on-stage-for-his-netflix-roast/", "title": "NFL Fans Noticed That Tom Brady Invited The Most Random Player To Be On Stage For His Netflix Roast", "body": "\"Netflix is a Joke: The Greatest Roast of All Time: The Roast of Tom Brady\" was a part of the yearly celebration.\n\nThere were a number of former Tom Brady teammates, coaches, and others in attendance, including Bill Belichick, Peyton Manning, Randy Moss, Drew Bledsoe, Julian Edelman, Rodney Harrison, Willie McGinest, Matt Light, and Nate Solder.\n\nHowever, there was one former player on the stage that nobody could quite figure out who it was and why they were there.\n\nFormer Tampa Bay Bucs wide receiver and free agent Breshad Perriman was also on stage for this roast session.\n\nFans quickly took to the comment section:\n\nFor those wondering, Brady and Perriman made history together on the field.\n\nDuring the 2021 season, the then-44-year-old Tom Brady threw his 700th touchdown pass for the winning score in Tampa Bay's 33-27 overtime victory against the Buffalo Bills, via AP.com.\n\nIn his first game against the Bills since moving to Tampa Bay in 2020, Brady found Breshad Perriman for a 58-yard catch-and-run with 5:31 left in OT, which was the 700th TD pass of Brady's career, including playoffs.\n\nAlso Read: VIDEO: Tom Brady Totally Embarrassed Bill Belichick By Bringing Up His Shirtless Booty Call Video During Netflix Roast\n\nDuring the live Netflix roast in his honor, Tom Brady got a lot of flak, but one comment seemed to go too far.\n\nAt the Greatest Roast of All Time on Sunday, May 5, Brady's past rumored relationship with Kim Kardashian and his divorce from Gisele B\u00fcndchen were both up for discussion. However, the seven-time Super Bowl champion stood up when comedian Jeff Ross made a joke about Robert Kraft, the owner of the New England Patriots.\n\n\"'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made,'\" Ross said.\n\nThe crowd at the Kia Forum went crazy before Ross then added: \"Would you like a massage?\"\n\nBrady got up and walked to the dais where he whispered \"Don't say that s -- {"uri": "8113162994", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "05:08:41", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T05:08:41Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T05:07:41Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7176470756530762, "url": "https://www.bostonglobe.com/2024/05/06/sports/tom-brady-netflix-roast-features-belichick-kraft-gronk-edelman-and-bledsoe/", "title": "\"Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady\" was good not-so-clean fun at the quarterback's expense - The Boston Globe", "body": "\"It's great seeing you again,\" Belichick said. \"This is a big night. The fans want you. Everyone wants you. But it's not your night. Sorry, Drew.\"\n\nThe camera then switched angles to show Belichick was actually speaking to Drew Bledsoe, the quarterback he inherited when he took over as head coach of the Patriots in 2000 and later benched in favor of Brady in 2001.\n\n\"Brady,\" Belichick went on to say, as Brady slid into the frame. \"You're in. Let's go.\"\n\n\"Are you [expletive] kidding me?\" Bledsoe said, as Belichick and Brady walked off together. \"Again?\"\n\nThe harmless joke was hardly indicative of what was to come, as no topics were off limits for what Netflix called \"The Greatest Roast of All Time.\" More than a dozen people took the stage at the Kia Forum in Los Angeles to rib Brady, poking fun at everything from his sexuality to his failed marriage with Gisele B\u00fcndchen to B\u00fcndchen's new romance with jiu-jitsu instructor Joaquim Valente to Brady's involvement with crypto exchange FTX.\n\nAmong those also participating were Patriots owner Robert Kraft, former Patriots wide receivers Julian Edelman and Randy Moss, ex-tight end Rob Gronkowski, Brady's longtime rival (and soon-to-be Belichick's coworker) Peyton Manning, actor Ben Affleck, reality star Kim Kardashian, host Kevin Hart, and a slew of comedians.\n\nA vast majority of the jokes -- including nearly the entirety of Gronkowski's segment -- were too inappropriate to reprint in this story. The only one that prompted Brady to interject pertained to Kraft's Orchids of Asia visit in January 2019.\n\nJeff Ross, introduced as the \"roastmaster general,\" made an addendum to what Brady, as a rookie, famously told Kraft. Not only did Brady say, \"I'm the best decision your organization has ever made,\" Ross quipped, but then he also asked, \"Would you like a massage?\"\n\nBrady then walked up to the podium and said in Ross's ear, \"Don't say that [expletive] again.\"\n\nNot every punchline was off-color, however.\n\nBelichick's segment was essentially clean, with his first joke acknowledging his negative portrayal in the \"Dynasty\" series.\n\n\"I'm so honored to be here for the roast of Tom Brady on Netflix,\" he said. \"It's not to be confused with the roast of Bill Belichick on the 10-part Apple TV series.\"\n\nBelichick then went on to poke fun at his former players, including Gronkowski for his Tide Pod commercial in 2018 and Danny Amendola for his limited production early in his Patriots tenure. He struck a more serious tone when discussing former safety Rodney Harrison, calling the fact that Harrison is still not in the Pro Football Hall of Fame \"the biggest joke of the night.\"\n\nWhen Belichick finally got to Brady, he leaned into the fact that their relationship soured over time and the speculation that Belichick's lack of praise affected Brady.\n\n\"Believe it or not, I got a lot of nice things to say about Tom, but I'm running out of time here,\" Belichick cracked.\n\n\"Tom, you had so many clutch moments, so many big plays, so many unbelievable plays that will live on forever. I remember the pass you threw to Amendola when we beat Baltimore in the playoffs in '14. No, no, that was Julian who threw that pass. There was the pass you threw to [Phillip] Dorsett when we beat the Eagles in 2019. No, no, Julian you threw that one, too. Oh. Tom threw a lot of touchdown passes. I can't remember, but he threw a bunch of them.\"\n\nBelichick also took a shot at Brady's longtime trainer and business partner Alex Guerrero, who became a point of contention in his relationship with Belichick.\n\nBelichick couldn't escape the jokes, either, as his relationship status and job status proved to be popular talking points as well.\n\n\"You remember when you used to yell at us, 'Look, the [expletive] kids at Foxborough High can make that [expletive] play,'\" quipped Edelman. \"I've been waiting for this for so long: 'Look, Foxborough High is the only job offer you [expletive] had.\"\n\nBrady took the stage for the final 10 minutes of the program, punching back at nearly all of the participating roasters. He joked about Manning living in his shadow, Edelman's perceived infatuation with him, Gronkowski's intelligence, and Deflategate, among other topics.\n\nBefore the night ended, though, Brady {"uri": "8113182414", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "05:26:16", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T05:26:16Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T05:25:56Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7176470756530762, "url": "https://www.cbssports.com/nfl/news/ranking-the-top-moments-from-tom-brady-roast-bill-belichick-zings-pats-brady-owns-up-to-deflategate-more/", "title": "Ranking the top moments from Tom Brady Roast: Bill Belichick zings Pats, Brady owns up to Deflategate, more - CBSSports.com", "body": "Tom Brady can now add having the greatest roast of all time to his long list of accolades. The greatest quarterback of all time was the subject of Netflix's Tom Brady Roast that included many, many jabs thrown his way by former teammates, coaches and celebrity alike.\n\nBut similar to his football career, Brady was in control of the proceedings at the end, capping off the night with some perfectly executed zingers of his own.\n\nThe roast included many memorable moments that will surely dominate the headlines during an otherwise lazy Monday on the NFL calendar. Here's a rundown of the top moments from Brady's roast. Six moments were ranked, which is fitting, given Brady won six Lombardis during his legendary run in New England.\n\nSome of the videos shared below include graphic language.\n\n6. Edelman goes after Belichick\n\nBrady wasn't the only one that got roasted Sunday night. Former Patriots receiver Julian Edelman went after his former coach, Bill Belichick, for not landing another head coaching job after leaving the Patriots this offseason. Edelman's ribbing included his patented Belichick impression.\n\n5. Belichick, Kraft do a shot together\n\nYes, you read that right. This moment truly encapsulated the sheer absurdity of the night. Patriots owner Robert Kraft, who has received a ton of flack for his criticism of Belichick since the two parted ways (including the Apple TV documentary on the Pats' dynasty that Kraft had a role in making), went out of his way to praise his former coach before taking a shot with him at the request of comedian/actor Kevin Hart.\n\n4. Gronk being Gronk\n\nLet's just say that Rob Gronkowski more than lived up to his reputation when it was his turn at the mic. I'm not going to try to summarize what he said (check it out here if you so wish), but just know that it included Belichick blowing a whistle at him to try to get him to skip one of his graphic jokes, which Gronk declined to do.\n\nOh, Gronk also spiked his shot glass, because, Gronk.\n\n3. Bledsoe's revenge\n\nDrew Bledsoe, the quarterback Brady replaced at the start of the Patriots' two-decade long dynasty, finally got his payback on Sunday night.\n\nBledsoe took no prisoners. He made more than a few jokes about Brady's divorce with Gisele.\n\n2. Belichick takes swipe at Pats\n\nWell, it wasn't at the Patriots, per se, but more at Kraft and his role in \"The Dynasty\" documentary. The doc was largely viewed as a Belichick hit piece, which clearly wasn't lost on the six-time championship head coach.\n\n\"Im so honored to be here for the Roast of Tom Brady on Netflix,\" Belichick said. \"It's not to be confused with the Roast of Bill Belichick, the 10-part Apple TV series.\"\n\nBelichick's time at the mic also included a dig at Gronkowski and his new gig as a TV analyst. He did so while adjusting his trademark phrase, \"Do your job.\"\n\n\"Gronk, I've been watching you on Fox NFL Sunday,\" he started, \"and I'm begging you, please, stop doing your job.\"\n\n1. Brady takes no prisoners\n\nAfter getting raked over the coals, Brady turned the tables at the end of the night. His roasting included a jab at two of his former rivals.\n\n\"I'm trying to buy the Raiders. I'm tired of owning the Colts and Bills,\" he said.\n\nBrady also went after Chiefs fans while alluding to their most famous fan, Taylor Swift.\n\n\"Kansas City, you say your stadium is the loudest. It helps when your fans are 14-year-old girls,\" Brady said. \"In order of Tay Tay ... let's take a look at the Chiefs' eras: terrible for 50 years, good for five. Shake it off.\"\n\nBrady nearly brought down the house when he alluded to the NFL spending $21 million to try to prove that Brady deflated footballs in 2014.\n\n\"If they had given me the $21 million, I would have just told them I (expletive) did it,\" Brady said, a fitting ending to quite possibly the greatest roast ever.", "source": {"uri": "cbssports.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "CBS {"uri": "8113112431", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "04:14:16", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T04:14:16Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T04:13:51Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7137255072593689, "url": "https://heavy.com/sports/nfl/new-england-patriots/kraft-belichick-share-shot-at-brady-roast/", "title": "Bill Belichick and Robert Kraft Take a Shot as Part of Tom Brady's Amazing Roast: WATCH", "body": "The Roast of Tom Brady on Netflix was a no-holds-barred affair that left no stone unturned in its comedic assault on the legendary quarterback. Everyone seized the opportunity to unleash their best jabs at Tom Brady's expense, from Bill Belichick to Kim Kardashian to Drew Bledsoe.\n\nHosted by Kevin Hart, the event was a rollercoaster of laughter and surprise, with jokes flying fast and furiously, sparing no aspect of Brady's illustrious career or personal life. As the night unfolded, the roasters pulled no punches, delving into everything from Brady's on-field and off-field controversies to his recent divorce from Giselle Bundchen.\n\nDespite all the serious digs and amazing jokes, a few moments felt like therapy for New England Patriots fans and the stars on stage. Following a speech by Patriots owner Robert Kraft, Kevin Hart asked Kraft if he would do a shot with former Patriots Coach Bill Belichick. And they both obliged. Before the two Patriot legends shared cheers, Robert Kraft referred to Bill Belichick as \"the greatest coach in the game's history.\"\n\nSince Tom Brady left New England, there has been an endless amount of conversation regarding the ever-souring relationship between Brady and Belichick. And despite Brady praising his former coach multiple times, fans and the media still believed there was a severe rift between the two. But perhaps all they needed was former Patriot tight end Rob Gronkowski to play mediator.\n\nThe shot between Belichick and Kraft wasn't the only libation shared between two Patriot legends who have had a tumultuous relationship lately. Following Gronkowski's roast of Brady, the legendary tight end asked Belichick and Brady to share a shot with him. And in wild Gronk fashion, he \"gronk-spiked\" the shot glass right after.\n\nIt was a truly great moment to witness the Patriot legends coming together on stage to share cheers and acknowledge and display that there really is no feud and that the past is obviously behind both of them. In a bit of an ironic twist, both Belichick and Brady will now be part of the football media as Belichick is set to join a show with the Manning brothers as well as The Pat McAfee Show, and Brady will be the lead color analyst for FOX this upcoming football season.\n\nThere were so many unforgettable moments, and quite a few that were NSFW. But, some topics needed to be aired out, and this was the perfect forum. Belichick addressed what many hoped he might, the 10-part documentary, \"The Dynasty,\" on Apple TV. The docuseries is about the Patriot's epic run as a dynasty, but it has received harsh criticism for its focus on the many controversies during the Patriot's unparalleled run. The doc appears explicitly to paint Belichick as the source for most issues within the Patriots organization at those times.\n\nEven Kraft, who had his name in the documentary's credits but had no creative control, expressed his disappointment with the final product.\n\nDespite how harsh the doc is, Belichick addressed it hilariously. Belichick started his segment by saying, \"I'm so honored to be here for the roast of Tom Brady on Netflix, not to be confused with the roast of Bill Belichick, the 10-part Apple TV series. \"\n\nAfter everyone on the dais took their shot at Tom Brady, the legendary quarterback got the last laugh. One of his best jokes was a direct shot at his former coach, and the packed crowd at the Kia Forum in Los Angeles loved it. Brady started the joke by addressing Belichick and asking, \"How many Super Bowls have you won since I left?\" Brady continued, and the ensuing joke was incredible. \"Maybe it's not just the guy on the sideline. When I go to the Indy 500, I don't ask the winning driver, hey, who gassed up your car?\"\n\nWith the freedom of a live Netflix production, the roasters didn't shy away from pushing the boundaries of what's deemed appropriate, resulting in a wild and raucous evening that kept viewers on the edge of their seats. Former Patriot Julian Edelman had an excellent set, as did Rob Gronkowski, comedian Niki Glaser, Andrew Shulz, and comedian Tony Hinchcliffe. The special event even featured a guest appearance from Ron Burgundy. Belichick hilariously said that Ron Burgundy was \"the only member of the media that I respect.\"\n\nUltimately, the Roast of Tom Brady was a deliciously entertaining spectacle, serving up a heaping plate of laughter and irreverence that left audiences craving more. It was a night to remember, as Brady was at the center of a comedic storm unlike any other. Above all, it felt like Patriots fans and the legends on stage could get some closure regarding rumors and headlines that have been seeping out of Foxborough since the Patriots parted ways with Belichick. And that closure came in some fantastic and heartwarming moments.", "source": {"uri": "heavy.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Heavy"}, "authors": [{"uri": "colin_lynch@heavy.com", "name": "Colin
