{"uri": "2024-05-346023081", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "07:08:14", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T07:08:14Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T03:56:32Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6666666865348816, "url": "https://www.masslive.com/patriots/2024/05/tom-brady-roasts-bill-belichick-for-ring-video.html", "title": "Tom Brady roasts Bill Belichick for Ring video", "body": "The pillars of the Patriots dynasty were at Tom Brady's Netflix roast on Sunday night, as Bill Belichick, Robert Kraft, and Brady himself all took turns at the microphone.\n\nThe evening was filled with unfiltered humor, and when Brady finally took the stage to end the show, he landed a hilarious zinger at his former coach's expense. Last November, a Ring camera video surfaced that showed a man looking a lot like Belichick leaving a residence shirtless, and Brady didn't hold back.\n\n\"Everybody asks me which ring is my favorite,\" Brady said. \"I used to say 'the next one.' But now that I'm retired, my favorite Ring is the camera that caught Coach Belichick slinking out of that poor girl's house at 6 a.m. a few months ago... hey, you've still got it! Respect, baby.\"\n\nBrady kept it rolling from there.\n\n\"You know we've been through so much and after two decades I've finally had to admit that all along it was you,\" Brady said. \"You're the reason for the Patriots dynasty because you, Bill Belichick, you are a true coaching genius. I mean, you had to choose between an aging, injured, overpaid Drew Bledsoe and a young, healthy, minimum wage superstar. I could have gotten a (expletive) coach from Foxboro (expletive) high school to make that decision.\n\n\"I've been out of the game for a minute so I'm curious, how many Super Bowl rings have you won since I left? Maybe it's not just the guy on the sideline. When I go to the Indy 500 I don't ask the winning driver, 'Hey, who gassed up your car?'\"\n\nOn the flip side, the coach got Brady just as good earlier in the night. Belichick began by talking about the struggling soccer team that Brady has an ownership stake in, and delivered one of the lines of the night at Alex Guerrero's expense.\n\n\"We've already talked about the cryptocurrency, I'll stay away from that one. But I see your soccer team Birmingham City got knocked down to another tier in the English football league,\" Belichick said. \"So for those not familiar with English football and the intricacies to their obscure (relegation) system, just let me put it in English for you: They suck! Not so easy running a team, is it Tom?\n\n\"So little coaching advice, stick to American football. You're really good at that. People have said that Tom and I butted heads a lot, and in a way that was true, but not really. It was hard to butt heads with Tom because it was so far up Alex Guerrero's (butt).\"\n\nBelichick finished by poking fun at the trick plays that Patriots used to call that took the ball out of Brady's hands.\n\n\"You know, Tom, you had so many clutch moments, so many big plays, so many just unbelievable plays that will live on forever. I remember the pass that you threw to (Danny) Amendola when we beat Baltimore in the playoffs in '14 -- no, that was Julian (Edelman) that threw that pass to Amendola. There was the pass you threw to (Phillip) Dorsett when we beat the Eagles -- (Philly fan Kevin Hart) you remember that one -- in 2019. No, Julian, you threw that one too. Oh. Tom threw a lot of touchdown passes. I can't remember them, but he threw a bunch of them.\n\n\"Seriously, Tom and I had our differences, but you know it only comes with love and respect about our relationship and we did some special things together. For all of you out there that think about who's responsible for the Patriots' success during the time when Tom and I were there, was it Brady? Was it me? Was it Brady? Was it me? In reality, the truth of the matter is, it was both of us because of me. Great event. Netflix, great night to be here. Thank you very much. Love you. Tom, (inaudible), love you guys. Thank you!\"\n\nAll parties seemed to enjoy the evening, and Belichick, Brady and Rob Gronkowski took a shot together at one point as well.", "source": {"uri": "masslive.com", "dataType": "news", {"uri": "8113730961", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "11:55:26", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T11:55:26Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T11:55:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6666666865348816, "url": "https://www.tvinsider.com/1134499/tom-brady-netflix-roast-most-memorable-moments-jeff-ross-will-ferrell/", "title": "Tom Brady Netflix Roast: Craziest, Most Unforgettable Moments", "body": "Will Gray be forced to get his hands dirty? Get a sneak peek at the final episode of the AMC series.\n\nNFL legend Tom Brady had a night he'll never forget on Sunday, May 6, as he took to the stage at the Kia Forum in Los Angeles to be roasted by comedians and his former teammates.\n\nThe Netflix live event, The Greatest Roast of All-Time: Tom Brady, uniquely honored the Patriots great by having his peers brutally roast him about all aspects of his life, from his former marriage to Gisele B\u00fcndchen to the deflate-gate controversy.\n\nHosted by Kevin Hart, the event saw the likes of Kim Kardashian, Nikki Glaser, Robert Kraft, Jeff Ross, and Will Ferrell take to the stage to deliver their best Tom Brady burns.\n\nCheck out some of the most memorable moments below.\n\nComedy roast stalwart Jeff Ross, aka the Roastmaster General, received admonishment from Brady after one particularly brutal joke.\n\n\"So Tom became a Patriot and moved up to New England, and on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said, 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made. Would you like a massage?'\" Ross quipped.\n\nThe comedian was referencing the 2019 incident where Kraft and others were charged with solicitation in an anti-sex trafficking investigation into several Florida massage parlors. Prosecutors later dropped the charges against the Patriots owner.\n\nAfter Ross made the joke, he turned to where Kraft was sitting, saying, \"I love Robert Kraft...\" He was then interrupted by Brady, who walked on stage and whispered in Ross' ear, \"Don't say that s*** again.\"\n\nRoss also brought up the 2015 scandal in which the NFL disciplined Brady and the Patriots for lowering the inflation of game footballs.\n\n\"I really wanted you to be our first G.O.A.T. to be roasted because you're an example to future generations that if you work hard, eat right, film the other team's practices, deflate the balls, and have the NFL make new rules just for you, then you too can be the third most famous guy in a Dunkin Donuts commercial, Tommy,\" Ross joked.\n\nReality star Kim Kardashian made a surprise appearance at the event, but she didn't receive the most welcome response. As she started speaking, the crowd drowned out her speech with loud boos.\n\n\"All right, all right, all right,\" she said, trying to calm the boos down. Meanwhile, Hart could be heard off-screen saying, \"Whoa, whoa.\"\n\nAfter the audience finally quieted down, Kardashian got off her jokes, including comparing Brady to Caitlyn Jenner.\n\n\"You remind me too much of my stepdad now,\" she said. \"Oh, part of me thinks you would want to [date] me just to try on my clothes. I know the transition from the NFL must have been really hard. But I think my stepdad is a great example for you. She's one of the best athletes in the world, who proved you can do anything in this next chapter of your life. You can become a commentator or a far-right-wing Republican or even a strong confident woman.\"\n\nIntroduced as \"a living legend, a world-class lover, and the No. 1 news anchor in all of Sunday,\" Will Ferrell took to the stage as his Anchorman persona, Ron Burgundy.\n\n\"My name is Ron Burgundy,\" he started. \"I am a very big deal, but tonight is not about me... We are here to honor a champion of the gridiron, a great American, a father and a sexy man, a true patriot -- until he was not.\"\n\nAfter talking about Brady's looks, Burgundy ended his speech by saying, \"I mean, let's be honest. Your best years are behind you, Tom. The Super Bowls, Gisele, your movie career, it's all done, it's all gone. But you won't be forgotten, you'll always be remembered as Eli Manning's b***h. Don't let that get you down, Tom.\"\n\nAs host, it was up to Hart to kick the evening off, and he did so by poking fun at Brady's breakup with his ex-wife Gisele B\u00fcndchen.\n\n\"Gisele gave you an ultimatum,\" Hart said. \"She said you have to retire or you're done. But when you got a chance to go eight and nine, and all it will cost you is your wife and your kids, you gotta do what the f*** you gotta do. You know what that's called, Tom? That's called real s***. F*** them kids.\"\n\nHe then turned his attention to B\u00fcndchen's new boyfriend, her karate coach Joaquim Valente.\n\n\"You know who also f***** their coach? Gisele, she f***** her karate coach,\" Hart joked. \"Tom, how did you not see this coming? Eight karate classes a day?\"\n\nAfter Hart set the tone, comedian Nikki Glaser went in for the kill with her focus on Brady's broken marriage.\n\n\"Five-time Super Bowl MVP, most career wins, most career touchdowns. You have seven rings. Well, eight, now that Gisele gave hers back,\" Glaser quipped. \"But sorry, Tom, the only thing dumber than you saying yes to this roast was when you said, 'Hey, babe, you should try jiu jitsu.'\"\n\nShe also referenced actress Bridget Moynahan, whom Brady dated between 2004 and 2006. She gave birth to their child in 2007.\n\n\"But seriously, Tom... you're the best to ever play for too long. I mean, you retired, then you came back, and then you retired again. I mean, I get it. It's hard to walk away from something that's not your pregnant girlfriend. To be fair, he didn't know she was pregnant. He just thought she was getting fat, and Tom hates fat.\"\n\nHere are some more of the best burns.\n\nHart: \"We're here to roast the greatest quarterback of all time. Oh, wait, Joe Montana's here?\"\n\nKardashian referencing how her late father, Robert Kardashian, was part of O.J. Simpson's defense team: \"Honestly, it's hard for me to watch people roast you. But I think enough of my family members have helped defend former football players.\"\n\nBrady: \"Thank you so much for being here. I know Kim was terrified to be here tonight. Not because of this, but because her kids are home with their dad [Kanye West].\"\n\nAndrew Schulz: \"ACL is the only injury Gronk can spell.\"\n\nBurgundy: \"I never liked you Tom in all my years of watching professional football. I never saw a more boring quarterback. He actually made me look forward to all the fun and laughter of a Bill Belichick postgame interview.\"\n\nRoss: \"I really wanted Kevin [Hart] to host because he already looks like a deflated On Sunday, a few comedians and friends of Brady gathered for a Netflix live Special, The Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady. The audience went bonkers during the show as Tom Brady suffered roasts. Most of the jokes and jabs were directed at his failed marriage with Gisele B\u00fcndchen. However, despite being the target of countless jests, Brady remained a good sport, joining in on the comedic banter.\n\nSunday was a fun-filled day for Tom Brady's friends as they gathered at the Kia Forum in Inglewood, California. Fans watched as comedians, friends, and former teammates of the 46-year-old fired insults at Brady during a Netflix joke fest. The jokes that drew the most gasps were particularly channeled at the former Quarterback's divorce from B\u00fcndchen. Recall that Brady and the model divorced in 2022, after which she moved on with Brazilian jiu-jitsu instructor Joaquim Valente. Beginning the greatest roast of all time, Comedian Nikki Glaser joked:\n\n\"How much it would suck for Tom... Omg, just knowing your ex-wife's new boyfriend could beat your a** while eating hers.\"\n\nGlaser then took things a bit further, adding:\n\n\"Tom, the only thing dumber than you saying 'yes' to this roast was when you said, 'Hey babe, you should try jiu-jitsu.\"\n\nBesides Glaser, Tom Brady also suffered roasts from Kevin Hart, Julian Edelman, Rob Gronkowski, Drew Bledsoe, Randy Moss, and even Kim Kardashian. Speaking of Hart, the comedian mocked Brady for choosing to unretire and play one final unsuccessful season with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.\n\n\"Gisele gave you an ultimatum. She said you have to retire or you're done. But when you have a chance to go 8-9 you gotta do it,\" he said.\n\nBrady's failed marriage wasn't the only thing the star received jabs about. He also got insulted for his losses to the New York Giants, his failed crypto commercials, and his looks. Kardashian, who was booed as she got on stage, particularly mocked Brady, noting that she couldn't date him because \"he reminded her too much of her step-dad Caitlyn Jenner.\" Well, Brady later got the chance to get back at Kardashian for her comment, and he took it. In his response, Brady went for a low blow as he referenced the socialite's ex-husband, Kanye West.\n\n\"I know Kim was terrified to be here tonight...not because of this but because her kids are at home with their dad,\" he said. B\n\nBrady's comment left the audience roaring and Kardashian shaking her head with a restrained smile. Overall, the event was everything the celebrities and audience could have hoped for. {"uri": "2024-05-346905850", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "20:00:19", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T20:00:19Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T19:56:11Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.658823549747467, "url": "https://clutchpoints.com/most-savage-jokes-from-roast-tom-brady", "title": "The most savage jokes from the Roast of Tom Brady", "body": "Tom Brady looked uncomfortable from the jump. Kevin Hart went straight to the quarterback's marital problems on Sunday, joking about how Brady was played by his ex-wife.\n\n\"You know who also f***ed their coach? Gisele, she f***ed her karate coach,\" Hart said. \"What an idiot. Why would you do this? Jesus Christ, Tom. One of the smartest quarterbacks to have ever played the game. Tom, how did you not see this coming? Eight karate classes a day? ... And she's still a white belt!\"\n\nBrady raised his glass, seemingly knowing he was in for a long night. Indeed, he was as comedian Nikki Glaser also made similar, brutal jokes about the end of his relationship with his ex-wife.\n\n\"You have seven rings. Well, eight now that Gisele gave hers back,\" she said in a less vulgar joke than one she made later on. \"The only thing dumber than saying yes to this roast was when you said, 'Hey babe, you should try jiu-jitsu.'\"\n\nHart also made a joke about Brady's decision to come out of retirement in 2022.\n\n\"Gisele gave you an ultimatum,\" Hart started. \"She said you have to retire or you're done. But when you have a chance to go 8-9 you gotta do it.\"\n\nJulian Edelman roasts Bill Belichick's employment status\n\nThe former Patriots receiver didn't hold back when discussing Belichick's search to find his next head coaching job this offseason.\n\n\"Remember when you used to yell at us, 'Look a**holes, the f***ing kids at Foxborough High can make that f***ing play,'\" Edelman said. \"I've been waiting for this for so long: Look a**hole, Foxborough High is the only job offer you f***ing had.\n\n\"Do your job? More like, need a job, coach.\"\n\nEdelman wasn't the only one to make jokes about Belichick's inability to land a coaching gig this offseason. Drew Bledsoe seemingly got his revenge on his former coach 23 years after he benched him for Brady.\n\n\"There were rumors Coach Belichick was gonna be here tonight,\" Bledsoe said. \"Turns out he has some time on his hands. Look, at least when I was fired somebody else wanted me.\"\n\nPeyton Manning roasts Tom Brady's cryptocurrency failure\n\nThe other notable shortcoming Tom Brady had off the field in recent years was his investment in FTX, a cryptocurrency exchange. His former rival doesn't have much to stand on over him on the field, but he made sure to roast him about that on Sunday.\n\n\"Tom is making a donation to every one of his former teammates' charities that came here tonight,\" Manning said. \"And I gotta tell you, Tom, that is first class. Hey fellas, don't let him pay you in crypto.\"\n\nNikki Glaser, Tom Brady, Bill Belichick brutally insult Rob Gronkowski's smarts\n\nRob Gronkowski's non-football IQ was roasted throughout the night, with a few burns seeming to hit harder than others. Glaser poked fun at Gronkowski while making a joke about Brady's crypto failure.\n\n\"Even Gronk was like, 'Me know that not real money!'\" Glaser said, mimicking Gronkowski's voice.\n\nBelichick roasted Gronkowski's ability, or inability, to do be a good broadcaster.\n\n\"A lot of people connect me to the saying, 'Do your job,' and telling people to do their job,\" Belichick said. \"Gronk, I've been watching you on FOX NFL Sunday, and I'm begging you: Stop doing your job. Do another job. Do somebody else's job!\"\n\nBrady also joked how low the standards were for Gronkowski to be a good tight end, tying in Aaron Hernandez.\n\n\"Despite everything we've seen here tonight, Gronk was actually useful on the field,\" Brady said. \"Although the bar for Patriots tight ends was pretty low back then: block, catch, don't murder.\"\n\nJulian Edelman mocks Tom Brady's look\n\nOf all the former Patriots players, Edelman might have been the one who landed the most memorable cracks on Sunday. He tossed a joke about Brady's evolved appearance throughout the years, implying he's had some help from doctors.\n\n\"When we played together, Tom, you used to scream, 'Laser focus! Laser focus!' Now that's what he screams at his plastic surgeon,\" Edelman said. \"Who's laughing now Tom? Not you, because your face can't move and you don't have a sense of humor.\"\n\nTom Brady surprisingly went there with Bill Belichick\n\nWhile many mocked Brady's marital struggles on Sunday, he complimented his former coach's game off the field when discussing the number of Super Bowls he's won.\n\n\"Everybody asks me which ring is my favorite, I used to say, The next one,'\" Brady said. \"But now that I am retired, my favorite Ring is the camera that caught Coach Belichick slinking out of that poor girl's house a few months ago.\n\n\"Hey, you still go it. Respect baby.\"\n\nThe video Brady is referring to is one of Belichick appearing to be caught on camera leaving someone's house that was leaked late in 2023. It's unknown when the video was taken.\n\nBrady also threw a jab at his coach for not winning a Super Bowl after he left, something he did with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in 2020.\n\n\"I've been out of the game for a minute, so I'm curious, how many Super Bowl rings have you won since I left?\" Brady said. \"Maybe it's not just the guy on the sideline. When I go to the Indy 500, I don't ask the winning driver, 'Hey, who gassed up your car?'\"", "source": {"uri": "clutchpoints.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "ClutchPoints"}, "authors": [{"uri": The target was New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft, the man who signed Brady's paychecks for the first 20 years of his 23-year NFL career.\n\nRead more: If you liked Nikki Glaser's roast of Tom Brady, wait till she flames herself in new HBO special\n\nAfter host Kevin Hart opened the show with a blistering monologue -- \"Why didn't we go to the Crypto.com Arena downtown? Well, the reason why we didn't go there is because we didn't want to remind Tom's fans of how much money he owes them\" -- comedian and celebrity roast staple Jeff Ross kept the hits coming. Would you like a massage?'\"\n\nThe joke was a reference to Kraft being arrested in 2019 on charges of soliciting sex from a prostitute during an encounter at a Florida day spa. Kraft pleaded not guilty, and the charges were dropped the following year after his lawyers prevented video and audio footage from being used as evidence in court.\n\nAs the crowd laughed and Ross blew a kiss in Kraft's direction, Brady could be seen shifting in his seat behind and to the right of the comedian. The camera cut to a close shot of Ross, who said \"I love Robert Kraft.\"\n\nRead more: Our 25 must-see shows at Netflix Is a Joke\n\nBrady then approached Ross. The NFL's all-time leader in passing yards and touchdown passes had a bit of a smile on his face, but his tone was dead serious when he leaned in and said to Ross, \"Don't say that s -- again.\"\n\nAs Brady returned to his seat, Ross laughed, put his hands up and said, \"OK, OK!\" He pointed in Kraft's direction and said, \"He's having fun, look at him.\" As Ross added some sincere words of praise for Kraft, the Patriots owner was shown smiling in the crowd.\n\nBrady didn't appear to hold a grudge and could be seen laughing during the rest of Ross' set. The two men embraced and spoke after Ross' performance -- a scene Hart mocked by implying Ross was kissing up to the GOAT. \"I heard you over there,\" Hart said. \"'Tom, you all right? Yeah? {"uri": "8113718983", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "11:47:26", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T11:47:26Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T11:47:07Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6509804129600525, "url": "https://ftw.usatoday.com/2024/05/tom-brady-roast-taylor-swift-chiefs-netflix", "title": "Tom Brady takes a dig at the Chiefs and Taylor Swift during his Netflix roast", "body": "Netflix hosted a roast of former New England and Tampa Bay quarterback Tom Brady on Sunday evening, and no one was safe from ridicule. The 7-time Super Bowl champion was ribbed by everyone from Bill Belichick to Rob Gronkowski to Kim Kardashian to Nikki Glaser.\n\nMORE: The best Tom Brady moments from The Roast of Tom Brady, including some classic Bill Belichick zingers\n\nBut after the roasting left Brady good and toasted, the future Hall-of-Famer had a chance at a little revenge. At one point, Brady turned his jokes towards the new NFL dynasty -- the Chiefs -- and 14-time Grammy winner Taylor Swift.\n\n\"Kansas City, you say your stadium is the loudest?\" Brady asked. \"It helps when all your fans are 14-year-old girls.\" He then went on to break down the \"Chiefs' eras,\" saying the team was \"terrible for 50 years, good for five\" before adding \"shake it off.\"", {"uri": "8113077483", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "03:37:57", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T03:37:57Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T03:36:27Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6509804129600525, "url": "https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-news/tom-brady-roast-best-jokes-gisele-deflategate-crypto-1235890602/", "title": "Tom Brady Roast: Kevin Hart, Jeff Ross, Bill Belachick, Will Ferrell and More Joke About Gisele Bundchen, Deflategate, Crypto Failure", "body": "Bentonville Film Fest Sets 'Out of My Mind' as Opener, Unveils Competition Lineup\n\nTom Brady was a good, um, sport on Sunday night, where he was roasted about all aspects of his life, from his former marriage to Gisele B\u00fcndchen to his role in deflategate.\n\nHost Kevin Hart kicked off The Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady by noting that the event would be focusing on the \"greatest quarterback of all time.\" \"Wait, Joe Montana's here?\" he quipped. He went on to joke that the teleprompter should have included the qualifier \"one of the\" greatest quarterbacks ever in reference to Brady. \"The greatest is Joe Montana,\" he affirmed.\n\nHart also commented on the demographic makeup of the attendees inside the Kia Forum. \"I've never seen Inglewood so white,\" he quipped of the Los Angeles suburb where the venue is located. \"It's so fucking white in here. It looks like a Bruce Springsteen concert just let out. This used to be the home of the Lakers, now it's the home of the Quakers.\"\n\nHart went on to joke about Brady's former gig as an ambassador for failed cryptocurrency giant FTX (Brady also lost $30 million in crypto investments). \"You're saying, 'Guys, why didn't we go to the Crypto.com Arena downtown?'\" Hart said. \"Well, the reason why we didn't go there is because he didn't want to remind Tom's fans of how much money he owes them. He fucked those people. ... Fucked 'em good, didn't he?\"\n\nAfter introducing Brady -- the seven-time Super Bowl champion came onstage with brief remarks (\"Are you guys ready? Because I am\") -- Hart continued his roast.\n\n\"You know, Tom, this is crazy because for more than 20 years, Tom has ruined Sundays for football fans all over the country,\" Hart said. \"But tonight, well, tonight we're gonna ruin yours, Tom. I'm gonna ruin your fucking Sunday.\"\n\nAs might be expected, many of the jokes centered on Brady's divorce from his ex-wife, Gisele B\u00fcndchen, with whom he shares two kids. The jokes not only took aim at Brady but also B\u00fcndchen.\n\n\"Single life is what you deserve because you had no choice,\" Hart said. \"Gisele gave you an ultimatum. Gisele said, 'You retire or we're done.' ... Let me tell you something: When you got a chance to go eight and nine, and all it will cost you is your wife and your kids, you gotta do what the fuck you gotta do. ... You know what that's called, Tom? That's called real shit. Fuck them kids.\"\n\nHe then added Brady's coach of 18 seasons, former New England Patriots coach Bill Belichick, into the mix.\n\n\"The world knows that you left Bill Belichick high and dry, man,\" Hart said. \"You left him and then you went to Tampa and you won a championship. You left Bill Belichick with [quarterback] Matt Jones. ... You fucked your coach. But let me tell you something. ... That's what you gotta do to maintain your happiness. You understand, you sometimes gotta fuck your coach. You know who else fucked that coach? Gisele. She fucked that karate man.\" (That's a reference to B\u00fcndchen's reported boyfriend, jiu-jitsu instructor Joaquim Valente.)\n\n\"What an idiot,\" Hart continued. \"I mean, Jesus Christ, Tom, one of the smartest quarterbacks ever played a game. How did you not see this coming? Eight fucking karate classes a day. ... The only bruises she had were on her ass. Everybody should have known it.\"\n\nJeff Ross followed Hart, armed with his own jokes about Brady's marriage to B\u00fcndchen.\n\n\"Give it up for the lord of the Super Bowl rings: my friend Tom Brady, a man who has so many rings, he could melt them down and forge a sword to go on a quest to get Gisele back from that jiu-jitsu teacher,\" he joked. \"You're a legend, Tom. You really are. You really put the jizz in Gisele.\"\n\nRoss went on to note that Brady was drafted 199th in the NFL draft. \"You sat there for days waiting and waiting and then you were finally picked in the sixth round when Bill Belichick's dog stepped on the keyboard by accident, son,\" he quipped.\n\nRoss also referenced deflategate, the 2015 scandal in which the NFL disciplined Brady and the Patriots for lowering the inflation of game footballs, which the NFL did not allow, after saying it found evidence of the deflation during the AFC Championship Game.\n\n\"I really wanted you to be our first G.O.A.T. to be roasted because you're an example to future generations that if you work hard eat right, film the other team's practices, deflate the balls and have the NFL make new rules just for you, then you too can be the third most famous guy in a Dunkin Donuts commercial, Tommy,\" Ross joked.\n\nBelichick also appeared, to a standing ovation and loud applause, to serve up his own jokes about many of his former players who were at the event. He also brought up the English soccer team that Brady co-owns, Birmingham City.\n\n\"I see your soccer team, Birmingham City, got knocked down to another tier in the English football league,\" he said. \"So you know, for those not familiar with English football and the intricacies to their obscure regulation system, just let me say -- I'll put it in English for you: They suck. It's not so easy running a team, is it, Tom?\"\n\nHe went on: \"Seriously, Tom and I had had our differences but, you know, it only comes to love and respect about our relationship and we did some special things together, you know. For all of you out there that think about who's responsible for the patriots success during the time when Tom and I were there: Was it Brady? Was it me? Was it Brady? Was it me? In reality, the truth of the matter is it was both of us. Because of me.\"\n\nAfter Belichick exited the stage, Hart noted that he'd had jokes ready aimed at the legendary coach but said he was so touched by Belichick's appearance that he was going to forgo the jabs. (This move was confirmed to be a good one when Hart tried to explain one of the jokes that didn't go over so well, and Belichick playfully threw his handkerchief at Hart. Hart protested the move, which he likened to getting a flag thrown on a play in football.)\n\n\"I really was a little touched just the fact that you came out,\" Hart told Belichick. \"I'm dead serious right now. That was a very gentleman-like move on your behalf, Tom. You better fucking appreciate that and tell him about it later.\"\n\nNikki Glaser noted Brady's accomplishments onstage: \"Five-time Super Bowl MVP, most career wins, most career touchdowns. You have seven rings. Well, eight, now that Gisele gave hers back.\n\n\"But sorry, Tom, the only thing dumber than you saying yes to this roast was when you said, 'Hey, babe, you should try jiu jitsu.'\"\n\nGlaser continued: \"But seriously, Tom .. you're the best to ever play for too long. I mean, you retired, then you came back and then you retired again. I mean, I get it. It's hard to walk away from something that's not your pregnant girlfriend [Bridget Moynahan]. To be fair, he didn't know she was pregnant. He just thought she was getting fat and Tom hates fat.\"\n\nGlaser also had a through-line of how attractive she finds Brady: \"To be honest, Tom, I didn't really know a ton about your career before this and I only really started watching football when Taylor Swift said it was OK. But what I've learned, I'm in a absolute awe of you. You were a sixth-round draft pick that really everyone kind of counted out, no one believed in. And then you became this, you became the greatest of all time. And if I've learned anything, if I've learned anything about this man is that if you tell Tom Brady, he can't do something. Not only will he do it, but he'll do it the best it's ever been done. So I'm here to say tonight, Tom Brady cannot make me come.\"\n\nWill Ferrell appeared in character as Ron Burgundy, his character in the Anchorman films, also remarked on Brady's looks.\n\n\"This man is gorgeous. ... Look at those cheekbones. That's a million-watt smile right there. ... I could get lost in those eyes and right now I am that person. Ron, pull it together. You're a straight man. He's making you question your sexuality. Stop looking at him. You're here to make fun of him. Not fall in love. Concentrate.\n\n\"I never liked you Tom in all my years of watching professional football. I never saw a more boring quarterback,\" he said, later adding: \"He actually made me look forward to all the fun and laughter of a Bill Belichick postgame interview.\"\n\nKim Kardashian also took the stage, noting the rumors that once swirled that the two were dating. \"I know there were some rumors that we were, and I'd never say if we did or not,\" she said. \"I'd just release a tape.\"\n\nShe went on: \"But I do know it would never work out,\" noting that Brady is a former athlete with strong cheekbones and \"silky hair.\"\n\n\"You remind me too much of my stepdad now,\" she quipped of Caitlyn Jenner. \"Oh, part of me thinks you would want to [date] me just to try on my clothes. I know the transition from the NFL must have been really hard. But I think my stepdad is a great example for you. She's one of the best athletes in the world who proved you can do anything in this next chapter of your life. You can become a commentator or a far-right-wing Republican or even a strong confident woman.\"\n\nShe added: \"Honestly, it's hard for me to watch people roast you. But I think enough of my family members have helped defend former football players,\" she joked of her late father, Robert Kardashian, who was on O.J. Simpson's defense team during the latter's murder trial.\n\nBrady's former teammate Julian Edelman -- who referred to the Super Bowl champ as \"Leonardo DiCaprio's ex-girlfriend's ex-husband\" -- joked about what his and Brady's teammates used to call a \"bromance\" between the two.\n\n\"I know there's going to be a lot of jokes about me being gay for Tom,\" Edelman said. \"Well, let me set the record straight. Those balls weren't going to deflate themselves.\"\n\nFor his part, Brady laughed along with the jabs, though he did seem a bit uncomfortable amid some of the harsher B\u00fcndchen jokes. But one joke seemed to irk him more than others. During his turn onstage, Ross quipped: \"So Tom became a Patriot and moved up to New England, and on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the [Patriots] owner Robert Kraft's office and said, 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made. Would you like a massage?'\" Brady then approached Ross, who'd blown a kiss Kraft's way, and said in his ear: \"Don't say that shit again.\" Ross replied, \"OK.\"\n\nThe joke was a reference to a 2019 incident in which Kraft was charged with soliciting prostitution after an investigation into massage parlors in Florida. Police said they had recorded Kraft paying for sex acts. He pleaded not guilty, and a federal judge in later ordered that the recordings be destroyed after it was found they were filmed unlawfully. The case was dismissed later that year.\n\nAt the end of the night, Brady took the stage. \"People ask: 'Tom, why would you do this roast?'\" he added. \"It's simple. I can take all the hits. I would have done this earlier, but I've just been too busy winning championships.\"\n\nHe also got back at some of his roasters.\n\nOn Peyton Manning: \"Thank you so much for coming out to L.A. to do this. I know sometimes you live in Denver and sometimes you live in Louisiana, but you'll always live in my shadow.\"\n\nOn Hart: \"I've heard some people talk about me having bad knees. You know, my knees are so fucked up, Kevin, because I spent so many goddamn hours on the floor begging Netflix to get [Dave] Chappelle to host this.\"\n\nOn Kardashian: \"Thank you so much for being here. I know Kim was terrified to be here tonight. Not because of this, but because her kids are home with their dad,\" Kanye West.\n\nOn NFL commissioner Roger Goodell (who was not present): \"Remember deflategate? The NFL spent $20 million and found that it was more probable than not that I was generally aware that someone may have deflated my footballs. You could have just given me the $20 million, and I would just told you I fucking did it.\"\n\nOn Kansas City fans: \"You say your stadium is the loudest. It helps when all your fans are 14-year-old girls. And in honor of Tay-Tay [Taylor Swift], let's take a look at the Chiefs 'eras': terrible for 50 years, good for five. Shake it off.\"\n\nOn Belichick: \"Everybody asked me which ring is my favorite. I used to say the next one, but now that I'm retired, my favorite ring is the camera that caught coach Belichick slinking out of that poor girl's house at 6 a.m. a few months ago. Hey, you still got it. .... You know, we've been through so much and after two decades, I finally had to admit that all along it was you. You're the reason for the Patriots dynasty because you Bill Belichick, you are a true coaching genius. I mean, you had to choose between an aging injured, overpaid Drew Bledsoe and a young healthy minimum-wage superstar. I could have got a fucking coach from Hawks Foxborough fucking high school to make that decision. ... I've been out of the game for a minute. So I'm curious, how many Super Bowl Rings have you won since I left?\"\n\nThe three-hour-plus roast, which was part of the Netflix Is a Joke Fest, was streamed live, which Netflix touted as the first-ever roast to be telecast live, unedited. The festivities, held at L.A.'s Kia Forum in Inglewood, kicked off shortly after 4 p.m., with guests filing into the arena. DJ Trauma spun some beats as stars in the front section took their seats at banquet style tables.\n\nAmong the other bold-faced names in attendance were Ben Affleck, Jim Gaffigan, Amanda Kloots, Richard Kind, Chelsea Handler and Dane Cook, along with NFL pros Rob Gronkowski (who also wound up as the butt of many of the evening's jokes), Randy Moss, Rodney Harrison, Julian, Edelman and Matt Light.\n\nJudging from the scene inside and around the Forum, you would be forgiven for thinking that Sunday's event was a typical big ticket football game. The show, which was a ticketed event for sale to the general public, drew hordes of Brady fans who arrived decked out in football jerseys. The majority were decked out on New England Patriots gear, while others were wearing Tampa Bay Buccaneers jerseys to represent the NFL team where he closed out his iconic career.\n\nThe roast was executive produced by Brady, Casey Patterson, Ross, Hart and Jeff Clanagan for Hartbeat.", "source": {"uri": "hollywoodreporter.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "The Hollywood Reporter"}, "authors": Brady also has a son, Jack, 16, with ex-girlfriend Bridget Moynahan.\n\nHowever, it was another subject that really triggered the NFL icon, as America's 'Roastmaster General' Jeff Ross referred to a scenario when Brady introduced himself to Patriots owner Robert Kraft.\n\n\"Tom became a Patriot, moved up to New England, and on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said, I'm the greatest decision your organisation has ever made... would you like a massage,\" Ross joked.\n\nThe gag was a reference to when Kraft was charged with soliciting a prostitute back in 2019, which drew gasp and laughs from across the room. But Brady appeared unimpressed and approached Ross mid-set.\n\n\"Don't say that s*** again,\" Brady said with a smile, while his hand poorly covered up the microphone.\n\nKraft was one of 25 people facing a misdemeanour charge for soliciting prostitution at a Florida day spa in February 2019. He pleaded not guilty and the charges were dropped in September of 2019 after a Florida appeals court ruled his constitutional rights were violated.\n\nKraft's attorneys revealed hidden cameras were installed at the spa before he visited under the guise of a response to a bomb threat. The Dynasty, a Kraft-copyrighted series on Apple TV that highlighted Brady and diminished Belichick, that was released a couple of months ago certainly added to the chasm.\n\nDuring his time at the mic on Sunday night, Belichick addressed the docuseries. \"Seriously, I'm so honored to be here for the roast of Tom Brady on Netflix,\" he said. \"Not to be confused with the 10-part Bill Belichick roast during the Apple TV doc.\"\n\nThough Kraft didn't single out Belichick by name, it was fairly obvious who he was referencing during his time with the mic when he compared the Patriot-heavy roast to a family reunion. \"Like many family reunions, there are some people I am desperately trying to avoid,\" Kraft said.\n\nThe jokes were playful, but it was hard not to notice that Kraft and Belichick were seated about as far away from each other as possible on the roasting stage and that the latter clearly appeared uncomfortable when Kevin Hart called for him to take a shot with the former. Regardless of his feelings, a grin-less Belichick did step to center stage and down some tequila with Kraft, but it looked as if the ceremonial gesture may have burned him as much as the alcohol.\n\nOf course, given that Mr. \"Do Your Job\" is now looking for one and can ill afford for Kraft to torpedo his employment search again (allegedly), Belichick will probably place nice, for a time. {"uri": "8113070423", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "03:28:25", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T03:28:25Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T03:27:48Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6431372761726379, "url": "https://www.totalprosports.com/nfl/video-bill-belichick-ruthlessly-destroyed-patriots-owner-robert-kraft-during-the-roast-of-tom-brady/", "title": "VIDEO: Bill Belichick Ruthlessly Destroyed Patriots Owner Robert Kraft During \"The Roast Of Tom Brady\"", "body": "Former New England Patriots head coach Bill Belichick did not disappoint whatsoever during his performance on Netflix's \"The Roast of Tom Brady\" special.\n\nNetflix brought out Bill Belichick as one of the high-profile folks to \"roast\" the seven-time Super Bowl champion on Netflix. The event, hosted by Kevin Hart, also featured appearances from other notable celebrities like Julian Edelman, Rob Gronkowski, Kim Kardashian and Jeff Ross.\n\nBelichick, who coached Brady for 20 seasons in New England from 2000 to 2019, did not waste time getting the audience fired up. Before roasting Brady, the 72-year-old took aim at Patriots owner Robert Kraft with a ruthless shot at his former employer:\n\n\"I'm so honored to be here for the roast of Tom Brady on Netflix, not to be confused with the roast of Bill Belichick on the 10 Part doc.\"\n\nAlso Read: New England Patriots' Latest Move Makes It Clear They Want Nothing To Do With Bill Belichick And His Legacy Anymore\n\nFor those unfamiliar, Apple TV+ produced a 10-part series on the Patriots' two-decade run of dominance called \"The Dynasty.\" Many fans and former Patriots players were highly critical of the docuseries, believing it was meant to paint Belichick in a bad light.\n\nAfter waiting for several weeks, fans finally got a response from Bill Belichick, who's known for being a man of very few words. Though it's unlikely to happen, it sure would be fun to see Mr. Kraft respond to this roast...\n\nIt's well-known by now that Belichick's relationships with Brady and Kraft did not end on the best of notes. But this doesn't take away the unprecedented history and run of success the three enjoyed together in New England.\n\nThe Patriots won six Super Bowls over a 17-year span from 2001 to 2018. The Pittsburgh Steelers are the only other NFL franchise to have won six Super Bowls, and they did it over a 34-year period from 1974 to 2008.\n\nFrom 2001 to 2019, the Patriots had only winning seasons and won their division every year except 2002 and 2008. They reached nine Super Bowls over that two-decade run of dominance and had double-digit wins every season from 2003 to 2019. In short, you aren't going to see a period of historic greatest like that ever again.", "source": {"uri": "totalprosports.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Total Pro Sports"}, "authors": [{"uri": {"uri": "8114317621", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "19:01:50", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T19:01:50Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T19:01:14Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6431372761726379, "url": "https://www.nbcsportsboston.com/nfl/new-england-patriots/tom-brady-roast-winners-losers-bill-belichick-nikki-glaser/610499/", "title": "Winners and losers from a Tom Brady roast that exceeded expectations", "body": "It turns out the best way to heal old wounds is to open them all up in front of a live primetime audience.\n\n\"The Roast of Tom Brady,\" a live Netflix special in Los Angeles on Sunday night in which the former New England Patriots quarterback opened himself to ruthless insults from celebrities, comedians, ex-teammates and even his old boss, Bill Belichick, had the potential to get awkward in a hurry.\n\nAnd while there was one awkward moment between Brady and comedian Jeff Ross, the event on the whole had a cathartic feel, with Brady, Belichick and Patriots owner Robert Kraft gamely absorbing jokes about supposedly sensitive topics, including Brady's divorce from Gisele Bundchen; Belichick's split from his longtime girlfriend, Linda Holliday; whether Brady or Belichick deserves more credit for New England's dynasty; and Deflategate.\n\nA host of ex-Patriots players also joined in on the fun, with Julian Edelman, Rob Gronkowski, Randy Moss, Drew Bledsoe and more taking turns to roast their former quarterback.\n\nSince Brady makes everything a competition, we're handing out winners and losers from the three-hour chop-busting session.\n\nThe Bill Belichick Redemption Tour continues.\n\nExpectations were low for the ex-Patriots coach, who's best known for his grunts and one-word answers at press conferences. But Belichick came to play, dropping a one-liner right off the bat by calling out his portrayal in the Apple TV+ docuseries, \"The Dynasty.\"\n\n\"I'm so honored to be here for the roast of Tom Brady on Netflix. It's not to be confused with the roast of Bill Belichick on the 10-part Apple TV series,\" Belichick joked.\n\nBelichick didn't hold back on Brady, either, addressing their at-times-strenuous relationship by bringing up a reported sore spot: Brady's personal trainer, Alex Guerrero.\n\n\"People have said it, Tom and I butted heads a lot,\" Belichick said. \"And in a way that was true. But it was hard to butt heads with Tom, because he was so far up Alex Guerrero's ass.\"\n\nBetween Sunday's roast and his appearance on The Pat McAfee Show during the 2024 NFL Draft, Belichick is showing a much more congenial side -- and perhaps making NFL fans forget that he failed to land a head coaching job this offseason.\n\nBelichick kept his burns of former Patriots players mostly off the field, with one notable exception: ex-Patriots wide receiver Danny Amendola.\n\n\"Danny joined us in 2014 and got us 200 yards that year,\" Belichick said. \"And in 2016, he picked up another 250. Or to put it another way, what Randy (Moss) would call a decent first half.\"\n\nAmendola was fairly critical of Belichick in the Apple TV+ docuseries -- \"I could've gotten the kid from Foxborough High School to tell you that you shouldn't have let Tom Brady go,\" Amendola said in one episode -- so was Belichick's chance for a rebuttal. Amendola didn't seem particularly amused by Belichick's dig, so we're chalking this up as a loss.\n\nNot only did Harrison avoid getting roasted Sunday night, he actually got an endorsement from Belichick, who made another case for the ex-Patriots safety to be inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame.\n\n\"One of the greatest players I've ever coached,\" Belichick said of Harrison. \"He was a great, great football player. Great person. Great competitor. He's not in the Pro Football Hall of Fame, and to me, that might be the biggest joke of the night.\"\n\nWhether Harrison eventually gets the nod is unclear -- he was one of 28 semifinalists in 2023 -- but there's no doubt Belichick is in his corner.\n\nMoss is a dynamic personality -- he was excellent in \"The Dynasty\" -- but his roast of Brady fell disappointingly flat. The Hall of Fame receiver mostly lamented not winning a ring during his three seasons in New England from 2007 to 2010 and made a passing reference to Deflategate, telling Brady, \"Why the f--- didn't we cheat when I was there?\"\n\nMoss' performance certainly wasn't the worst of the night, but expectations were higher here.\n\nBelichick and his former players had some pretty good material, but most of it paled in comparison to the real comedians in the house -- especially Nikki Glaser.\n\nThe comedian/actress/podcast host came out swinging in her set with some vicious digs about Brady's divorce from Gisele and rumors that Gisele is now dating her jiu-jitsu instructor.\n\n\"The only thing dumber than you saying yes to this roast is when you said, 'Hey babe, you should try jiu-jitsu,\" Glaser quipped.\n\nGlaser also made several more jokes we can't repeat here, but she was undoubtedly one of the stars of the show.\n\nWhy was Kardashian at Brady's roast, you ask? Apparently many in attendance had the same question.\n\nKardashian was the only roaster who was loudly booed when she took the stage -- to the point where host Kevin Hart had to tell the audience to stop -- and didn't really contribute much during her brief set.\n\nThe Patriots' dynasty ended with plenty of drama and reported infighting. But on Sunday night, the key figures finally let their guards down.\n\nBrady and Belichick both declared their mutual respect for one another after trading good-natured barbs. Belichick and Kraft took a shot together on stage (even if Belichick didn't look particularly thrilled to be there). Brady addressed one of the several elephants in the room with a Deflategate joke.\n\nSeveral topics that many Patriots fans thought would never be discussed in public were aired out by the dynasty's main actors, who cut out the \"middle man\" and addressed some of their thornier issues head-on.\n\nIn a way, Sunday night felt like closure for New England fans, who now can focus on celebrating those six Super Bowls in 20 years instead of wondering how the dynasty fell apart.", "source": {"uri": "nbcsportsboston.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "NBC Sports Boston"}, "authors": [], {"uri": "8113926434", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "14:03:30", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T14:03:30Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T14:03:08Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6431372761726379, "url": "https://talksport.com/football/1856624/bill-belichick-birmingham-city-dig-netflix-tom-brady-roast/", "title": "Belichick 'takes the p***' out of Birmingham relegation on Netflix's Brady Roast", "body": "Birmingham City were caught in the crossfire as Bill Belichick roasted Tom Brady on Netflix.\n\nThe Blues were relegated to League One on Saturday after their 1-0 win over Norwich proved not to be enough to save them, earning themselves a spot in the third tier for the first time since 1995.\n\nBut as Birmingham fans were still licking their wounds from a weekend of heartbreak, their co-owner, NFL legend Tom Brady, was getting roasted on Netflix - and the Blues got a... special mention.\n\nNetflix's latest edition of \"The Greatest Roast of All Time\" saw seven-time Super Bowl Brady being ripped into by a number of big names, including Kim Kardashian and Will Ferrell, with the latter also reportedly following in Brady's footsteps and buying into an EFL club.\n\nBut the one Blues fans have taken notice of was Brady's legendary coach at the New England Patriots, Bill Belichick, as he jokingly tore into the club following last weekend's relegation.\n\nAddressing Brady whilst on stage in front of a large audience, Belichick said: \"I see your soccer team Birmingham City got knocked down another tier in the English Football League, so you know.\n\n\"For those not familiar with English football, thanks to the intricacies of their obscure regulations system, just let me say, or I'll put it in English for you, they suck!\"\n\nThe audience then burst out laughing, with Brady also left with a huge grin plastered across his face.\n\nHe then appeared to respond, off mic, asking: \"Do you want to coach them?\"\n\nBut Belichick carried on, adding: \"Not so easy to run a team is it Tom!\"\n\nBrady could only smile as he took in the good-natured dig and the rest of the room cracks up once again.\n\nBrady and Belichick won six Super Bowls together with the New England Patriots, dominating NFL for two decades.\n\nHowever, their time together ended on slightly sour terms, with Brady wanting to stay with New England in 2019, only for Belichick to believe the ageing quarter-back was past his prime.\n\nBrady then went on to win a Super Bowl with Tampa Bay, retiring there in 2022. Meanwhile, Belichick departed the Patriots in January this year, marking an end to his 24 years there.\n\nThere had been plenty of stories regarding the friction between the pair in recent years. No wonder fans were thrilled when they heard they would be reunited for Netflix's hit show.\n\nMeanwhile, Blues fans have also seen the funny side to the NFL legends' banter.\n\n\"Bill Belichick taking the piss out of Birmingham City for being relegated at the Brady Roast,\" one fan wrote on X. \"When we win the Champions League in 2030, this will be the first clip in the winners story montage.\"\n\nAnother said: \"We are massive!!! Keep Right On.\"\n\nBrady entered into a partnership with US-based Knighthead Capital Management LLC, who completed the takeover of Birmingham last August. {"uri": "8114173252", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "16:58:37", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T16:58:37Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T16:58:14Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6431372761726379, "url": "https://www.givemesport.com/tom-brady-drops-bombshell-about-deflategate-netflix-roast/", "title": "Tom Brady Drops A Bombshell To Cap Off His Netflix Roast", "body": "The legendary quarterback may have admitted some guilt regarding one of the league's most infamous recent scandals on Sunday night.\n\nHighlights The Roast of Tom Brady occurred on Netflix last night, and it was an entertaining event starring Brady and others from his playing career. Tom Brady addressed \"Deflategate\" at the roast, leading to various interpretations of his comments on the scandal. Some may argue that Brady admitted fault in the scandal, while others will claim that the longtime QB was merely poking fun at the league's vendetta against him.\n\nThe Roast of Tom Brady happened on Netflix last night, and the event didn't fail to live up to the hype.\n\nBill Belichick got in on the roasting action, as did longtime tight end and Brady favorite Rob Gronkowski. All in all, it was a hilarious trip down memory lane for those who fondly (or not so fondly) remember the career of the former New England Patriots and Tampa Bay Bucaneers quarterback.\n\nHowever, arguably the most impactful juncture of the night came towards the end of the proceedings, as Brady took the mic to address the disses he had been served throughout the roast. It was then that Brady addressed the infamous \"Deflategate\" scandal.\n\nThe comments got a standing ovation out of the notoriously mundane Belichick, and garnered looks of shock from Gronkowski and Patriots owner Robert Kraft.\n\nThough it's impossible to say exactly what Brady's intentions were with the remarks, it was the most memorable moment from a night full of them.\n\nRelated Bucs GM: Proving Everybody Wrong After Brady Retirement Is 'Part Of Our DNA' The Tampa Bay Buccaneers proved everyone wrong during the 2023 season, winning their division. Their GM claims its 'part of their DNA'. Did Brady Admit Fault in \"Deflategate\"? There have been a few interpretations of the QB's quote making the rounds since last night\n\nFor those that didn't have a chance to watch the roast (or couldn't view the Twitter/X clip above), the most pertinent quote from Brady regarded the league's extensive (and expensive) investigation into the \"Deflategate\" scandal:\n\n\"The NFL spent $20 million and found that it was more probable than not that I was generally aware that someone may have deflated my footballs... you could've just given me the $20M, and I would've just told you I f**king did it.\"\n\nNow, there are a couple of interpretations one could make about Brady's quote, though which side you fall on may have more to do with your feelings towards the greatest quarterback ever rather than an actual attempt at deciphering the meaning of the remark itself.\n\nOne interpretation is that Brady is making fun of Roger Goodell and the league for wasting so much time and so many resources on the investigation, given that he wasn't complicit in the scandal. In that sense, Brady is saying that the league should've just handed him the money they used to look into the scandal, and he would've admitted to guilt to save everyone time.\n\nAnother (less generous) reading of the quote is that Brady, after nearly three hours of getting roasted and downing many drinks, simply slipped up or decided he needed to get an eight-year weight off his chest. It's hard to believe that Brady would ever admit to such a thing given his otherwise impervious standing atop the league's greatest signal caller charts, but it is hilarious to imagine him giving Goodell the proverbial middle finger now that he's retired.\n\nOf course, you could just chalk it up to an inebriated guy playing into the comedic theme of the night. Though not as fun for discussion and tabloid purposes, it's possible that Brady was just engaging in some self-deprecating humor for the sake of the roast.\n\nGIVEMESPORT Key Stat: Regardless of whether Brady was actually guilty in \"Deflategate\", he quickly proved he didn't need deflated footballs to be the GOAT. After serving a four-game suspension to start the 2016 season due to the scandal, he finished second in regular season MVP voting before leading the greatest comeback in NFL history during the Super Bowl (the 28-3 game versus the Atlanta Falcons), earning an unprecedented fourth Super Bowl MVP.\n\nNo matter how you interpret Brady's jab at the whole situation, the roast itself was an entertaining event that drew a star-studded crowd and team of roasters. Though it sounds like the greatest QB to ever play the game has no intention of making a comeback, spectacles like this can serve as a fun (or traumatic, if you're a Jets fan) reminder of his playing Gisele said, 'You retire or we're done. That's what she said to you, Tom. 'You retire, or we're done.' Let me tell you something. When you got a chance to go 8-9, and all it will cost is your wife and your kids, you gotta do what the f -- you gotta do.\"\n\nHart also referred to rumors that B\u00fcndchen has been dating her jiu-jitsu coach, Joaquim Valente.\n\n\"I mean, Jesus Christ, Tom, one of the smartest quarterbacks who ever played the game, how did you not see this coming?\" Hart said. \"Eight f -- ing karate classes a day?\"\n\nGlaser also took aim at Brady's divorce.\n\n\"Five-time Super Bowl MVP, most career wins, most career touchdowns. You have seven rings. Well, eight, now that Gisele gave hers back,\" she said.\n\n\"But sorry, Tom, the only thing dumber than you saying yes to this roast was when you said, 'Hey, babe, you should try jiu jitsu.' That's gotta suck,\" she added.\n\nComedian Jeff Ross also didn't pull any punches when it came to jokes about their divorce.\n\n\"Give it up for the lord of the Super Bowl rings, my friend Tom Brady,\" he said. \"A man who has so many rings, he could melt them down and forge a sword to go on a quest to get Gisele back from that jiu-jitsu teacher.\"\n\nWill Ferrell also riffed about B\u00fcndchen and Brady's relationship, appearing as his \"Anchorman\" character, Ron Burgundy.\n\n\"Is it Gisele or Gisiele? .... She's Spanish, right? Oh, you don't even know? OK,\" he said, addressing Brady.\n\n\"Poor Gisiele,\" he continued. \"It took her 13 years to learn what we all knew. Tom is boring.\"\n\nBrady, 46, and B\u00fcndchen, 43, divorced in October 2022 after 13 years of marriage.\n\n\"We arrived at this decision to end our marriage after much consideration,\" Brady wrote in his Instagram story at the time.\n\nHe also wrote that he and B\u00fcndchen \"wish only the best for each other as we pursue whatever new chapters in our lives that are yet to be written.\"\n\nB\u00fcndchen also confirmed in her Instagram story that she and Brady had \"amicably finalized\" their divorce.\n\n\"My priority has always been and will continue to be our children whom I love with all my heart,\" she wrote.\n\nBrady and B\u00fcndchen share two children: Benjamin, 14, and Vivian, 11. Brady also has a son, John \"Jack\" Edward Thomas, from his previous relationship with actor Bridget Moynahan.\n\nIn March 2024, the Brazilian supermodel shot down rumors that she had cheated on Brady before their marriage ended.\n\n\"That is a lie,\" she said in an interview with The New York Times.\n\n\"This is something that happens to a lot of women who get blamed when they have the courage to leave an unhealthy relationship and are labeled as being unfaithful,\" she added.\n\n\"They have to deal with their communities. {"uri": "2024-05-346595458", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "14:19:03", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T14:19:03Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T14:12:17Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6392157077789307, "url": "https://www.mensjournal.com/news/tom-brady-robert-kraft-joke-netflix-roast", "title": "The Joke That Went Too Far for Tom Brady at His Netflix Roast", "body": "For three hours on Sunday night, comedians and celebrities took shots at the greatest quarterback in NFL history during the roast of Tom Brady as part of the Netflix is a Joke festival. But while the guest of honor took most of the jokes in stride -- even about his highly publicized divorce -- the joke that went too far for Brady involved New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft.\n\nBrady spent 20 seasons with the Patriots, and his relationship with Kraft and head coach Bill Belichick is generally regarded to be one of the most successful sports dynasties of all time. But Brady was hardly a \"get\" during the 2000 NFL draft, being selected 199th overall, as roastmaster Jeff Ross pointed out about five minutes into his set at the podium.\n\n\"He sat there for days, waiting and waiting, and then you were finally picked in the sixth round when Bill Belichick's dog stepped on the keyboard by accident,\" Ross quipped.\n\nHe then recalled the story when Brady, as a wet-behind-the-ears rookie, told Kraft upon being drafted, \"I'm the best decision your organization has ever made.\" The audience went wild with applause until Ross let the other shoe drop, adding: \"Would you like a massage?\"\n\nThe comedian was referring to the scandal in which Kraft was among over two dozen people busted in a prostitution sting at a Boston massage parlor in 2019. The charges were eventually dropped, but suffice to say, Brady was not amused.\n\nThe squeaky clean 46-year-old got up from his seat on the stage and approached Ross, whispering into his ear: \"Don't say that s--t again.\"\n\nA nervous-looking Ross relented. \"OK, OK. He's having fun, look at him,\" he said, gesturing to Kraft, who appeared to be laughing it off. \"I love what you do for the Jews, Robert Kraft. You're incredible.\"\n\nAccording to CBS News, the awkward exchange wasn't heard by those seated in the audience, but millions watching at home caught it. At any rate, after Ross' set, the two appeared to have gotten over it, as the pair hugged onstage and smiled as they chatted before moving on with the show.\n\nBut while it's a possibility that the moment was scripted for the show, John Breech of CBS Sports surmised that Brady did indeed seem prickled by the joke.\n\n\"It's certainly possible this was all part of the act, but it definitely felt like Brady was legitimately upset with the joke,\" Breech wrote. \"On a night where there were plenty of uncomfortable jokes, this seemed to be the only one that truly got under Brady's skin.\"", LiMay 6, 2024 at 6:42 PM\n\nSure-fire Hall of Fame quarterback Tom Brady might be able to take a joke -- but apparently not when his pal's being roasted.\n\nBrady lashed out at funnyman Jeff Ross during Sunday's \"The Roast of Tom Brady\" on Netflix, which was livestreamed, after the roast master took aim at New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft over the football executive's 2019 visit to a Florida massage parlor.\n\n\"And on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made,'\" Ross said during the Netflix roast. \"'Would you like a massage?'\"\n\nA smiling Brady initially appeared to take the shot at his former employer in stride. But then seconds later got up from his seat, reached the podium and whispered to Ross: \"Don't say that s--- again.\"\n\nRoss kept smiling, thew up his hands and said \"OK, OK, OK\" before the show went on without any Will Smith/Chris Rock-syle drama.\n\nThe whole moment was caught on camera and microphones picked up Brady's admonishment during the live special.\n\nKraft was accused of paying for sex acts at the Orchids of Asia Day Spa in Jupiter, Florida, in January 2019. The Patriots owner pleaded not guilty, but issued a public apology for what happened.\n\nBut more than 1 1/2 years later, Florida prosecutors dropped solicitation charges after an appeals court ruled video and audio surveillance of Kraft was inadmissible. The court said Jupiter police violated the rights of Kraft and others when they secretly installed video cameras inside massage rooms.\n\nBrady curiously drew the line at Kraft during a night filled with offensive jokes, which included shots at the QB's family and love life -- and even one-liners about deceased teammate and accused murderer Aaron Hernandez.\n\nBrady used Hernandez in his roast of tight end Rob Gronkowski.\n\n\"The bar for Patriots tight ends was pretty low back then, block, catch, don't murder,\" Brady said to a room of mixed laughs and groans.\n\nComic Nikki Glaser teased former Pats wide receiver Randy Moss also made light of Hernandez's jailhouse suicide.", "source": {"uri": "aol.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Aol"}, "authors": [{"uri": "david_k_li@aol.com", "name": "David K. {"uri": "8114211928", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "17:28:23", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T17:28:23Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T17:28:03Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6352941393852234, "url": "https://www.thecut.com/article/most-awkward-moments-tom-brady-roast-gisele-bundchen.html", "title": "The Most Awkward Moments From Tom Brady's Roast", "body": "The Roast of Tom Brady aired live on Netflix on Sunday night as the retired football star gamely sat through three hours of jokes at his expense. That's far too long to watch anything that isn't Titanic, so let's cut right to the stuff you really want to know about: What were the most awkward moments of the night? Let's get into it.\n\nKevin Hart was the emcee and started the show with a string of jokes about the dissolution of Brady's marriage to Gisele B\u00fcndchen. This set the tenor for the rest of the night, which at times seemed as though it was mostly about Brady's wife leaving him.\n\n\"The world knows you left Bill Belichick high and dry, man. You left him and then you went to Tampa and you won a championship,\" Hart said. \"That's what you gotta do to maintain your happiness. Sometimes you gotta fuck your coach. You know who else fucked their coach? Gisele. She fucked that karate man.\"\n\nB\u00fcndchen's new man is actually a jiujitsu instructor, but that's neither here nor there. Brady suffered through what felt like hours of Gisele jokes and did it all with a toothy smile plastered across his face. The lack of light in his eyes told a different story, however.\n\nJeff Ross came out dressed as \"Roast J. Simpson,\" wearing a football uniform detailed with flames (he arrived \"from hell\") and a pair of leather gloves. \"If the glove don't fit, you must talk shit,\" he said. The comedian, most famous for his roasting skills, followed through on that promise and produced the most tense moment of the night.\n\nRoss wound up by recounting a moment when Brady, drafted 199th in the NFL, walked into Patriots owner Robert Kraft's office and said, \"I'm the best decision your organization has ever made.\" The audience gave a big round of applause before Ross delivered the punch line: \"Would you like a massage?\"\n\nThe arena erupted with laughter at Ross's reference to Kraft's 2019 arrest for soliciting prostitution at a Florida massage parlor. Brady kept his smile glued to his face but went up to Ross at the podium and audibly told the comedian, \"Don't say that shit again.\" Was he joking? Well, as we learned later in the evening, Brady can be pretty funny, but it's unclear if he's that funny.\n\nOf all the roasters, Nikki Glaser might have gotten the biggest reaction of the night. The stand-up comic and roast regular received a standing ovation for her razor-sharp set, which, of course, included several jokes about B\u00fcndchen.\n\n\"Tom Brady: five-time Super Bowl MVP, most career wins, most career touchdowns,\" Glaser said. \"You have seven rings -- well, eight, now that Gisele gave hers back.\"\n\n\"The only thing dumber than saying 'yes' to this roast was when you said, 'Hey, babe, you should try jiujitsu,'\" Glaser joked. \"How much must that suck to know that your ex-wife's new boyfriend can beat your ass while eating hers?\"\n\nKim Kardashian came onstage and was greeted with boos from the audience. Like a true professional, she brushed it off and dived right into her prepared jokes.\n\nSomeone continued to heckle her from the audience as she began to address the rumor that she and Brady had briefly dated.\n\n\"I do know it would never work out,\" Kardashian said. \"An ex-athlete, high cheekbones, silky hair -- you remind me too much of my stepdad now.\" A meme was then put onscreen that had four photos of Brady through the years and then two photos of Caitlyn Jenner. \"The Evolution of Tom Brady\" was written over them in case you really couldn't put it together yourself.\n\nThis got a big laugh from the room and from Brady himself. He actually seemed to be the person who found Kardashian the funniest. Maybe they really did date.\n\nOver two and a half hours into the roast, it was time for Brady to make some jokes. This is the inherent flaw of a celebrity roast. The show's closer is usually the least funny person on the stage. Brady did well enough, but he is not beating the robot allegations anytime soon. He joked about Taylor Swift and the Chiefs. (\"Kansas City, you say your stadium is the loudest? It helps when your fans are 14-year-old girls.\") He took a shot at Kanye West. (\"I know Kim was terrified to be here tonight -- not because of this but because her kids are at home with their dad.\") He even made a joke about B\u00fcndchen, though it was fairly meek in comparison to everyone else's:\n\n\"There's been a lot of jokes tonight, but the truth is I miss the love of my life: football,\" he said. Not the best, not the worst -- a fitting cap for the entire evening.", "source": {"uri": "thecut.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "The Cut"}, "authors": [{"uri": "olivia_craighead@thecut.com", {"uri": "8113993334", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "14:48:27", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T14:48:27Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T14:48:10Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6352941393852234, "url": "https://www.theblaze.com/news/tom-brady-tells-jeff-ross-to-never-say-that-s-again-after-a-joke-about-the-owner-of-the-new-england-patriots", "title": "Tom Brady tells Jeff Ross to 'never say that s*** again' after a joke about the owner of the New England Patriots | Blaze Media", "body": "Future NFL Hall of Famer Tom Brady agreed to be the punchline on Netflix's \"The Greatest Roast of All Time,\" but it appears there was one joke that Brady could not let slide.\n\nAfter Jeff Ross -- otherwise known as the \"Roastmaster General\" -- appeared on stage to roast the former quarterback, there was one joke he said that seemed to rub Brady the wrong way.\n\nRoss' joke centered around Brady being selected by the New England Patriots in the sixth round of the NFL draft, ultimately being the 199th overall pick.\n\nRoss joked: \"So Tom became a Patriot and moved up to New England, and on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said, 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made. Would you like a massage?'\"\n\nWhile the audience reacted to the joke, the camera suddenly cut to Brady, who moved around in his seat, seemingly uncomfortable. Meanwhile, Ross turned to Kraft, who was stationed in the audience, and blew him kisses.\n\nRoss mentioned how he loved Kraft before Brady can be seen approaching Ross and whispering in his ear: \"Never say that s*** again.\"\n\nRoss heeded Brady's request and pointed out that Kraft was \"having fun\" during the roast.\n\nThe joke carried weight because, in 2019, Kraft and others were charged with solicitation as part of an anti-sex trafficking investigation into a number of Florida massage parlors, according to Deadline Hollywood.\n\nProsecutors ultimately dropped a misdemeanor charge against the Patriots owner after courts would not allow the use of video footage from secret cameras installed by police inside the parlors to be used.\n\n\"Although there was probable cause to make an arrest, the evidence cannot prove all legally required elements of the crime alleged and is insufficient to support a criminal prosecution,\" according to a court filing by the office of Palm Beach State Attorney Dave Aronberg, per NBC News.\n\nThe special was hosted by comedian Kevin Hart. Other jokes featured in the show had to do with Spygate and deflated footballs.\n\nOther roasters who were in attendance at the event were Bert Kreischer, Tom Segura, Nikki Glaser, Andrew Schulz, Tony Hinchcliffe, and Sam Jay.\n\nFormer wide receivers Randy Moss and Julian Edelman, quarterback Drew Bledsoe, and tight end Rob Gronkowski were also there to roast their friend.", "source": {"uri": {"uri": "2024-05-346528287", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "13:19:21", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T13:19:21Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T12:40:08Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6352941393852234, "url": "https://www.eastoregonian.com/sports/si/mics-caught-tom-bradys-nsfw-response-to-jeff-rosss-joke-about-robert-kraft/article_dcc66843-f558-5b59-a255-8f7a86eba414.html", "title": "Mics Caught Tom Brady's NSFW Response to Jeff Ross's Joke About Robert Kraft", "body": "Tom Brady was a good sport during Sunday night's roast of the seven-time Super Bowl champion on Netflix, as the retired NFL quarterback laughed at many of the barbs thrown his way by comedians, ex-teammates and former opponents -- and even told some good zingers himself.\n\nBut Brady was not a fan of every joke.\n\nWhen comedian Jeff Ross told a joke about the 2019 massage parlor scandal involving New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft, Brady was not pleased, and the three-time MVP proceeded to walk up to Ross to let him know not to say anything about the incident.\n\nNetflix mics caught Brady's NSFW message to Ross.\n\nRoss, imitating Brady in a conversation the longtime Patriots QB had with Kraft after the 2000 NFL draft, said, \" 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made.' \"\n\nRoss, then playing Kraft, responded.\n\n\" 'Would you like a massage?' \"\n\nAfter Ross was finished with the joke, Brady could be seen speaking into the comedian's ear.\n\n\"Don't say that s**t again,\" Brady said.\n\nKraft, owner of the Patriots since January of 1994, became embroiled in controversy when he was hit with two charges of soliciting another to commit prostitution after police surveillance videos of the NFL owner at a massage parlor in Jupiter, Fl surfaced. Edelman, Rob Gronkowski and Randy Moss, comedians like Kevin Hart and Jeff Ross, and even Brady's former coach Bill Belichick taking their shots at Brady.\n\nAnd it didn't take long for the fireworks to start.\n\nComedian Jeff Ross was taking his turn at roasting the GOAT when he joked about Brady first being drafted by the New England Patriots:\n\n\"On the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into Robert Kraft's office and said, 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made.\n\nWould you like a massage?\"\n\nThe joke was obviously a jab at Patriots owner
