And no less than Jeff Ross helped to get things going by showing up in an O.J. Simpson jersey.\n\n\"The juice is loose tonight,\" Ross yelled to the crowd, before removing two gloves. \"If the gloves don't fit, you must talk s -- t.\"\n\nHe wasn't finished.\n\n\"What's up, patriots,\" he asked, clearly a play on Brady's former team. \"I just came from hell. Aaron Hernandez says hello.\"\n\nThe back of Ross' jersey read \"Roast J Simpson\" and along with Simpson's No. 32, sported what looked to be fake blood stains. So yeah, he went all out for this skit.\n\nBut Brady knew what was coming, and even indicated as much in his opening monologue.\n\n\"It's like a football game. You run with a game plan, and then you get to see kind of how the strategy goes, and then you adjust on the fly,\" Brady said. \"This is what a locker room has been like for me for all these years. So it's not like I'm used to people not making fun of me.\"\n\nThen again, not all the jokes were funny to Brady, it seems.\n\nAs the Guardian reports:\n\n\"The only time Brady objected to a joke was when Jeff Ross made a reference to Patriots owner Robert Kraft and massages. In 2019, Kraft originally received a misdemeanor charge that he paid for sex at a Florida massage parlor. Prosecutors later dropped the charge after courts blocked the use of video from cameras installed by police inside the massage parlors.\n\n\"In the sketch, Ross joked about Kraft offering Brady a massage when he first joined the Patriots. On Sunday, Brady walked up to Ross and said in his ear 'don't say that s -- t again,' but it was clearly caught on the microphone and heard by those watching the roast at home.\"\n\nSo, massage jokes? Off-limits. But O.J. Simpson attire? {"uri": "8112970357", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "01:11:22", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T01:11:22Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T01:10:54Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5921568870544434, "url": "https://variety.com/2024/tv/news/jeff-ross-tom-brady-netflix-roast-robert-kraft-joke-1235992609/", "title": "Tom Brady Tells Jeff Ross 'Don't Say That S -- - Again' After Massage Joke About Patriots Owner Robert Kraft at Netflix Roast", "body": "On Sunday, the Kia Forum and millions of viewers at home experienced great discomfort while watching Netflix's live special of \"The Roast of Tom Brady\" when comedian Jeff Ross joked about Robert Kraft, owner of the New England Patriots, and Tom Brady, asking if Brady wanted a massage.\n\nHosted by Kevin Hart, the event saw Jeff Ross, introduced as the roastmaster, entering the arena wearing a seemingly bloody No. 32 football jersey with the words \"Roast J Simpson\" on the back. \"If the gloves don't fit, you must talk shit,\" Ross quipped.\n\nFive minutes into his set, Ross delved into Brady's career after being the 199th pick in the NFL draft. \"He sat there for days, waiting and waiting, and then you were finally picked in the sixth round when Bill Belichick's dog stepped on the keyboard by accident,\" Ross joked.\n\nRoss then recounted a moment when Brady, as a scrawny rookie, told owner Robert Kraft, \"I'm the best decision your organization has ever made,\" upon joining the Patriots. The audience erupted into applause before Ross delivered the punchline, \"Would you like a massage?\"\n\nThe reference was to Kraft's previous controversy involving accusations of soliciting prostitution in a Florida massage parlor, though he was never charged in the case.\n\nBrady, seated front-and-center on stage, appeared visibly uncomfortable, shifting in his seat and turning towards Ross after the massage joke. While Ross blew a kiss to Kraft in attendance, he was then approached by Brady at the podium, who whispered into Ross' hot microphone, \"Don't say that shit again.\"\n\n\"Okay, okay,\" Ross responded nervously. \"He's having fun, look at him. I love what you do for the Jews, Robert Kraft. You're incredible.\"\n\nThe camera then captured Kraft laughing in the audience.\n\nAfter completing his set, Ross and Brady hugged on stage, exchanging words with smiles on their faces.\n\nAs Hart returned to the microphone, he teased Ross, \"Wow, wow. Stop being a bitch, Jeff, and sit down. Stop kissing his ass. 'Are you okay? It was just jokes?'\"\n\nHart then transitioned to the next roaster, saying, \"Make sure to check out Jeff's one-man show. It's playing at the Hollywood Cemetery. His career is literally dying. If we stop doing these roasts, you will not see Jeff Ross ever again.\"\n\nAs part of Netflix Is a Joke Fest, \"Greatest Roasts of All Time: Tom Brady\" featured the former quarterback, who played 20 The roasters included comedians Kevin Hart, Nikki Glaser, Tony Hinchcliffe, Sam Jay, Bert Kreischer, Jeff Ross, Tom Segura and Andrew Schulz.\n\nThey were joined by past NFL superstars Drew Bledsoe, Julian Edelman, Rob Gronkowski and Randy Moss. The six-time Super Bowl-winning coach began the night by taking a couple of strays but ended it by dishing out a fair share to his former players.\n\nBelichick roasted former tight end Rob Gronkowski, giving him some job advice in the process. The legendary coach said:\n\n\"A lot of people connected me with a saying called, 'Do your job,' and telling people to do their job. Gronk, I've been watching you on 'Fox NFL Sunday,' and I'm begging you, please, stop doing your job.\n\n\"I loved coaching Gronk. A great teammate, great, great player. A Hall of Fame player. ... Tide Pods.\"\n\nNext up for Belichick was Hall of Fame pass-catcher Randy Moss.\n\n\"A lot of you don't know, but I really have a big heart,\" Belichick said. \"I rescued a dog from the shelter, and I rescued Randy from the Raiders. Listen, Randy, I'm really sorry you didn't get a ring. Not enough to give you one of mine, but I'm really sorry.\"\n\nOf course, Belichick had to go in on the man of the hour, Tom Brady. But when such a situation presents itself, what else can you do but let loose?\n\nAll told, Sunday's showcase was an entertaining affair. It was yesterday,\" Bledsoe told Brady as the venue erupted with laughter.\n\nBledsoe married wife Maura in 1996, three years after the Patriots selected him first overall in the 1993 NFL Draft.\n\nBrady, 46, and B\u00fcndchen, 43, tied the knot in 2009 and later became parents to son Benjamin, 14, and daughter Vivian, 11.\n\nThe now-former couple announced in October 2022 they had finalized their divorce after 13 years of marriage.\n\nB\u00fcndchen has since moved on with her jiu-jitsu instructor, Joaquim Valente, another topic Brady was mercilessly subjected to during the roast.\n\nBefore the jokes started flying on the main stage, former Patriots coach Bill Belichick opened the festivities by mimicking his fateful decision decades ago to move forward with Brady over Bledsoe.\n\n\"It's great seeing you again. This is a big night. The fans want you, everyone wants you. But it's not your night. Sorry, Drew,\" Belichick said to Bledsoe backstage before telling Brady, \"You're in, let's go.\"\n\nWarning: Explicit language\n\nBledsoe bluntly replied: \"Are you f-king kidding me? Again?\"\n\nThe now-52-year-old Bledsoe was infamously knocked out of a Sept. 23, 2001 game against the Jets by linebacker Mo Lewis, paving the way for Brady, a sixth-round pick (No. 199 overall) out of Michigan in 2000, to take over.\n\nBledsoe was eventually traded to the Bills in 2002 and finished his career with the Cowboys in 2006. {"uri": "8114228332", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "17:42:32", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T17:42:32Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T17:42:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5803921818733215, "url": "https://nesn.com/2024/05/patriots-closure-bill-belichick-robert-kraft-shot-tom-brady-roast/", "title": "Patriots Closure? Bill Belichick, Robert Kraft Rip Shot At Tom Brady Roast", "body": "Patriots fans probably felt some kind of way Sunday night watching \"The Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady\" on Netflix.\n\nIt's been four years since Brady left New England in free agency, kicking off a three-year stint with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers. And it's been roughly four months since the Patriots parted ways with Bill Belichick, the head coach for New England's dynastic run that included six Super Bowl titles.\n\nYet, it took a live, unfiltered roast hosted in Los Angeles by Kevin Hart to finally bring some semblance of closure to a franchise that spent more than two decades as the NFL's lightning rod.\n\nSome jokes were uncomfortable. And that was the point. Whether it was Brady's divorce from Gisele B\u00fcndchen (and her reported relationship with jiu-jitsu instructor Joaquim Valente) or Aaron Hernandez's murder conviction and subsequent prison suicide, nothing was off-limits as former teammates, celebrities and comedians tore into the greatest quarterback of all time -- for the whole world to see.\n\nOne moment that undoubtedly struck a chord with Pats fans, though, came when Hart brought Belichick and Kraft together on-stage for a shot.\n\nSure, it was awkward. And yes, Kraft already sung Belichick's praises during a January press conference to announce the longtime coach's departure. But this -- an impromptu toast, under the bright lights, amid a chaotic and unprecedented live event with wall-to-wall star power -- felt different.\n\nMaybe now, regardless of whatever feelings truly exist between Belichick and Kraft (and Belichick and Brady, for that matter), everyone finally can turn the page in Foxboro, Mass.\n\nThe Patriots had a monumental offseason, between hiring Jerod Mayo as their next coach and selecting quarterback Drake Maye with their highest draft pick since Kraft became owner. A new era already was in full swing.\n\nStill, there was something cathartic about watching Belichick, Kraft and Brady, among others, take off the gloves Sunday night. {"uri": "2024-05-346136960", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "07:36:49", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T07:36:49Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T05:20:32Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5803921818733215, "url": "https://eu.usatoday.com/story/sports/nfl/2024/05/06/tom-brady-roast-netflix-patriots-belichick-gronk/73582349007/", "title": "Tom Brady roast on Netflix: 12 best burns* of NFL legend, Bill Belichick and Patriots", "body": "\"The Greatest Roast of All Time: The Roast of Tom Brady,\" part of the annual \"Netflix is a Joke Festival,\" took place Sunday night at the Kia Forum in Inglewood, California, and aired live on the streaming platform.\n\nBrady, the seven-time Super Bowl champion quarterback, was the key figure getting roasted. However, his former head coach Bill Belichick and New England Patriots teammates also took their licks during the program.\n\nDrew Bledsoe, Randy Moss, Rob Gronkowski, Julian Edelman, Rodney Harrison, Willie McGinest, Matt Light and Nate Solder were among Brady's former Patriots teammates in attendance. Patriots owner Robert Kraft and the team's former head coach, Bill Belichick, also were present and took to the microphone to deliver messages to the to-be first-ballot Hall of Fame quarterback.\n\nWhile TB12 took the brunt of the roasting, Bledsoe, Gronkowski, Edelman and Belichick also were on the receiving end of plenty of razzing.\n\nHere are the 12 best burns* (* that are safe to print in a family publication such as USA TODAY) from Sunday night's \"GROAT\" on Netflix:\n\nJulian Edelman, Patriots WR (2009-2020)\n\n\"Leonardo DiCaprio's ex-girlfriend's ex-husband.\" -- In one of a number of jokes referring to Brady's ex-wife, fashion model Gisele B\u00fcndchen.\n\n\"Alex (Guerrero) is the snake oil salesman who turned Tom into a big (expletive) weirdo.\" -- On Brady's \"body coach\" and business partner, who was in attendance for the roast.\n\nRob Gronkowski, Patriots TE (2010-2018), Buccaneers TE (2020-2021)\n\n\"Let's talk about my designated driver, Tom Brady. We played together for 11 years and I barely know this guy.\"\n\nDrew Bledsoe, Patriots QB (1993-2001)\n\n\"Can you please stay (expletive) retired? We're sick of this (expletive).\" -- Speaking for most NFL fans.\n\nNikki Glaser, comedian\n\n\"Drew, I'm going to move on from you just like your team did after you almost died.\"\n\nRandy Moss, Patriots WR (2007-10)\n\n\"I'll tell you what you deflated: my legacy. I want my ring ... Drew Bledsoe was in the freakin' hospital, and he has a Super Bowl ring. Nate Ebner - who the (expletive) is Nate Ebner? - he has three Super Bowl rings.\" -- On not being part of Brady's six title teams in New England.\n\nBill Belichick, Patriots head coach (2000-2023)\n\n\"I rescued a dog from a shelter and rescued Randy (Moss) from the Raiders. Sorry you didn't get a ring. Not sorry enough to give you one of mine.\" -- Referring to the 2007 trade that sent Moss from AFC West doormat Oakland to title-contending New England.\n\n\"Ron Burgundy ... the only member of the media I respect.\"\n\n\"Not so easy running a team, is it Tom? Stick to American football.\" -- Referring to the English soccer team Birmingham City, which was relegated to a lower league in Brady's first year as part-owner.\n\nWill Ferrell, actor\n\n\"I never liked you, Tom. In all my years of watching football, I never saw a more boring quarterback; the master of the 6-yard slant. Randy (Moss), he was never going to get you that ring. ... Tom is the master of the check down. You were just a sexy decoy.\" -- In character as Ron Burgundy, who also called Brady \"a dead robot of a quarterback.\"\n\nPeyton Manning, Colts QB (1998-2010), Broncos QB (2012-2015)\n\n\"My (golf) handicap is a 6.4. Tom's handicap is blowing leads to my brother Eli in the Super Bowl.\" -- Also referred to Brady as a \"three-time Super Bowl loser.\" Brady did get in a the last word, however, saying, \"Peyton, sometimes you live in Denver, sometimes you live in Louisiana, but you'll always live in my shadow.\"\n\nRobert Kraft, Patriots owner\n\n\"Vladimir Putin, if you're watching, give me my (expletive) ring back.\" -- Kraft has long said that the Russian president stole his Super Bowl XXXIX ring.", "source": {"uri": "usatoday.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "USA Today"}, "authors": [], {"uri": "8113149307", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "04:54:05", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T04:54:05Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T04:53:26Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5764706134796143, "url": "https://thecomeback.com/nfl/robert-kraft-bill-belichick-greatest-coach-history-football.html", "title": "Robert Kraft's reunion with Bill Belichick featured bold praise", "body": "\"Having Tom Brady and him was the greatest honor that the good lord gave me.\"\n\nMost football fans likely assumed that New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft and former Patriots head coach Bill Belichick wouldn't be hanging around each other anytime soon after Kraft relieved him of his duties this offseason. But the two shared the stage together on Sunday during the Netflix comedy special The Roast of Tom Brady, where Kraft had some very complimentary words for Belichick.\n\nWith the thanks of roast host Kevin Hart, Belichick and Kraft were brought to the stage together to share a shot. But before they had their celebratory drinks, Kraft called Belichick the \"greatest coach in the history of the game\".\n\n\"I want to say, this is the greatest coach in the history of the game,\" said Kraft. \"That did what no one else has done. Having Tom Brady and him was the greatest honor that the good lord gave me.\"\n\nIt's a hard statement to argue from Kraft considering all Belichick was able to accomplish for Kraft in New England. Belichick's six Super Bowl championships of course mark the most of any coach in NFL history.\n\nYou can obviously argue whether Belichick or Brady had the most impact on those championship-winning teams. But the general consensus is that neither likely would have experienced as much success as they did without the other.\n\nStill, it is interesting to see these two sharing this kind of moment only months after Kraft let Belichick go. But now that I am retired, my favorite Ring is the camera that caught Coach Belichick slinking out of that poor girl's house a few months ago. Hey, you still go it. Respect baby,\" Brady said while pointing in his former coach's direction.\n\nBelichick flashed an uncomfortable-looking grin but wasn't exactly in hysterics as Julian Edelman put his arm around him.\n\n\"I've been out of the game for a minute, so I am curious how many Super Bowls have you won since I left,\" Brady said about Belichick. \"Maybe it's not just the guy on the sidelines. When I go to the Indy 500, I don't ask the winning driver who gassed up your car.\"\n\nNothing was out of bounds during the Netflix special -- aside from Robert Kraft massage jokes -- as Brady was mercilessly dragged over his Gisele Bundchen divorce for three hours.\n\nBelichick used his opportunity to take a dig at Brady's relationship with trainer Alex Guerrero.\n\nGuerrero's close relationship with Brady was reportedly a point of contention for Belichick during the Patriots' dynasty.\n\n\"People said me and Tom butted heads a lot. In a way that was true, but not really it was hard to butt heads with Tommy because it was so far up Alex Guerrero's ass,\" Belichick said in one of the funnier digs of the night.\n\nIt has been speculated that it was Belichick in the Ring video -- it was a topic on \"The Pat McAfee Show\" -- but never confirmed.\n\nPage Six reported in September that Belichick and longtime girlfriend, Linda Holliday, broke up after \"a drawn-out, back-and-forth breakup for nearly a year.\"\n\nBelichick was spotted with a mystery brunette at Contessa Italian restaurant in Boston in March on what a tipster told the social media gossip account Deuxmoi \"was definitely a date.\"\n\nBrady and Belichick won six Super Bowls together in New England before Brady left for the Buccaneers in free agency in 2020.\n\nThere have been reports since that it was Belichick who believed the Patriots would be better off moving from Brady, who promptly led the Buccaneers to a Super Bowl the following season.\n\nBelichick and the Patriots parted ways in January after a disastrous 4-13 season.\n\nHis inability to land another NFL head coaching job this offseason was used against him during the {"uri": "8113569199", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "10:08:49", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T10:08:49Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T10:08:25Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5764706134796143, "url": "https://www.dailymail.co.uk/galleries/article-13386681/NFL-legend-Tom-Brady-Netflix-Roasts-outrageous-moments.html", "title": "NFL legend Tom Brady Netflix Roast's most outrageous moments", "body": "By Sonia Horon For Dailymail.Com and Adam Levy For Dailymail.com\n\nTom Brady had to be a good sport on Sunday as he got brutally mocked by a number of his friends and comedians during a Netflix roast. Many jokes during the star-studded show, titled The Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady, poked fun of the former NFL star's, 46, divorce from model Gisele Bundchen , 43, and her moving on with Brazilian jiu-jitsu instructor Joaquim Valente, 35.\n\nNikki Glaser, 39, was one of the comedians who roasted the athlete about his split during the special. The Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady, which was part of the Netflix Is a Joke Fest, was streamed live, which Netflix touted as the first-ever roast to be telecast live, unedited. The festivities were held at L.A.'s Kia Forum in Inglewood. 'How much would it suck for Tom... omg, just knowing your ex-wife's new boyfriend could beat your [expletive] while eating hers,' she told the crowd. 'Tom, the only thing dumber than you saying \"yes\" to this roast was when you said, \"Hey babe, you should try jiu-jitsu,\"' she went on.\n\nIn another pointed jab Nikki added, 'You have seven rings... well, eight now that Gisele gave hers back.' However, Tom was a good sport about it all, and chuckled as Nikki continued to make fun of him. Tom and Gisele -- who share two kids together, son Benjamin, 13, and daughter Vivian, 10 -- finalized their divorce on October 28, 2022, after 13 years of marriage. Gisele started training jiu-jitsu in 2021, which is when it's believed she met Joaquim, her instructor. News of them dating was confirmed publicly in February of 2024. Among those who roasted the retired quarterback on Sunday were host Kevin Hart, Julian Edelman, Rob Gronkowski, Drew Bledsoe, Randy Moss and Kim Kardashian.\n\nLater on in the evening, Tom had a chance to hit back at the unrelenting jokes as he fired back at Kim with a low blow regarding her ex-husband Kanye West. Brady, 46, referenced West, 46, when delivering his response at the Kia Forum in Los Angeles to the many celebs who roasted him at the event Sunday, with Kim, 43, being one of them. 'I know Kim was terrified to be here tonight...not because of this but because her kids are at home with their dad,' the NFL legend said, leaving the crowd roaring. The reality star - who shares daughters North, 10, and Chicago, six, and sons Saint, eight, and Psalm, four, with West - shook her head at the comment and held a restrained smile as she looked at the former New England Patriots quarterback, who she was romantically linked to about a year ago.\n\nA number of social media users predicted that West wouldn't have a sense of humor in regards to Brady's joke, and that it was only a matter of time before the outspoken artist responded to the pointed punchline aimed at his parenting. The seven-time Super Bowl winner did not stop there as he also ripped the Chiefs over Taylor Swift and her fans amid Travis Kelce romance during his rebuttal. Tom Brady ripped the Kansas City Chiefs over the team's new fanbase of Taylor Swift fans on Sunday night. The NFL icon suffered a fair roasting of his own at the hands of Kevin Hart, former teammates Julian Edelman and Rob Gronkowsk, Bill Belichick and even Kim Kardashian during his Netflix live roast. However, after the onslaught of jokes about ex-wife Gisele and Spygate, the former quarterback had the chance of his own at a few quips.\n\nAnd the seven-time Super Bowl winner seized the opportunity to take aim at the reigning champions, the Chiefs. The 46-year-old blasted Patrick Mahomes and co. about their newfound fanbase, suggesting Arrowhead Stadium is mainly filled with Swifties - the fans of Travis Kelce 's girlfriend, Taylor Swift. 'Kansas City, you say your stadium is the loudest. It helps when your fans are 14 year old girls...,' he said, referencing the Swifties increased interest in the franchise amid their idol's romance with the star tight end. 'And in honor of TayTay, let's take a look at the Chiefs Eras; Terrible for 50 years, good for five. SHAKE IT OFF,' Brady added, with nods to Swift's Eras Tour and hit song. The Chiefs won their third Super Bowl in five years in February with many fans claiming it put Mahomes and co. on track for the claim to a dynasty like the New England Patriots of Brady's era. And Kansas City's latest victory came in front of Swift as the popstar cheered on her tight end boyfriend from a VIP suite in Allegiant Stadium as the Chiefs took down the San Francisco 49ers in overtime.\n\nElsewhere during the live show, Hart also chose to go for Brady's divorce. He first mocked him for choosing to 'unretire' and play a final, unsuccessful season with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers. 'Gisele gave you an ultimatum. She said you have to retire or you're done. But when you have a chance to go 8-9 you gotta do it.' Like Nikki, he also brought up Bundchen's new boyfriend. 'You know who also [expletive] their coach? Gisele, she [expletive] her karate coach. Tom, how did you not see this coming? Eight karate classes a day?' Brady appeared uncomfortable as he raised his glass to the crowd in response. Brady's other former teammate Bledsoe also mentioned his marriage, while discussing how rarely the athlete would get sacked on the field, as he joked that he's 'pretty used to not being touched. Just like at the end of the marriage.'\n\nBledsoe also joked that he got to experience two things Brady never will: going number one in the NFL Draft and celebrating a 28th wedding anniversary. At one point in the show Edelman made a grim joke about his late former teammate Aaron Hernandez, who killed himself in prison by hanging, in 2017. 'Everyone always asks me how big Gronk's [expletive] is. Now don't get me wrong, it gets the job done. But there was this other Patriots tight end. Now he was hung,' he said, making a pun at Hernandez's death. Hernandez had committed [expletive] in his jail cell at the age of 27, as he was serving life in prison without parole for the shooting death of semi-professional football player Odin Lloyd in 2013.\n\nHowever, there was one joke that appeared to get under Brady's skin. It happened when legendary comedian Jeff Ross took his turn to roast the athlete. Ross talked about Brady joining the Patriots after being drafted 199th overall in 2000. 'Tom became a Patriot, moved up to New England, and on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft 's office and said \"I'm the best decision your organization has ever made,\"' Ross said, adding, 'Would you like a massage?' Ross then blew a kiss to Kraft, who was in attendance. At that point Brady got out of his seat, walked up to Ross and said in his ear but loud enough for the microphone to pick up, 'Don't say that [expletive] again.' Kraft was charged with soliciting prostitution in February 2019 in Florida, with police saying they recorded Kraft paying for sexual acts at the Orchids of Asia spa in January 2019. He pleaded not guilty, and later a federal judge ruled that the recordings were filmed using unlawful surveillance. The case was dismissed in September 2019.\n\nMeanwhile Kim Kardashian was booed by the crowd in her hometown of Los Angeles when she took the podium at the roast. The reality star, 43, appeared caught off-guard by the chilly reception at the event. She was immediately jeered as she made her way onstage, pausing for a moment after thanking host Kevin. She appeared to be launching into a joke, telling Hart, 'I know a lot of people make fun of your height,' before appearing to do a double take at the outburst from her less than-adoring public. Kardashian, who sported blonde locks as she held a Champagne glass at the event in Southern California, sought to get the show back on track, saying, 'Alright, alright, alright, Kevin,' who himself appeared to jump in to do damage control as he said, 'Whoa, whoa.' A number of people on Sunday took to social media with real-time reactions to the chilly reception Kardashian received at the comedy event. 'Kim Kardashian getting booed at the Tom Brady Roast is incredible,' one user wrote, while another said, THEY JUST BOOED KIM KARDASHIAN BEFORE SHE EVEN SAID A WORD LMFAO.' Said one user: 'Bill Belichick gets a standing ovation and Kim Kardashian gets booed. The Tom Brady roast is the best thing Netflix has ever produced.'\n\nIn her set, Kardashian alluded to past rumors of a romance with Brady after they crossed paths last summer at a July 4 party in the Hamptons. 'I'm really here tonight for Tom,' said Kardashian, who past dated NFL players including Reggie Bush and Miles Austin. 'I wasn't going to come tonight, but since I'm not here as Tom's date, there's still a good chance I might.' Kardashian's set also included a reference to Caitlyn Jenner , who was formerly married to her mother Kris Jenner . 'I do know it would've never worked out,' Kardashian said. 'An ex-athlete, high cheekbones, silky hair ... you remind me too much of my stepdad now.' She added: 'Part of me thinks you would want to entrust me just to try on my clothes. I know the transition from the NFL must've been really hard, but I think my stepdad is a great example for you. 'She's one of the best athletes in the world, who proved you could do anything in this next chapter in your life. You can become a commentator, a far-right Republican or even a strong, confident woman.'\n\nKardashian made a reference to her late father Robert Kardashian's work on the late O.J. Simpson's 'Dream Team' of attorneys, to wrap up her set. 'Honestly, it's hard for me to watch people roast you,' Kim said. 'But I think enough of my family members have helped defend former football players.' She concluded in saying, 'So I'm just here tonight to support you and celebrate you - I'll give you the same advice I give all of my exes, good luck knowing the best is behind you.' Brady was also roasted for his failed crypto commercials as well as his losses to the New York Giants. The Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady can be seen on Netflix.\n\nWant more stories like this from the Daily Mail? He made an outrageous amount of money and is set to make even more over the course of a monstrous deal with Fox to be their new lead broadcaster -- if he doesn't try to make another NFL comeback this fall.\n\nAll of this is to say, Brady should not be in a position where he's desperate to say yes to things like a celebrity roast. Brady stood up from his seat, walked over, and very much not jokingly said \"don't say that shit again\" to Ross.\n\nKraft, of course, was charged with solicitation in 2019 after a sting at a Florida massage parlor, but pled not guilty. As per ESPN reports, Guerrero had a presence within the Patriots building despite not being employed by the franchise. He worked closely with Brady, and Brady even got his other teammates to work with Guerrero allegedly.\n\nHowever, Belichick sought to minimize Guerrero's presence in 2017 as he deemed him a problematic presence, which apparently became a contributing factor to his fraying relationship with Brady. Belichick seems to have taken this head-on in the roast of his former pupil, delivering not only a great joke but also insight for all the fans looking for an explanation. Or maybe he's just toying with us, playing into fans's narratives. And he continued several times in the show telling the others, \"please explain that joke to Gronk.\"\n\nKevin Hart as host said, \"We wanted to roast you in Florida but because of your governor we wouldn't be able to call you gay.\"\n\nMost of the jokes were about Brady's time with the New England Patriots and his marriage to super model Gisele B\u00fcndche, with teammate Julian Edelman calling him \"Leonardo DiCaprio's ex-girlfriend's ex-husband.\" And comedian Andrew Schulz told him, \"No matter how big you get, you end up as a twice-divorced supplement salesman in Tampa, Florida.\"\n\nKim Kardashian took the stage to squash rumors she is dating Brady. \"An ex-athlete, high cheekbones, silky hair, you remind me too much of my stepdad now,\" Kardashian continued, referencing her mom Kris Jenner's former spouse, Caitlyn Jenner, previously known as Bruce Jenner. \"Part of me thinks you would want to undress me, just to try on my clothes.\"\n\nThis roast, held during the Netflix is a Joke comedy festival in California, was the first time in history that a roast has aired live and unedited on television or streaming, according to Netflix. Clocking in at just over three hours, the roast was filled with jokes about Brady, his divorce, his ex-wife's new romance, his vanity, his awful business decisions and his complex relationship with former coach Bill Belichick.\n\nSome of the top burns:\n\n\"Tom, I wanted you to be our first G.O.A.T. to be roasted, because you're an example to future generations. If you work hard, eat right, film the other team's practices, deflate the balls and have the NFL make new rules just for you, you too can be the third-most famous guy in a Dunkin Donuts commercial.\" -- Jeff Ross\n\n\"Tom Brady. Five-time Super Bowl MVP, most career wins, most career touchdowns. You have seven rings -- well, eight, now that Gisele gave hers back. The only thing dumber than saying yes to this roast was when you said, 'Hey babe, you should try jiu-jitsu.'\" -- Nikki Glaser\n\n\"When we played together, Tom, you used to scream, 'Laser focus! Laser focus!' Now that's what he screams at his plastic surgeon. Who's laughing now Tom? Not you, because your face can't move and you don't have a sense of humor.\" -- Julian Edelman\n\n\"Tom is making a donation to every one of his former teammates' charities that came here tonight. And I gotta tell you, Tom, that is first class. Hey fellas, don't let him pay you in crypto.\" -- Peyton Manning\n\n\"Despite everything we've seen here tonight, Gronk was actually useful on the field. {"uri": "8113697719", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "11:33:21", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T11:33:21Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T11:32:58Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.572549045085907, "url": "https://www.cinemablend.com/streaming-news/netflix-roast-of-tom-brady-most-hilarious-harsh-jokes-gisele-divorce", "title": "Netflix's Roast Of Tom Brady's Most Hilarious And Harsh Highlights, Including Gisele Divorce Jokes, Will Ferrell's Ron Burgundy And More", "body": "Everybody with a Netflix subscription has been granted some exclusive comedy anew thanks to the Netflix Is a Joke fest, with John Mulaney's Everybody's In L.A. going the whole nine yards (or six nights) in giving viewers a totally unique experience. But only one event could exist in just a single iteration: The Roast of Tom Brady, the live and 100% NSFW special aimed at the so-called GOAT of NFL-dom, with plenty of extra targets hit along the way.\n\nAnd wow to the wow, right from the kickoff, host Kevin Hart got right to it, setting the bar lower than low before Roast Master Jeff Ross took everything down to Hell and back again. Unsurprisingly, a whole lot of downright awful jokes were made at not only Tom Brady's expense -- \"Fuck you, Tom!\" came close to catchphrase territory -- but at the expense of everyone whose name came up during the event, which is already destined to be one of Netflix's best stand-up specials, especially with a run-time that pushed three hours.\n\nLet's loosen the gloves and dive into some of the harshest jokes that were made during the night, from gags covering the timeline of Tom and Gisele B\u00fcndchen's relationship to jokes about Rob Gronkowski's intelligence to a comparison between Brady and some of history's most notorious killers.\n\nAs soon as it was announced that Tom Brady would be the subject of a new celebrity Roast, the lineup of subject matter ripe for the pickin' was pretty clear, and his soured relationship with ex-wife Gisele B\u00fcndchen, as well as co-parenting their children, would be on the table. But holy shit, that table was actually a butcher's block the side of a small neighborhood.\n\nNobody pulled any punches when talking about Tom Brady leaving the New England Patriots for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, or his failed cryptocurrency efforts, but none of those barbs were nearly as razor-edged as the CONSTANT barrage of divorce jokes that Brady suffered throughout the night. While the kids themselves were mostly off-limits, the jiu-jitsu instructor B\u00fcndchen was seen with, so to speak, was very much on-limits. Check out some of the zingers below.\n\nNo stone left unturned, as they say, even if \"they\" definitely weren't talking about Tom Brady's relationship woes at the time. There were 100% moments where the Super Bowl GOAT looked ready to crawl under just such a rock, but thankfully kept his game face on and laughed throughout the majority of the vicious punchlines.\n\nKevin Hart proved himself to be quite the energetic Roast host, as he gleefully took on every imaginable kind of joke about his height and his movie choices, and also gave lots of props while also dishing out a multitude of clever jabs. (That got a bit more slurred as the night went on.) And he let audiences know exactly what kind of night we were in for just by him talking about the very building the event was being held in, the Kia Forum, and its history tied to not Tom Brady's sport of choice, but basketball. In Hart's words:\n\nAnd before The Roast of Tom Brady could even hit the 20-minute mark, out came RoastMaster General Jeff Ross, wearing a flaming O.J. Simpson jersey and black gloves, even if he took both off after making this his blistering opening:\n\nThat was followed by Kevin Hart joking about Jeff Ross only being angered by the O.J. Simpson scandal because a waiter was killed. Even Tom Brady had an O.J. joke late in the Roast when he ripped on Peyton Manning with a line about a white Bronco speeding down the 405. I can't say I expected those in particular, but that was just naivety on my part.\n\nIt's always a delightful surprise whenever Will Ferrell brings Anchorman's Ron Burgundy out for a sports-adjacent appearance. The character is where some of Ferrell's most quotable lines came from, and he was certainly on-point after taking the stage at The Roast of Tom Brady, with the gag being that he kept complimenting Brady in spite of his innate hatred. But his big moment wasn't a traditional insult, but rather the fact that he set up a nightmare scenario for the NFL vet and his fans, in which seemingly the entire crowd chanted out:\n\nThe chant refers to the two Super Bowls where Tom Brady and the Patriots lost to Eli Manning and the New York Giants, and the bonkers plays that went into those victories. As a longtime NFL fan, especially one who recalls both of those Super Bowls quite fondly, this was one of the wildest things I've ever seen with my eyeballs and heard with my eyes. Props to everyone who took part.\n\nNothing is ever sacred when it comes to Roasts, and while past TV airings often cut out some of the most malicious comments, the live aspect of Netflix's special made that a no-go. And while I can't say for sure that jokes about NFL superstar-turned-murderer Aaron Hernandez and his in-prison suicide would have been cut from a Comedy Central telecast, for example, the number of them possibly would have been cut back.\n\nBut since we're already, we might as well point out a couple of pitch-black jabs that caused some of the biggest cringes of the night.\n\nI mean, when even the dude's former buddy and quarterback is bringing those jokes to the special, with a healthy dose of tequila involved, then I guess all bets are off. But yeesh while giggling behind my hands all the same.\n\nIt was generally a highlight to see Ben Affleck taking the stage to get all Boston about shit, although I can't say I expected his presence to be an extended rant against social media trolls. That said, it was still kind of fun to watch it play out, as weird and 2014 as it was.\n\nAnd if nothing else, the Oscar winner's presence gave Tom Brady a chance to invoke Kevin Smith by poking fun at Jersey Girl, Phantoms (yo), and Bat-fleck. What's the Venn diagram of Brady fanatics and Snyder-verse fanatics?\n\nIf someone only turned The Roast of Tom Brady on during certain moments of the special, one might easily be swayed into thinking Rob Gronkowski's intelligence was actually the target of everyone's prickly comments. Just about everyone took a swing at that broad side of the barn, and plenty of them were hilarious. (No props for some of the slurs used in those insults, nor during any of the gay jokes in this \"locker room\" though.) A few of the jabs that rose to the top:\n\nNearly as funny as the jokes made at Gronkowski's expense were the number of times the camera would turn to catch his and Kevin Hart's reactions, and the former tight end would look directly down the barrel of the lens. It happened so many times, I couldn't tell if it was him doing a bit, Office-style, or if he was only looking up because his name was said, and just happened to look into the camera 4 out of 5 times.\n\nSeemingly any online debate will eventually arrive at the point where one side compares the other to Adolf Hitler, but longtime envelope-pushers Bert Kreischer and Tom Segura didn't even wait for an argument to ensue. They came to The Roast of Tom Brady with a visual-assisted presentation that, in part, compared the former quarterback to some of history's most notorious serial killers, such as that other good-looking T.B., Ted Bundy.\n\nThe apex was reached when, while standing in front of the image seen above, the two comedians dropped this double-dose of gobsmackers:\n\nUnderstandably, this was one of a couple of points during the night when those on stage made sure to point out that the things being said were only jokes, and that they did not want to be harmed by others.\n\nFor a comedian whose entire career and persona are based in part on insult comedy, the onus was obviously on Tony Hinchcliffe to deliver the goods for his return to Netflix, which hosted his 2016 stand-up special One Shot. The comedian and podcaster absolutely slayed with every energetic pop that he delivered, with winning lines like those below (and others scattered elsewhere):\n\nAnd of all the jokes about Jeff Ross' Jewishness that were voiced throughout the three hours, I was possibly most tickled by Hinchcliffe saying that Ross only watches football for the coin tosses. Not everything he says has to necessarily be vile in some way, although when it does...watch out.\n\nSome wild AF jokes were made about New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft, specifically his alleged past dealings involving massage parlors and other topics, and former Patriots coach Bill Belichick also took on his fair share of shit-talk. But at no point did I think the twain should or would meet, but Kevin Hart made that happen by voicing into existence the former colleagues taking the stage to share a shot of booze.\n\nGranted, Belichick did not look like he was super-pumped to be doing so, and left the stage as soon as humanly possible, but good on him for being cordial about it without throwing his shot glass down like Gronk did.\n\nEven though the special featured all manner of A+ zingers about football, not even the world of professional wrestling went without a reference or two. Or at least one of its most successful superstars, Dwayne \"The Rock\" Johnson, whose history of joking with Kevin Hart and being the actor's BFF came up for a pair of hilariously NSFW jokes, as seen below:\n\nTo be expected, Kevin Hart lost his mind laughing at both of those, with Nikki Glaser taking a moment to extend her showmanship after making that comment, as one should after comparing another to a larger person's sex toy.\n\nHaving heard a near-unending line of hellacious opinions and insults thrown his way for the better part of three hours, Tom Brady was armed and dangerous whenever he finally took the stage again to close out the stellar special. Obviously a lot of his lines were prepared by others, but that's not important, since he was the one tipsily reading all those F-bombs for live audiences both in-arena and streaming from home.\n\nAnd he did indeed get some of the night's big whoppers, which were aimed at Peyton Manning, Kanye West (who went unnamed), Drew Bledsoe and more, as evidenced by the below:\n\nWhile I'm not sure if Tom Brady should ever take the stage for a televised stand-up special all on his own, this Netflix roast proves that he'd be a damned fine entrant in the line-up of roasters for whatever the next special is. The pair were married from 2009 to 2022 and share two children, Benjamin and Vivian.\n\nJust before the roast began, host Kevin Hart spoke with ET from outside of the event and said that he was approaching the roast with a take-no-prisoners attitude and that nothing was off limits, including B\u00fcndchen, the dissolution of their marriage and B\u00fcndchen's new relationship with her jiu-jitsu trainer, Joaquim Valente.\n\n\"I'm being mean today,\" Hart, 44, quipped. \"I'm not nice Kevin today... I'm expecting to lose the relationship with Tom after today. I've already come in with that.\"\n\nThe actor and comedian added, \"Tom knows I love him. He knows all my stuff is coming from a place of fun and good heart, but I do have a job to do. I have a job to do.\"\n\nWhile Brady said in a promo for the event that it was \"no f**king problem\" that the comedians and friends alike would be coming at him hard and fast, the football star looked uncomfortable as the punchlines about his ex-wife added up throughout the night.\n\nThe roast also brought out famous faces and friends close to the former Tampa Bay Buccaneers star, including Kim Kardashian, Patriots CEO Robert Kraft, former coach Bill Belichick and Ben Affleck -- who recently starred in a Dunkin' commercial with Brady -- all of whom steered clear of jokes referencing the Host Kevin Hart said before the event that no topic was off limits, and Hart went on the offensive early with jokes about Brady's ex-wife, Gisele Bundchen.\n\n\"Gisele gave you an ultimatum. She said you retire or we're done. When you got a chance to go 8-9 and all it will cost you is your wife and your kids, you've got to do what you've got to do,\" Hart said, referring to Brady coming out of a brief retirement in 2022 for one more season.\n\nThe only time Brady objected to a joke was when Jeff Ross made a reference to Patriots owner Robert Kraft and massages. {"uri": "8114087750", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "15:54:30", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T15:54:30Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T15:54:14Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5686274766921997, "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/roast-tom-brady-actually-very-154400628.html", "title": "'The Roast of Tom Brady' Was Actually Very, Very Good", "body": "In the late aughts, celebrity comedy roasts dropped as often as Marvel films. It was a rare chance for famous people to publicly acknowledge their most bizarre controversies, announce that they were in on the joke, and awkwardly laugh at themselves in the safety of a room of their peers. Joining a group of Charlie Sheen, Donald Trump, Justin Bieber, Joan Rivers, Alec Baldwin, Bob Saget, and countless more, football legend Tom Brady threw his name into the fire this past weekend for Netflix's The Roast of Tom Brady. Needless to say... it got weird.\n\nFor three hours, the night's roasters -- including Jeff Ross, Nikki Glaser, Kevin Hart, Kim Kardashian, and Will Ferrell (reprising his Anchorman character, Ron Burgundy!) -- roasted the seven-time Super Bowl champion alongside former football pro's Randy Moss, Julian Edelman, Drew Bledsoe, Bill Belichick, and Rob Gronkowski.\n\nThough everything from Deflategate, to his recent divorce from Gisele B\u00fcndchen, to his FTX investment scandal was on the table, one topic appeared off-limits for Brady. When Ross joked about New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft's 2019 arrest for soliciting prostitution at a massage parlor, the football pro told Ross, \"Don't say that shit again.\" Aside from the one tense moment, Brady took more cordial hits regarding his lengthy football career.\n\nComedian Nikki Glaser dished out some of the best lines of the night, including calling Brady: \"The best to ever play for too long.\" She called the night the \"comedians' Super Bowl.\" Addressing their past dating rumors, Kim Kardashian joked, \"I wasn't going to come tonight, but since I'm not here as Tom's date, there's still a good chance I might.\" Randy Moss, a former Patriot alongside Brady, asked the football legend, \"Why the fuck didn't we cheat when I was there?\"\n\nAfter taking what felt like countless blitzes, Brady finally hit back. \"I can take all the hits,\" he told the audience. \"I would have done this earlier but I've been too busy winning championships.\" The former football pro also poked fun at Kansas City's recent Super Bowl win. He made reference to the team's frequent Taylor Swift appearances, joking, \"You say your stadium is the loudest? I am a very big deal but tonight is not about me,\" Ferrell, 56, said. \"We are here to honor a champion of the gridiron, a great American, a father and a sexy man, a true patriot -- until he was not of course.\"\n\nRelated: Ron Burgundy Is Back! Will Ferrell Reprises Iconic 'Anchorman' Character on Every Late Night Show\n\nRelated: Kim Kardashian Addresses Tom Brady Dating 'Rumors' During Netflix Comedy Roast: 'I'd Never Say'\n\nConstantly referencing Brady's good looks, Burgundy gushed about the former New England Patriots quarterback. \"Holy s--- this man is gorgeous,\" he said. \"Look at those cheekbones. That's a million-watt smile right there. ... A person could get lost in those eyes and right now I am that person.\"\n\n\"Ron, pull it together. You're a straight man,\" Burgundy told himself. \"He's making you question your sexuality. Stop looking at him. You're here to make fun of him. Not fall in love. Concentrate!\"\n\nFerrell, as Burgundy, went on to tease Brady over his football career, even making remarks about Brady's ex-wife Gisele B\u00fcndchen (PEOPLE confirmed in October 2022 that the couple were divorcing after 13 years of marriage).\n\n\"I never liked you Tom... in all my years of watching professional football, I never saw a more boring quarterback,\" he said, joking that Brady \"ruined football for all of us\" and that watching the Patriots play \"actually made me look forward to all the fun and laughter of a Bill Belichick postgame interview.\"\n\nRelated: Tom Brady Will Be Roasted in Live Netflix Special Hosted by Kevin Hart: 'No Helmets, No Mercy'\n\nNever miss a story -- sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from juicy celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.\n\nBrady, 46, had a good sense of humor during the special, which was hosted by Kevin Hart. Other stars who made appearances included Julian Edelman, Rob Gronkowski, Nikki Glaser, Drew Bledsoe, Randy Moss and Kim Kardashian.\n\nSpeaking with reporters including PEOPLE before the show, Hart said Brady makes a great subject for a roast.\n\n\"Look, he's America's sweetheart to a certain degree, right?\" said Hart. \"Everybody has seen him through one lens and has had one perception. I think this is a way for him to kind of broaden that landscape and give people a different POV through his words and through others.\"\n\n\"Having the ability to laugh at yourself says a lot about who you are,\" Hart added. \"Not taking yourself too seriously says a lot about who you are. But one joke was maybe just a little too much for Brady.\n\nThe three-hour event was part of this year's Netflix Is a Joke Fest, with some events including the roast streaming live on the platform. It seems like a big deal but remember -- this is the G.R.O.A.T. for the G.O.A.T., a seven-time Super Bowl-winning quarterback who can keep the world in suspense over whether or not he's going to go to work. So these jokes can be really, really mean.\n\nRoss is no stranger to this, and at one point, he brought New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft into the insult parade. Here was Ross's Kraft bit:\n\nSo, Tom became a Patriot and moved up to New England, and on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said, \"I'm the best decision your organization has ever made. Would you like a massage?\"\n\nKraft was accused of soliciting sex from a woman at a Florida massage parlor in 2019. He publicly apologized, and the charges were dropped.\n\nImmediately after the joke, Brady fidgeted in his seat as Ross started blowing kisses to Kraft in the audience. {"uri": "8114366370", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "19:47:34", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T19:47:34Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T19:47:03Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5607843399047852, "url": "https://www.unionleader.com/news/back_page/the-5-best-jokes-from-the-tom-brady-roast-on-netflix/article_1be78614-0bde-11ef-a4d3-ef08bfb271c1.html", "title": "The 5 best jokes from the Tom Brady roast on Netflix", "body": "Former Tampa Bay Buccaneers quarterback Tom Brady, a seven-time Super Bowl winner, was roasted on Netflix on Sunday night in what the streaming company called \"The Greatest Roast of All-Time.\"\n\nDespite ending his career in Tampa Bay, there was little reference to the Buccaneers.\n\nComedian Jeff Ross, known as the \"Roastmaster General,\" kicked things off at the Kia Forum in Inglewood, California, by acknowledging Brady's teammates in the audience such as Rob Gronkowski. \"Forum is how Rob Gronkowski counts to 5.'' And he continued several times in the show, telling the others, \"please explain that joke to Gronk.\"\n\nKevin Hart as host said: \"We wanted to roast you in Florida but because of your governor we wouldn't be able to call you gay.\"\n\nMost of the very filthy jokes were about Brady's time with the New England Patriots and his marriage to super model Gisele B\u00fcndchen, with teammate Julian Edelman calling him \"Leonardo DiCaprio's ex-girlfriend's ex-husband.\" And comedian Andrew Schulz told him, \"No matter how big you get, you end up as a twice-divorced supplement salesman in Tampa, Florida.\"\n\nKim Kardashian took the stage to squash rumors she is dating Brady. \"An ex-athlete, high cheekbones, silky hair, you remind me too much of my stepdad now,\" Kardashian continued, referencing her mom Kris Jenner's former spouse, Caitlyn Jenner.\n\nThis roast, held during the Netflix is a Joke comedy festival, was the first time in history that a roast has aired live and unedited on television or streaming, according to Netflix. Clocking in at just over three hours, the roast was filled with jokes about Brady's divorce, his ex-wife's new romance, his vanity, his awful business decisions and his complex relationship with former coach Bill Belichick.\n\nHere are five of the top burns:\n\n* \"Tom, I wanted you to be our first G.O.A.T. to be roasted, because you're an example to future generations. If you work hard, eat right, film the other team's practices, deflate the balls and have the NFL make new rules just for you, you too can be the third-most famous guy in a Dunkin' Donuts commercial.\" -- Jeff Ross\n\n* \"Tom Brady. Five-time Super Bowl MVP, most career wins, most career touchdowns. You have seven rings -- well, eight, now that Gisele gave hers back. The only thing dumber than saying yes to this roast was when you said, 'Hey babe, you should try jiu-jitsu.'\" -- Nikki Glaser\n\n* \"When we played together, Tom, you used to scream, 'Laser focus! Laser focus!' Now that's what he screams at his plastic surgeon. Who's laughing now Tom? Not you, because your face can't move and you don't have a sense of humor.\" -- Julian Edelman\n\n* \"Tom is making a donation to every one of his former teammates' charities that came here tonight. And I gotta tell you, Tom, that is first class. Hey fellas, don't let him pay you in crypto.\" -- Peyton Manning\n\n* \"Despite everything we've seen here tonight, Gronk was actually useful on the field. Although the bar for Patriots tight ends was pretty low back then: block, catch, don't murder.\" -- Tom Brady", "source": {"uri": "unionleader.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "UnionLeader.com"}, {"uri": "8113116905", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "04:19:28", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T04:19:28Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T04:18:53Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5607843399047852, "url": "https://nesn.com/2024/05/patriots-legend-tom-brady-makes-admission-about-deflategate-at-roast/", "title": "Patriots Legend Tom Brady Makes Admission About Deflategate", "body": "Tom Brady touched on a variety topics when he took to the mic as the guest of honor at his comedic roast Sunday night.\n\nBrady even brought up the Deflategate. And after years of pushing back against the scandal, the legendary quarterback pointed the finger at himself for his role in the deflating-football scheme.\n\nBrady began by asking where NFL commissioner Roger Goodell was -- he was not one of the many guests in attendance at the Kia Forum in Los Angeles for \"The Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady\" -- and that segued into a joke over the league's handling of the situation and an admission about Deflategate.\n\n\"Remember Deflategate? The NFL spent $20 million and found that it was more 'probable' than not, that I was 'generally' aware that someone may have deflated my footballs,\" Brady said, as seen on Netflix. \"You could've just given me the 20 million and I would've just told you I (expletive) did it.\"\n\nWhile Brady was telling a joke, it also felt like a confession from the 46-year-old. The future Hall of Famer has never outright admitted to any wrongdoing when it came to the scandal. Former Patriots cornerback Darrelle Revis even shared in \"The Dynasty\" documentary that Brady told the team the \"allegations are false.\"\n\nBut now Brady has laid credence that he was involved in the deflation of footballs. Brady did get severely punished by the NFL for his role in it all as the league suspended him for the first four games for the 2016 season. The Patriots were also fined $1 million and forfeited two draft picks.\n\nDeflategate will always be a black mark on Brady's illustrious career. But it seems like he's at a point now where he doesn't have to fight it anymore and can have a laugh over it.", "source": {"uri": "nesn.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "NESN"}, "authors": [{"uri": However, his former head coach Bill Belichick and New England Patriots teammates also took their licks during the program.\n\nDrew Bledsoe, Rob Gronkowski, Julian Edelman, Rodney Harrison, Willie McGinest, Matt Light and Nate Solder were among Brady's former Patriots teammates in attendance. Patriots owner Robert Kraft and the team's former head coach, Bill Belichick, also were present and took to the microphone to deliver messages to the to-be first-ballot Hall of Fame quarterback.\n\nWhile TB12 took the brunt of the roasting, Bledsoe, Gronkowski, Edelman and Belichick also were on the receiving end of plenty of razzing.\n\nHere are the 12 best burns* (* that are safe to print in a family publication such as USA TODAY) from Sunday night's \"GROAT\" on Netflix:\n\n\"Leonardo DiCaprio's ex-girlfriend's ex-husband.\" -- In one of a number of jokes referring to Brady's ex-wife, fashion model Gisele B\u00fcndchen.\n\n\"Alex (Guerrero) is the snake oil salesman who turned Tom into a big (expletive) weirdo.\" -- On Brady's \"body coach\" and business partner, who was in attendance for the roast.\n\n\"Let's talk about my designated driver, Tom Brady. We played together for 11 years and I barely know this guy.\"\n\n\"Can you please stay (expletive) retired? We're sick of this (expletive).\" -- Speaking for most NFL fans.\n\n\"Drew, I'm going to move on from you just like your team did after you almost died.\"\n\n\"I'll tell you what you deflated: my legacy. I want my ring ... Drew Bledsoe was in the freakin' hospital, and he has a Super Bowl ring. Nate Ebner - who the (expletive) is Nate Ebner? - he has three Super Bowl rings.\" -- On not being part of Brady's six title teams in New England.\n\n\"I rescued a dog from a shelter and rescued Randy (Moss) from the Raiders. Sorry you didn't get a ring. Not sorry enough to give you one of mine.\" -- Referring to the 2007 trade that sent Moss from AFC West doormat Oakland to title-contending New England.\n\n\"Ron Burgundy ... the only member of the media I respect.\"\n\n\"Not so easy running a team, is it Tom? Stick to American football.\" -- Referring to the English soccer team Birmingham City, which was relegated to a lower league in Brady's first year as part-owner.\n\n\"I never liked you, Tom. In all my years of watching football, I never saw a more boring quarterback; the master of the 6-yard slant. Randy (Moss), he was never going to get you that ring. ... That's when Brady got out of his seat and made his first audible reaction of the night.\n\n\"Don't say that s-t again,\" Brady, who was smiling, told Ross.\n\nKraft was charged with soliciting prostitution in February 2019 after a multi-county investigation into massage parlors in Florida, with police saying they recorded Kraft paying for sex acts at the Orchids of Asia spa in January 2019.\n\nKraft pleaded not guilty, a federal judge in Florida later ruled that the recordings were filmed using unlawful surveillance and must be destroyed.\n\nThe case was dismissed in September 2019.\n\n\"I am truly sorry,\" Kraft said in a March 2019 statement about the case. \"I know I have hurt and disappointed my family, my close friends, my co-workers, our fans and many others who rightfully hold me to a higher standard.\n\n\"Throughout my life, I have always tried to do the right thing. The last thing I would ever want to do is disrespect another human being.\n\n\"...As I move forward, I hope to continue to use the platform with which I have been blessed to help others and to try to make a difference. I expect to be judged not by my words, but by my actions. Brady got some jokes of his own, calling out Bills fans, Kanye West, and the NFL's investigation into \"Deflategate.\"\n\nBrady smiled and took most jokes of the night, but he made it clear that he didn't like one in particular. Comedian Jeff Ross told the story of Brady as a rookie telling Patriots owner Robert Kraft that he was the \"best decision\" his organization had ever made, followed by, \"Would you like a massage?\"\n\nBrady initially smiled, and Ross blew a kiss to Kraft, saying, \"I love Robert Kraft, I love -- \" before he was cut off by the former quarterback.\n\n\"Don't say that s**t again,\" Brady told the comedian.\n\nBrady's sore spot, his most obvious one of the night, came from allegations that Kraft solicited prostitution at a Jupiter, Florida spa in 2019. His charges were dropped the following year.\n\nKraft had been arrested along with at least 25 others as part of a human trafficking investigation. Kraft himself was not charged with human trafficking, but two counts of solicitation, to which he pleaded not guilty.\n\nIt was initially reported that Florida prosecutors had offered Kraft and others a standard pretrial deal for first-time offenders, where if they admitted they would be proven guilty at trial, they could swap time behind bars with community service, education courses, payments, and STD screenings. Kraft released an apology where he apologized for hurting and disappointing his loved ones and emphasized his \"extraordinary respect for women.\"\n\n\"I expect to be judged not by my words, but by my actions. And through those actions, I hope to regain your confidence and respect,\" read Kraft's statement.\n\nIn the end, Jupiter police were found to have been wrong in installing video cameras in the spa's massage rooms, leading prosecutors to drop the cases against the men. I'm expecting to lose the relationship with Tom after today. I've already come in with that.\"\n\nThe Lift actor said that he and Brady have had a \"good run\" but that he is focused on being the best roast master possible.\n\n\"I don't think he has a real idea of, you know, what the world of roasting is, so it's going to get a little ugly but it's in fun!\" he said. \"And I think the world needs this. The world needs to see some, you know, some -- some cross-the-line humor that's done with a tasteful approach where people are having a good time on both sides.\"\n\nIn a trailer for the highly anticipated roast, Hart promoted the event by promising, \"No helmets, no mercy, no Brady rule.\" In the promo, Brady himself responded to the take-no-prisoners approach, saying, \"No f**kin' problem.\"\n\nAs for what kind of jokes he has prepared, Hart said that when he sat down to write them, he considered nothing off limits, including the end of Brady's marriage to Brazilian supermodel Gisele B\u00fcndchen. The couple announced the \"amicable\" end of their 13-year marriage in October 2022. At the time, B\u00fcndchen wrote in a statement, \"The decision to end a marriage is never easy, but we have grown apart.\"\n\nHart told ET that the panel of roasters -- including Jeff Ross and other surprise roasters -- could say or do anything in order to poke fun at Brady and get the laugh.\n\n\"I mean, I can't speak for what other people are doing or what I'm doing, it's a live event,\" Hart continued. \"It's a live event, man, you know? I think in the idea of funny, you have to be able to grab -- you got to -- you got to go and make the uncomfortable comfortable.\"\n\nHe added, \"Tom knows I love him. He knows all my stuff is coming from a place of fun and good heart, but I do have a job to do. You can opt-out at any time.\n\nTom Brady fielded jokes spanning his ex-wife Gisele B\u00fcndchen to his failed crypto venture during his Netflix roast on Sunday.\n\nThe NFL Hall-of-Famer was mostly a good sport -- except for with one joke.\n\nComedian Jeff Ross, dubbed the \"Roastmaster General,\" was one of the first to take to the stage during \"The Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady.\"\n\nReferring to the New England Patriot's owner, he told the audience: \"Tom became a Patriot and moved up to New England, and on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said, 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made. Would you like a massage?'\"\n\nHe then blew a kiss towards Kraft, pointed at him, and said, \"I love Robert Kraft.\"\n\nSeconds later, Brady stood up from his seat, walked up to Ross, and murmured in his ear, \"Don't say that shit again.\"\n\nRoss, who is Jewish, replied, \"OK, OK. He's having fun, look at him. I love what you do for the Jews, Robert Kraft. You're incredible.\"\n\nThe joke referenced a 2019 scandal when Kraft was charged with two counts of soliciting prostitution during a human trafficking and prostitution investigation involving several day spas in Florida.\n\nThe sports executive was accused of engaging in sex acts with one of the spa's employees, along with 24 other men and four women. Kraft pleaded not guilty, and the charges were later dropped due to a lack of evidence.\n\nWith the charges hanging over his head, Kraft, 82, appeared to conduct business as usual: in the summer after he was accused, he attended an institutional dinner alongside President Donald Trump in Qatar, and was later spotted partying with Jon Bon Jovi and Jamie Foxx in the Hamptons.\n\nWhile the charges were eventually dropped against the men involved in the scandal, the women still had to agree to a plea deal and pay hefty fines amounting to thousands of dollars.\n\n\"The Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady\" aired as part of the Netflix Is A Joke, the streamer's 12-day-long live comedy festival taking place in LA.\n\nHosted by Kevin Hart, Brady wasn't only roasted by Jeff Ross, but also Bert Would you like a massage?'\"\n\nBrady then approached Ross, who'd blown a kiss Kraft's way, and said in his ear: \"Don't say that shit again.\" Ross replied, \"OK, OK. He's having fun, look at him. I love what you do for the Jews, Robert Kraft. You're incredible.\"\n\nThe joke was a reference to a 2019 incident in which Kraft was charged with soliciting prostitution after an investigation into massage parlors in Florida. Police said they had recorded Kraft paying for sex acts. He pleaded not guilty, and a federal judge later ordered that the recordings be destroyed after it was found they were filmed unlawfully. The case was dismissed later that year.\n\nThe Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady, which was part of the Netflix Is a Joke Fest, was streamed live, which Netflix touted as the first-ever roast to be telecast live, unedited. The festivities were held at L.A.'s Kia Forum in Inglewood.\n\nAmong the other boldface names in attendance were Ben Affleck, Will Ferrell, Kim Kardashian, Jim Gaffigan, Amanda Kloots, Richard Kind, Chelsea Handler and Dane Cook, along with NFL pros Peyton Manning, Rob Gronkowski, Randy Moss, Rodney Harrison, Julian, Edelman and Matt Light. {"uri": "8113866592", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "13:23:35", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T13:23:35Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T13:23:22Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5490196347236633, "url": "https://www.pajiba.com/tv_reviews/tom-brady-cant-take-a-joke-even-when-hes-paid-to.php", "title": "Tom Brady Can't Take A Joke Even When He's Paid To", "body": "Roasts are dreadful. I mean, specifically, the kind of \"Comedy Central\" Roasts that have been festering on television screens for over two decades. A room full of celebrities, some who know each other and some who don't, trade pre-written (by someone else) barbs aimed at being the most shocking, offensive, or cruel. A \"guest of honor\" takes most of the heat while the guests catch strays. They're gross, and often go too far, and for some reason, Tom Brady thought he could handle that.\n\nFull disclosure: I didn't even know this was happening. This kind of roast isn't affiliated with Comedy Central anymore. Netflix took the idea and \"Roastmaster\" Jeff Ross and added Tom Brady. The result is The Greatest Roast of All Time, which aired live on Netflix last night. The Roastmaster arrived to do his thing and quickly got on Brady's bad side.\n\nRoss told a brief story about Brady meeting New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft. \"So Tom became a Patriot and moved up to New England, and on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said, 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made. Would you like a massage?'\" Ross told the sizeable crowd. Kraft faced misdemeanor charges for soliciting prostitutes at a day spa in 2019.\n\nThe crowd winced and laughed. Brady is smiling his big, $100 million smile at first. Then he gets out of his seat and \"whispers\" in Ross's ear. \"Don't say that s*** again,\" Brady says, pretty much into the mic. He also tries to cover his mouth with his hand for a moment, like he doesn't want people to know what he says, then speaks at almost full volume. I put whisper in quotes because I do think that's what he was trying to do. It just didn't work out.\n\nI'm not surprised he couldn't take it. In the past, these roasts were done in front of, at most, 4000 people. I'm sure he saw those darkly lit rooms and thought, \"I can handle it.\" This special was filmed at the Kia Forum in LA, which seats 17,505 people. That's a lot more! Brady is no stranger to packed stadiums, but this is a different kinda crowd. Brady doesn't have a defensive line to protect him. Everyone's there to watch him get clowned on, and he broke early.", "source": {"uri": "pajiba.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Pajiba"}, "authors": [{"uri": "andrew_sanford@pajiba.com", "name": And we did some special things together,\" Belichick said, as seen on Netflix's live broadcast. \"For all of you out there that think about who's responsible for the Patriots' success during the time that Tom and I were there. {"uri": "8112998078", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "01:53:24", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T01:53:24Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T01:52:45Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.545098066329956, "url": "https://www.today.com/popculture/news/tom-brady-robert-kraft-joke-netflix-roast-rcna150796", "title": "Tom Brady appears unhappy about Robert Kraft joke at roast and confronts comic onstage", "body": "During the first-ever live Netflix roast, the retired quarterback appeared to briefly confront comic Jeff Ross.\n\nTom Brady's Netflix roast nearly took an unexpected turn when one joke seemed to rub him the wrong way.\n\nDuring the first-ever live roast on the streaming platform May 5, Brady sat onstage at the Kia Forum in Los Angeles as multiple celebrities took the stage and joked about his NFL career.\n\nBut the retired quarterback seemed to take offense to comedian Jeff Ross's quip about him and New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft.\n\nRoss mentioned that Brady was, famously, drafted as the 199th overall pick before he went on to have a legendary career, winning seven Super Bowl rings.\n\nThe comic joked that after Brady was selected he entered Kraft's office and said, \"'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made.'\"\n\nWhile the audience applauded, Ross continued, \"'Would you like a massage?'\"\n\nBrady arose from his seat next to the lectern and audibly whispered in Ross's ear, \"Don't say that s -- again.\"\n\nRoss replied, \"OK, OK,\" and finished the rest of his routine. It's unclear if Brady's response was scripted into the set.\n\nThe massage joke referenced the 2019 controversy involving the Patriots CEO when he was charged as part a human trafficking investigation surrounding a massage parlor in Jupiter, Florida. Kraft pleaded not guilty to two counts of soliciting a prostitute and released a statement at the time.\n\n\"I am truly sorry. I know I have hurt and disappointed my family, my close friends, my co-workers, our fans and many others who rightfully hold me to a higher standard,\" he said in March 2019, as NBC News reported.\n\nHe added, \"As I move forward, I hope to continue to use the platform with which I have been blessed to help others and to try to make a difference. I expect to be judged not by my words, but by my actions. And through those actions, I hope to regain your confidence and respect.\"\n\nIn September 2020, Florida prosecutors dropped the solicitation charges, NBC News reported.\n\nStill, Ross's innuendo made Brady briefly stop laughing so he could confront the comic on stage. Viewers reacted to the uncomfortable interaction on X.\n\nOther comedians, like host Kevin Hart and comic Nikki Glaser, repeatedly poked fun at Brady's 2022 divorce from Gisele B\u00fcndchen throughout the evening. I'm talking about The Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady, which streamed live and was, of course, unedited. The likes of Jeff Ross, Kim Kardashian and Peyton Manning were present to deliver some jabs at the expense of the former New England Patriot. Said event was hosted by a friend of Brady's, Kevin Hart but, despite their closeness, the comedian went hard when it came to making jokes. And we probably should've known that'd be the case, as Hart previously quipped that he was expecting to \"lose the relationship\" he has with Brady.\n\nKevin Hart has forged a public persona as one of the nicest guys in Hollywood, despite having an occasionally sharp tongue he puts to use when doing stand-up comedy. However, the A-lister spoke with ET before the show and stated that he wasn't going to be so kind during the big roast. That's when he jokingly made the assertion about what might happen between him and the seven-time Super Bowl winner after the show ended:\n\nThe Lift star, who's been making major moves at Netflix as of late, certainly made his stance clear while on the red carpet. What seemed to excite him the most is the fact that the roast's honoree wasn't too familiar with the ins and outs of a typical roast. Of course, the comic viewed the event as more than just an opportunity to take shots at his pal. He believed the streaming event could hold greater significance:\n\nOne could argue that the TV production was ultimately successful in that regard, as plenty of people were buzzing about it on social media over the weekend. And that's partially because of what the Jumanji star said while on stage.\n\nAs a whole, there are plenty of highlights from Tom Brady's roast, and I'd wager that some of the best (and harshest) jokes are going to be discussed for some time. Kevin Hart definitely dropped his fair share of zingers. For example, he was one of the many to joke about Brady's relationship with Gisele B\u00fcndchen, his ex-wife. Brady and B\u00fcndchen divorced in 2022 amid a flurry of rumors, including the assumption that Brady's unretirement led to the split. I mean, can you truly be friends with someone without being able to occasionally hit each other with playfully rude jokes? I don't think so.\n\nTo see all the comments that were shared on the show, stream The Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady on Netflix now. Nothing like a little booze on the brain to make your former brother in football arms lighten up a little.\n\nIt'll be fascinating to see how the Patriots fare in the post-Belichick era. Others who appeared and spoke at the show included Bill Belichick (Brady's former head coach in New England), Jeff Ross, Kim Kardashian, and ex-teammates Julian Edelman and Rob Gronkowski.\n\nWhen it was Brady's turn to speak, he made a ruthless joke about OJ Simpson that caused a reaction from the audience. Simpson passed away at the age of 76 on Apr. 10 from a battle with prostate cancer.:\n\n\"When I heard there was a slow white Bronco heading down the 405 to come here tonight, I thought we might actually see a real football legend.\"\n\nAlso Read: NFL Fans All Noticed The Same Thing About Tom Brady During His Roast On Netflix\n\nBrady is referencing the infamous \"Bronco chase\" involving Simpson and his friend Al Cowlings on June 17, 1994. Simpson was charged with the murders of his ex-wife, Nicole Brown Simpson, and her friend, Ronald Goldman, and he drove off with Cowlings despite agreeing to turn himself over to police.\n\nAbout 95 million Americans watched the low-speed chase unfold on TV. Simpson arrived at his home and spoke to his mother over the phone before surrendering to police.\n\nSimpson was ultimately acquitted of both murders, but he was later found liable for the deaths of Brown and Goldman in a civil trial. Simpson was ordered to pay $33.5 million to the victims of both families.\n\nFrom jokes about his relationship with Bill Belichick to teases about his lost money in Crypto, Tom Brady was certainly handed a handful of awfully harsh jokes.\n\nBut the future Pro Football Hall of Fame inductee handled the entire event with class and sportsmanship. SHAKE IT OFF.\" And that's not the only fanbase Brady insulted. Brady claimed that Philadelphia is filled with fans who have sad hopes of winning the championship.\n\nHe also made some wild allegations against them and said, \"Philly fans are a bunch of racist a**holes... But Kevin Hart is from there, so I understand. Philly has to grease their poles when they win a Championship, and how do they do it? By rubbing someone from Philadelphia on them.\" There was no love lost between Brady and the city of Philly. And even in a room full of comedians, Brady was holding his own well.
