{"uri": "8113789991", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "12:33:47", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T12:33:47Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T12:33:21Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5254902243614197, "url": "https://www.thepinknews.com/2024/05/06/julian-edelman-gay-for-tom-brady-roast-nfl-netflix/", "title": "Former NFL star confuses internet with his 'gay' comments during Tom Brady roast", "body": "Julian Edelman has joked about being \"gay for\" his former NFL teammate Tom Brady. (Getty)\n\nFormer American football wide receiver Julian Edelman has confused the internet by joking that he is \"gay\" for his old NFL teammate Tom Brady.\n\nDuring last night's live Netflix comedy special The Roast of Tom Brady, comedians including Jeff Ross and Nikki Glaser poked fun at legendary former football quarterback Tom Brady, touching on subjects including his marriage to model Gisele B\u00fcndchen, and his ambassadorship for cryptocurrency brand FTX.\n\nYet one of the oddest quips of the night came from Edelman, who decided to lean into an ongoing joke among NFL fans that he and Brady are \"gay\" for each other.\n\nAddressing fans' flippant remarks about his sexuality, Edelman said: \"I know there's going to be a lot of jokes about me being gay for Tom. Well, let me set the record straight. Those balls weren't going to deflate themselves.\"\n\nHis punchline referenced a 2015 NFL controversy in which it was discovered that Brady was aware that employees of his team, the New England Patriots, had been deflating footballs in order to give the team an advantage.\n\nBrady was suspended for four games, and the team was fined around one million dollars.\n\nWhile some fans declared Edelman's remark as the \"joke of the special\", others were left a little more confused by the pun.\n\n\"What is going on,\" demanded one fan on social media, as another simply wrote: \"What the f**k.\"\n\n\"The LGBTQ+ community aren't going to like that one,\" a third added.\n\nBrady and Edelman's relationship has sparked interest for several years, with some people even writing fan fiction about the pair online. In 2022, after Brady announced his retirement from the game, Edelman shared a photo of him on social media alongside the caption, \"Thanks for the memories, babe\" - further sparking fan theories and jokes.\n\nIn addition to quipping about his non-existent romance with Tom Brady, Julian Edelman also made a questionable remark seemingly directed at former NFL player Aaron Hernandez, who died by suicide in 2017.\n\n\"Everyone always asks me how big Gronk's [former NFL tight end Rob Gronkowski] d**k is,\" Edelman began.\n\n\"Now don't get me wrong, it gets the job done. Bill Belichick skewers Tom Brady's TB12 collaborator at Brady roast", "body": "Many NFL fans were curious to see how Bill Belichick would fare at Netflix's Tom Brady roast Sunday, and the long-time Patriots coach didn't disappoint with his performance.\n\nBelichick showed off his comedic side, delivering several barbs to his former star quarterback and eliciting big-time laughs from those on hand for the event.\n\nNone drew a bigger reaction than the shot Belichick took at Alex Guerrero, Brady's \"TB12\" collaborator.\n\n\"People say that Tom and I butted heads a lot, and in a way, that was true, but not really,\" Belichick said. \"It was hard to butt heads with Tom because he was so far up Alex Guerrero's ass.\"\n\nNaturally, that joke was well-received, as Guerrero was a central figure in Brady's final days with the Patriots. "sim": 0.5215686559677124, "url": "https://www.reviewjournal.com/sports/raiders/raiders-not-immune-from-jokes-during-tom-brady-roast-3046039/", "title": "Raiders not immune from jokes during Tom Brady roast", "body": "The NFL and Hollywood took turns taking shots at Tom Brady during Sunday's live roast on Netflix.\n\nThe Raiders were not immune during the three-hour event called \"The Greatest Roast of All Time,\" but the franchise was largely spared any direct shots.\n\nBrady, the former star quarterback who won seven Super Bowls, mentioned the organization during his closing set, alluding to his ongoing efforts to purchase a stake in the franchise.\n\nAfter making a joke in which he essentially admitted to deflating footballs and mocked the NFL for spending $20 million on the investigation when they could have just paid him that money to admit guilt, Brady quickly pivoted.\n\n\"I don't want to get the NFL too upset because I'm trying to buy a piece of the Raiders,\" he said. \"I'm tired of owning just the Colts and Bills.\"\n\nThe line, like much of Brady's set, drew laughter from the live audience at the Kia Forum in Inglewood, California.\n\nHis former boss, Patriots owner Robert Kraft, participated in one of the big moments of the evening when he did a shot with former New England coach Bill Belichick and called him the greatest coach of all time.\n\nKraft struggled through his set a bit, but drew some of his biggest laughs when he made light of one of the Raiders' offseason transactions.\n\n\"Good luck buying the Raiders,\" Kraft said. \"They did your favorite thing for you already: They got rid of Jimmy Garoppolo.\"\n\nGaroppolo was drafted by the Patriots as a potential Brady replacement and reportedly became the focal point in a growing rift between Brady, Belichick and Kraft until the team was essentially forced to trade Garoppolo. There were allegations Brady demanded Garoppolo be moved.\n\nGaroppolo spent last season with the Raiders, but was benched midway through the season and released in March.\n\nBased on some of the edgier material, little was off limits during the roast. There appeared to be an exception, though. Comedian Jeff Ross, perhaps the person most associated with modern-day roasts, made the only reference of the night to Kraft's massage parlor scandal.\n\nBrady rose from his seat and appeared to admonish Ross off microphone for the joke and instruct him and others the topic was off-limits. It was not mentioned again despite being a potential treasure trove of material.\n\nThe other key figure of the Patriots' dynasty also took a shot at the Raiders during his surprisingly entertaining set.\n\nBelichick was explaining to the audience that he has a softer side than what is typically portrayed.\n\n\"Not everyone knows, but I have a big heart,\" he said, already drawing laughter. \"I rescued a dog from the shelter, and I rescued (Randy Moss) from the Raiders.\"\n\nThere was one more Raiders reference. It was mostly a throwaway line, but it might get the attention of fans still holding out hope Brady, 46, decides to return to the field for the team he is trying to purchase a share of.\n\nActor Will Ferrell, in full character as Ron Burgundy from the comedic classic \"Anchorman,\" indicated Brady still has plenty of options even if he is past his prime.\n\n\"I can't wait for you to be on Fox Sports commentating on the game you loved or playing for the Raiders in the playoffs or coaching the Patriots or whatever you are going to do,\" Ferrell said. \"But let's be honest, your best years are behind you.\"\n\nThere were clearly Raiders fans in the crowd, as Ferrell had to briefly pause for applause after the mention of the Raiders in the playoffs.", "source": {"uri": No subject seemed off-limits-not even the delicate topic of Brady's recent split from Gisele B\u00fcndchen, but clearly it wasn't the case.\n\nThe tension reached a boiling point when Ross, serving as the \"roast master,\" veered into sensitive territory. Recounting the story of Brady's legendary start with the Patriots, Ross highlighted Brady's draft position and his bold first interaction with Kraft. Mimicking Brady, Ross joked, \"I'm the best decision your organization has ever made.\" But Ross pushed further with a risky punchline, asking mockingly, \"Would you like a massage?\"-a direct jab at Kraft's past legal troubles.\n\nThe joke referred to the charges Kraft faced back in February 2019, linked to a multicounty investigation into massage parlors that involved secret recordings and allegations of soliciting sex, from which Kraft was eventually cleared in 2020. The gag elicited a mixed reaction from the audience at the Los Angeles Forum, blending laughter with audible groans.\n\nBrady's response was swift and stern. As Ross turned to acknowledge Kraft in the crowd, Brady confronted the comedian. Caught by a hot mic, Brady's warning to Ross was clear: \"Don't say that s--- again.\" The remark, though delivered quickly, underscored Brady's displeasure and his protective stance towards Kraft, hinting that while he was prepared for personal roasts, he expected the jabs at others, especially those close to him, to remain off-limits.\n\nThe incident, captured live, added an unexpected layer of intensity to the event, as Brady showcased his loyalty and perhaps, a line that even a roast should not cross. Ross, for his part, acknowledged the rebuke with a laugh, a moment of levity in an otherwise tense exchange. Naturally, the event drew some of the most annoying elites (they are all Brady's friends, after all). Robert Kraft, Kim Kardashian, and Chelsea Handler were all on hand to say mean things. Unfortunately, most of them were...not that funny. Kevin Hart called him stupid, Jeff Ross called him gay, and Nikki Glaser called more attention to his wife's hot jiu-jitsu instructor boyfriend.\n\nWhile most of the jabs at Brady were about as flaccid as all those footballs the Patriots deflated (thank you! thank you! I'll be here all week!), those in the audience got dragged to absolute hell and back. For instance, Kardashian (who also attempted to get some shots in at Brady despite some apparent issues with the teleprompter) was one of them.\n\n\"I know Kim was terrified to be here tonight,\" Brady told the audience at one point. \"Not because of this, but because her kids are at home with their dad.\" Ope! A Ye meltdown post is imminent, I fear. But that -- or the onslaught of boos directed at Kardashian when she took the stage for a toast to Brady -- wasn't even the most gasp-inducing moment.\n\nJeff Ross, known as the \"Roastmaster General\" at the event, made a joke about massages aimed at Brady's former boss, Robert Kraft. Watch it here. You might remember that in 2019, the team's CEO was charged in a multicounty investigation of massage parlors in which authorities confirmed that Kraft and other men were recorded soliciting sex workers. Kraft never pleaded guilty to the solicitation charges and was ultimately cleared in 2020.\n\nThe moment could've passed with a giggle or a shift in one's seat but Brady didn't see it that way. Instead, he exacerbated the situation and pulled a Will Smith. No, he didn't give Ross a shiner (imagine if he did though!). But he did get up from his seat and deliver this warning on Kraft's behalf in Ross' ear...that was caught on mic: \"Don't say that shit again.\"\n\nOf all the things to get your jockstrap in a twist over it's...your zionist sex pest former boss's past indiscretions that does it? {"uri": "2024-05-346063678", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "07:13:48", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T07:13:48Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T04:47:39Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5098039507865906, "url": "https://clutchpoints.com/patriots-news-did-tom-brady-just-confess-deflategate-issue-fans-going-crazy", "title": "Did Tom Brady just confess to the Patriots deflategate issue? Fans are going crazy", "body": "Tom Brady is grabbing headlines on a Sunday, just like he used to during his time in the NFL with the New England Patriots and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers. This time, though, he's back in the limelight because of something entirely different from what he became famous for. During Sunday's The Roast of Tom Brady, the former NFL quarterback's tolerance for jokes was put to an absolute test. However, he also got to take shots at others, including the NFL itself.\n\nDuring a moment in the event, Brady touched on the subject of \"Deflategate\" and roasted the NFL for it.\n\n\"Remember deflategate? The NFL spent $20 million and found that it was more probable than not that I was generally aware that someone may have deflated my footballs. You could have just given me the $20 million, and I would just told you I f**king did it.\"\n\nUnfortunately for everyone who watched the event, NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell was not in attendance. It would have been so much fun if people got to see his constant reaction to that hilarious jab from the seven-time Super Bowl champion.\n\nTo set the record straight, Tom Brady did not admit to anything. Deflategate, to him, is perhaps nothing more than just a topic worthy as material for events like, well, live roasting. At the height of the controversy, Brady had to seek legal help to fight the suspension the NFL slapped him. He was successful in that regard in 2015 because he was able to play that year's NFL campaign. However, he ultimately accepted the league's penalty and spent the first four games of the 2016 NFL campaign off the field to serve his suspension. On that of Brady's suspension, the Patriots were also stripped of two draft picks in the 2016 NFL Draft and fined a total of $1 million.\n\nFor what it's worth, the Patriots managed to win three of four games during his time away from the team. Once he returned, Brady used his burning desire to have the last laugh amid the controversy to fuel the Patriots into winning 11 of 12 games. And oh, the Patriots also won the Super Bowl that season in epic fashion, defeating the Atlanta Falcons in Super Bowl 51 despite being down by as many as 25 points (28-3) in the contest.\n\nFans react to Tom Brady's Deflategate shot at NFL\n\nMany took it upon themselves to point out to everyone, who may be thinking they just heard Brady confess, that it was all a joke. Suprise!\n\n\"No, he's saying instead of wasting the 20 million to find out if he did it, give him the $20 million and he would just say he did it whether true or not,\" said @uncletyler_eth.\n\n\"He was saying that he would say it for $20 mil like he was saying he would do anything for $20 mil he wasn't admitting to it he was saying he would say he did it if it meant he got $20 million\"\n\n\"Brady got up there drunk asf and started to yap \ud83d\ude2d\ud83d\ude2d,\" commented @Davethe_King1.\n\n\"Took some balls. Deflated ones. But took them nonetheless,\" joked @CincyHub.\n\n\"Pretty sure he was more making a joke that he'd admit to anything for $20 mil,\" said @Stark_AJ199.\n\n\"Still beat the garbage colts by like 40 points. Don't think the pats defense benefited at all,\"chimed in @_paytonjames.", "source": {"uri": "clutchpoints.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "ClutchPoints"}, "authors": [{"uri": Credit - USA TODAY Sports\n\nTom Brady finally became the butt of the joke, which used to be Bill Belichick's gig ever since the 'Dynasty' docu-series dropped. Everyone took digs at the old man, even his former players. The ex-Patriots head honcho, however, finally got his payback at the 'The Tom Brady Roast' last Sunday. Yet, his subtle jabs weren't just directed at Brady but at another former Patriot, Danny Amendola.\n\nTwo-time Super Bowl-winning wide receiver, Danny Amendola, hasn't shied away from giving his former head coach the business when it came to cricizing him. From claiming that the 'Patriot Way' revolved around Tom Brady, not Bill, to asserting on the infamous docu-series that even a young Boston fan knew TB12 was meant to stay -- Amendola has been busy.\n\nBill Belichick surely got the wind of this too, and at the first-ever live-taping of the roast show, he didn't shy away from a ruthless clapback. The eight-time Super Bowl-winning coach made sure everyone knew about Amandola's performance on the field, which wasn't quite as explosive as his off-field banter.\n\n\"Danny joined us in 2014 and had 200 yards. In 2016 he had 250. Or what Randy [Moss] would call a decent first half,\" Belichick quipped, as per Alex Berth on X.\n\nEveryone had their eyes set on Roastmaster General Jeff Ross and host Kevin Hart, but it's safe to say Bill Belichick turned out to be the one to steal the show. However, the Amendola dig wasn't the only moment that left the audience and football fans gasping for air.\n\nWhile Belichick's cheeky dig at Amendola went somewhat unnoticed, his other witty comebacks were much appreciated by the fans. For instance, he labeled the 'Dynasty' docu-series as his version of the roast, saying,\n\n\"I'm so honored to be here for the roast of Tom Brady on Netflix. That's not to be confused with The Roast of Bill Belichick, the ten-part Apple TV series,\" as per Boston.com.\n\nBill then hilariously recounted if he and Brady ever \"butted heads,\" and the answer must have been no, as he quipped, \"It was hard to butt heads with Tom because he was so far up Alex Guerrero's ass.\"\n\nNext up was Rob Gronkowski, Belichick's prodigal son and arguably the best tight end to grace the gridiron. The head coach, who is currently without a job himself and is looking to make a broadcasting debut, wasn't at all impressed by Gronk's time on FOX NFL Sunday. In fact, Bill even pleaded with him to call it quits.\n\n\"Gronk, I've been watching you on FOX NFL Sunday, and I'm begging you: Stop doing your job. Do another job. Do somebody else's job!,\" he said.\n\nThe shenanigans didn't end there, as when Brady and Gronk got their turn at the podium, the duo highlighted two separate incidents, all pointing in one direction: Belichick dating young college girls.\n\nThis roast will go down in history as one of the grandest off-field events football has ever indirectly helped bring about. Only the live-taping of the event has taken the internet by storm; thus, it can be said with certainty that it will remain the talk of the town for a while. Mandatory Credit: David Butler II-USA TODAY Sports\n\nIn the latest Netflix special 'The Roast of Tom Brady', former Patriots HC Bill Belichick was the casualty of one of the sickest roasts of the night. The format of the show is such that everyone who roasts gets roasted back. But Belichick might have gotten a lot more in return than what he gave.\n\nFormer Patriots WR Julian Edelman took on the responsibility of roasting his former HC Bill Belichick with much interest. The charming Edelman revealed that back when he was a player for the Patriots, the HC would always compare the players with Foxboro high school students and how they could make better plays than the Patriots players.\n\nEdelman however now sees Belichick's current condition as the perfect opportunity for a rebuttal as he brutally reminds his former HC that his only offer currently might be from Foxboro High.\n\n\"You remember when you used to yell at us? Look, assholes, the fucking kids down at Foxboro High can make that fucking play. I've been waiting for this for so long. Look, asshole, Foxboro High is the only job offer you fucking had.\"\n\n\"Do your job? More like need a job, coach!\" said Edelman ending his roast with a venomous payback. The crowd, including Tom Brady, was left stunned by Edelman's scathing roast. Bill Belichick however didn't take it to his heart as he broke his stoic character and laughed hard at the joke.\n\nWhile Belichick didn't have a roast with such extensive buildup and punchline, the HC did take a job at Patriots owner Robert Kraft which has left the internet melting!\n\nThe last time Bill Belichick appeared on a streaming platform, he wasn't portrayed in a positive light. Yes, we are talking about 'The Dynasty', the 10-part Apple TV series tracking down the intricacies behind the New England Patriots' dominant era. HC Bill Belichick in the Robert Kraft-led documentary was shown as a stubborn cold hearted man with a short temper.\n\nHis portrayal of the way he treated Brady with tough love and Belichick's handling of the Aaron Hernandez situation put him in a bad light. Hence addressing this skewed portrayal, Belichick started his roast with a cheeky dig. He expressed his gratitude to be part of Brady's roast and urged people not to be confused with the roast of Bill Belichick - 'The Dynasty'.\n\n\"Seriously I'm so honored to be here for the roast of Tom Brady on Netflix,\" Belichick said. \"It's not to be confused with the roast of Bill Belichick on the 10-part Apple TV series.\"\n\nBelichick being shown in negative light was condemned by many of his former players. From Rodney Harrison to Ty Law, many came in support of their former HC and spoke against the documentary. {"uri": "8114365596", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "19:46:45", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T19:46:45Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T19:46:13Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4901960790157318, "url": "https://thesportsrush.com/nfl-news-back-in-2019-alex-guerrero-coach-belichick-probe-made-tom-brady-hang-up-in-middle-of-the-interview/", "title": "Back in 2019, Alex Guerrero-Coach Belichick Probe Made Tom Brady Hang Up in Middle of the Interview - The SportsRush", "body": "Jan 4, 2020; Foxborough, Massachusetts, USA; New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady (12) before their playoff game against the Tennessee Titans at Gillette Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Winslow Townson-USA TODAY Sports\n\nTom Brady got roasted last night, and it was glorious to see him sit there and take it like a tough cookie. During the live-taping of the event, everyone took a jab at his appearance, being picked in the 6th round, his TB12 method, his divorce, and several other topics. However, another recurring theme that emerged was Brady's association with his diet coach, Alex Guerrero.\n\nEven though the former NFL star has made it abundantly clear that he prefers to keep his relationship with his long-time diet guru, Alex Guerrero, out of the limelight, the roast didn't go easy on anyone, not even this touchy topic. Despite Brady's discomfort with discussing Guerrero, the jokes continued.\n\nYet, like a true competitor, Brady remained a good sport, sitting through the entire session with a subtle unease evident on his face. It must have been challenging for the 3-time MVP, given his aversion to discussing Guerrero openly. There's even that memorable incident when he abruptly ended an interview because the interviewer refused to respect his wish to steer clear of the topic.\n\nDuring a 2019 radio appearance with WEEI in Boston, Tom Brady was inquired about his controversial trainer and, even though he was willing to answer a question about him in brief -- TB12 didn't like the repeated follow-up questions posed to him by the interviewer.\n\nThey asked Brady about Alex being present with him on the plane that season when he missed the 2nd half of the previous season, to which the seven-time Super Bowl champ gave an affirmative answer. When the interviewer pressed further for clarification for Guerrero not being alongside Tom during the 2017-18 season, the season in which the Patriots lost to the Eagles in the Super Bowl; Brady clammed up, refusing to get into the incident.\n\nHowever, the dogged interviewer tried his luck yet again to force an answer out of the three-time MVP, and while Brady' asserted that he didn't want to get into it, he gave a brief reply, stating the importance of his relationship with Guerrero. Frustrated with repeated ignorance of his request, Brady said his goodbyes and left the call in a hurry.\n\nBrady and Belichick's relationship had soared beyond repair even before he left New England for Tampa. During the 2017 season, this friction led to Bill banning Alex from flying with the team and even taking his sideline privileges during game days. The team's medical staff didn't quite agree with or like Guerrero's alternative medicine and treatments, which led to the latter's ban.\n\nThough it was Brady's roast, everyone got their fair share of banter. However, some were grilled more than others, like Giselle and her Jiu-Jitsu instructor and Aaron Hernandez. However, as per Bill Simmons of the Ringer, Guerrero got the worst of it and was one of the losers in the Roast.\n\nThere were plenty of one-liners aimed at the Brady-Guerrero relationship. TB12's former head coach, Bill Belichick, while taking a dig at Guerrero, quipped, \"People said Tom and I butted heads a lot. In a way, it was true, but not really because it was hard to butt heads with Tom because it was so far up Guerrero's a**.\"\n\nMoreover, Julian Edelman, taking a mickey at Alex's weird practices and things he made Tom do, said, \"In case you didn't know, Alex Guerro is the snake oil salesman who turned Tom into a f*cking weirdo.\"\n\nAnother one of the roasters called Alex, Brady's wife, and playfully said, \"I don't want to talk about your wife. He's here actually! Alex Guerrero everyone!!\"\n\nWhile Guerrero turned out to be a loser and would have wished his invite had gotten lost in the mail, the winner was clearly Brady, who got to occupy center stage once again. He took it like a true champion and dished it out perfectly too. His jokes about Peyton Manning being in his shadow, him owning the Colts and Bills, and football being the love of his life.\n\nEveryone got to see the side of Brady and Belichick that the duo didn't show during those 20 years in Foxborough. Netflix \"Liberal F*cks\" For Only Giving Him One Minute During Tom Brady Roast", "body": "Nobody was safe during the Netflix roast of Tom Brady...including Netflix.\n\nThe special actually turned out to be even better than I expected, with nobody holding back as they took their turns roasting the seven-time Super Bowl winning quarterback...and pretty much everybody else in the room.\n\nComedian Jeff Ross seemed to get under the NFL superstar's skin with one joke in particular:\n\n\"On the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into Robert Kraft's office and said, 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made.\n\nWould you like a massage?\"\n\nThe joke was obviously a jab at Patriots owner Robert Kraft getting caught up in a prostitution scandal a few years ago, when he allegedly visited a Florida massage parlor for some...well, relief.\n\nAll of the charges against Kraft were eventually dropped, but apparently it's still a sore spot for Brady.\n\nAs Ross was telling Kraft how much he loved him after the jab, Brady stood up and the microphones picked up what he said in Ross's ear:\n\n\"Don't say that shit again.\"\n\nAnd even deceased former New England Patriots tight end wasn't safe from a few shots (neither were his murder victims) as both former Patriots wide receiver Julian Edelman and comedian Nikki Glaser were among the roasters who had jokes about Hernandez, who committed suicide in prison back in 2017 while serving a life sentence after being convicted of murder:\n\n\"Everyone always asks me how big Gronk's d*ck is.\n\nNow don't get me wrong, it gets the job done. But there was this other Patriots tight end. Now HE was hung.\"\n\nBrutal.\n\nBut UFC president and CEO Dana White decided to direct his jokes at the host network themselves, taking a shot at Netflix for only allowing him one minute during the show:\n\n\"It pisses me off. I flew all the way out here and you guys give me 60 seconds?\n\nMy name is Dana. Is that not trans enough for you liberal f*cks?\"\n\nObviously White is open about his support and friendship with former President Donald Trump, and hosts Trump often during UFC fights.\n\nWhite then turned to the subject at hand and laid into Brady:\n\n\"You played for the Patriots for so long that I was actually starting to feel like you were from Boston.\n\nThen I saw you run and I was like, {"uri": "8113733028", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "11:57:02", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T11:57:02Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T11:56:39Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4705882370471954, "url": "https://www.si.com/nfl/bills/tom-brady-netflix-roast-bills-mafia", "title": "WATCH: Tom Brady takes humorous shot at Bills Mafia during Netflix Roast", "body": "His prowess on the football field has been matched by few in NFL history. His joke-writing ability (or eye for ghostwriters), however, could use a bit of work.\n\nNetflix streamed The Greatest Roast of All Time on Sunday evening, a several-hour comedic pile-on of three-time NFL MVP Tom Brady. The former Michigan man needs no introduction -- he's arguably the greatest quarterback in NFL history, his 20-year stint at the helm of the New England Patriots resulting in a dynasty the likes of which the league may never see again. The Patriots appeared in nine Super Bowls throughout Brady's tenure with the team, winning six of them as Brady earned four Super Bowl MVP nods.\n\nThough wins are very much not a quarterback stat, Brady's career record of 286-97 is impressive...depending on who you ask. You may be hard-pressed to find anybody too moved by the statistic in Western New York, as over 30 of Brady's near-300 career wins came against the same team: the Buffalo Bills.\n\nRelated: 5 Bills in great situations to succeed following 2024 NFL Draft\n\nBrady simply dominated the Bills throughout his career, his 33-3 record against the team serving as a tangible marker of the intangible turmoil, heartache, and frustration he put Buffalo fans through throughout his two decades with the Patriots. It was largely the Bills' own organizational ineptitude that kept the team in purgatory -- and out of the playoffs -- throughout the first 17 years of the century, but Brady and New England serving as an ever-present hurdle in the division certainly didn't help matters.\n\nBrady was public enemy No. 1 in Western New York throughout his time with the Patriots, and the disdain, though not necessarily fully reciprocated, was partially shared. The quarterback even took a playful shot at the team and its fans during his Netflix roast, making note of the team's championship shortcomings.\n\n\"I'm trying to buy a piece of the Raiders, [because] I'm tired of owning just the Colts and the Bills,\" Brady said. \"Buffalo fans call themselves the 'Bills Mafia.' How are you the f****** mafia? At least the mafia has a ring you can kiss.\"\n\nTo prevent potential embarrassment, we'll let sleeping dogs lie -- Brady won seven Super Bowls throughout his career, so if ever there were a person qualified to joke about a team's lack of championship success, it's him. All of his Super Bowl victories, of course, were without any sort of controversy, and not a single one was unscrupulous in any way.\n\nThis also isn't the first time that Brady has taken a shot at Buffalo. While doing press for Super Bowl XLVI, the future Hall of Famer took a strange (and largely unprompted) jab at Western New York hotels, stating that \"they're not the nicest places in the world.\"\n\nSomeone apparently hasn't stayed at the world-renowned Motel 6 by the Buffalo Niagara International Airport. There's even a Cracker Barrel next door.\n\nJokes aside, Buffalo does appear to be on the road to its first Super Bowl championship; it's appeared in the postseason in each of the past six seasons, with most pundits agreeing that it's only a matter of time before otherworldly quarterback Josh Allen is able to get his team over the hump and deliver a Super Bowl to Western New York. If and when Allen is able to do so, perhaps Brady will be there to kiss his ring.", "source": {"uri": "si.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Sports Illustrated"}, "authors": [{"uri": {"uri": "8113048636", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "03:03:10", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T03:03:10Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T03:02:49Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4666666686534882, "url": "https://www.si.com/nfl/2024/05/05/bill-belichick-rob-gronkowski-tom-brady-roast", "title": "Bill Belichick Pokes Fun at Rob Gronkowski With Perfect Joke at Tom Brady's Roast", "body": "Former New England Patriots coach Bill Belichick dug deep into his playbook to unleash a few zingers while taking the microphone during Netflix's roast of Tom Brady on Sunday.\n\nAlthough the whole night was dedicated to making fun of the seven-time Super Bowl champion Brady, Belichick took down another one of his former players -- tight end Rob Gronkowski -- with a witty joke.\n\n\"You know, a lot of people connect me with a saying called, 'Do your job.' And telling people to do their jobs,'\" Belichick said at the podium. \"And Gronk, I've been watching you on FOX NFL Sunday, and I'm begging you -- please -- stop doing your job.\n\n\"Do another job. Do somebody else's job.\"\n\nThe cameras cut to Gronkowski laughing hard alongside former Patriots teammate Julian Edelman.\n\nGronkowski, who retired from the NFL for good in June 2022, has appeared on the FOX NFL Sunday show alongside Terry Bradshaw, Howie Long and the crew the past two seasons.\n\nBelichick wasn't done there, either. He took a side swipe at Apple TV's recent documentary The Dynasty: New England Patriots for, well, not shining the greatest light on his character and coaching style in Foxborough.", "source": {"uri": "si.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Sports Illustrated"}, "authors": [{"uri": "tom_dierberger@si.com", "name": "Tom Dierberger", "type": "author", "isAgency": false}], "concepts": [{"uri": {"uri": "8114445312", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "21:04:48", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T21:04:48Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T21:04:25Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4666666686534882, "url": "https://www.outkick.com/culture/roast-of-tom-brady-epitomized-comedy-offensive", "title": "Roast of Tom Brady Epitomized What Comedy Should Be, Nothing Was Off-Limits", "body": "In today's societal climate, it's rare to see an entire group of people completely ignore the \"rules\" set forth by the outrage mob to create true comedy. But that's exactly what made \"Greatest Roast of All-Time: Tom Brady\" one of the best American comedy events in the past five years.\n\nWas the show clunky at times? It was. Were there some terrible performances? There were. Would it have been more enjoyable without slogging along for three-plus hours? Maybe.\n\nYes, it was long. But the results of doing the show live made the grind worth it. Why? Because perpetually-offended producers in Hollywood or at Netflix didn't have a chance to edit out the \"offensive jokes\" that no-doubt riled up the \"I have a great sense of humor, but that kind of humor just isn't funny\" crowd.\n\nTo be fair to that group, I didn't see all that much backlash from the event. Granted, it's a Netflix special and should pick up steam as it sits on the platform. Live events aren't what they used to be, so there's still time.\n\nPerhaps, though, this is a signal that American society is returning to its best form. The one where people understand jokes for what they are: jokes. At its very comedy, comedy is meant to be offensive.\n\nEven the played-out \"my mother-in-law is a monster\" bits are rooted in making someone the butt of the joke.\n\nBut the \"Roast of Tom Brady\" went far deeper than that. There were jokes about murder, suicide, gay people, transgender people, black people, white people, democrats, republicans, mentally-challenged people ... no one was spared. And we all laughed. That's a good thing. We need more of it.\n\nOne of the most important acts of the night came from a comedian named Tony Hinchcliffe. I must admit, I was not familiar with him prior to the roast. But he went on that stage on Sunday night with zero fear and the results speak for themselves.\n\nSome of his one-liners were legendary - even if you can't tell them at your corporate job this week. If you do, you probably have to whisper, and you must really, really trust your co-worker.\n\nHe came out of the gate firing, starting with one of the most common themes of the night: Kevin Hart is short. Another played-out bit, but you have to play the hits at these things. But Hinchcliffe managed to weave in Aaron Hernandez' suicide into a Kevin Hart height joke.\n\n\"All night, [Kevin Hart] has been using the stool that Aaron Hernandez kicked out from under himself.\"\n\nAgain, I had no predispositions about Hinchcliffe. But I immediately realized this guy wasn't here to mess around or worry about people's feelings.\n\n\"Tom Brady is a Patriot, which is surprising since he looks like a Confederate Fag.\"\n\nTurns out, he was just warming up.\n\n\"Jeff [Ross] is so Jewish, he only watches football for the coin toss.\"\n\nThen, he took aim at DEI with a joke directed at a relatively-unknown comedienne named Sam Jay.\n\n\"Sam Jay is here, an obese, African-American, lesbian ... by having her here, Netflix checked a lot of boxes.\"\n\nThere are too many good jokes to write them all out, but here's a supercut of his set:\n\nOf course, the comedians brought the comedy and brought the offensive material. Jeff Ross came out in an O.J. Simpson jersey and said he had just visited Aaron Hernandez in hell.\n\nNikki Glaser said that Rob Gronkowski puts \"the 'Downs' in touchdowns ... the 'special' in special teams ... [and] the 'tard' in Rob Gronkowski is retarded.\"\n\nThey were both great, but they also did their jobs as comedians. The real surprise came when Brady's former teammate, Edelman, hit the stage. I was not prepared for where he was going to go with his roast.\n\n\"Everyone always asks me how big Gronk's dick is,\" Edelman began one of his jokes. \"Don't get me wrong, it gets the job done. But there was this other Patriots tight end...\" he continued before taking a long pause.\n\n\"Now, he was HUNG,\" Edelman concluded to gasps from the crowd, a reference to Aaron Hernandez hanging himself in prison. Dark! But, admittedly, a very funny joke.\n\nThen, there was his joke about Jeff Ross that really struck me. It was one of those \"can he really say that?!\" moments. That's when I realized that comedy was back, baby.\n\n\"Fun fact, Jeff and I are both Jewish. The difference is I'm the kind of Jew that makes people say 'oh, you're Jewish?'\" Edelman began, again before taking a long pause.\n\n\"Jeff Ross is the kind of Jew that makes people want to join Hamas.\"\n\nAs all roasts do, the event concluded with Tom Brady getting a chance to defend himself from taking the heat for three hours. He had some good zingers in there, but the one that really showed that no one on this panel cared about getting canceled was his brilliant 9/11 joke.\n\nI can't believe I just wrote that Tom Brady had a \"brilliant 9/11 joke.\" If that doesn't tell you that comedy is back, I don't know what does.\n\n\"Like the rest of America, I'll always remember where I was that fateful day in September 2001, when tragically...\" Brady started, as the entire crowd sat tensely wondering where he was going.\n\n\"Those two Jets slammed into Drew Bledsoe.\"\n\nFate in humanity and American society restored! There were too many great jokes to list all of them, and some of them were extremely \"offensive.\" Of course, I don't mean that I was offended, rather that those who make a living by being offended probably were offended.\n\nBut, screw them. A funny joke is a funny joke. They're not going to take that away from us. Thank you to Tom Brady and the cast of characters at the roast Sunday night for reminding us of America's greatest export: comedy.", "source": {"uri": "outkick.com", "dataType": "news", "title": {"uri": "8113151778", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "04:58:23", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T04:58:23Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T04:56:38Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4666666686534882, "url": "https://www.masslive.com/patriots/2024/05/everything-bill-belichick-said-at-tom-bradys-roast.html", "title": "Everything Bill Belichick said at Tom Brady's roast", "body": "About halfway into Tom Brady's roast on Netflix, Bill Belichick emerged from the back and became one of the stars of the evening.\n\nThe 72-year-old coach delivered one of the lines of the night -- an Alex Guerrero zinger -- and hit on a number of hilarious topics. Belichick implored Rob Gronkowski to stop doing his job on FOX, took credit for saving Randy Moss from the Raiders, and dubbed \"The Dynasty\" a 10-part roast of himself. It was one of the most memorable performances of the special.\n\nHere's everything Belichick said on Sunday night:\n\nTo comedian Kevin Hart:\n\n\"Kev, you think you can get me a cheer like that in Philly? Yeah, I didn't think so.\"\n\nTo comedian Will Ferrell, who appeared in character:\n\n\"Ron Burgandy, the only member of the media I respect.\"\n\nOn being a roaster:\n\n\"You know the fellas invited me up here to lighten up the mood a little bit tonight. But seriously I'm so honored to be for the roast of Tom Brady on Netflix. That's not to be confused with the roast of Bill Belichick on the 10-part Apple TV series.\"\n\n\"There's a lot of mean things being said about Tom tonight. I wonder why they invited me. Really, Tom, why are all these people so hard on you? Do you miss me?\"\n\nTo Hart:\n\n\"Whenever Kevin talks I go into a Cover 2 defense: Cover both ears.\"\n\nTo the panel of comedians:\n\n\"First time some of these comedians tonight. Andrew Schulz, Nikki Glazer, Tom Segura. This is the comedy version of the no name defense. Who are these people?\"\n\nTo comedian Jeff Ross:\n\n\"For 49 years I've been a football coach but now I'm going to be a life coach and Jeff: Punt. When I get rid of my two sleeves it's from my sweatshirts. When Jeff Ross gets rid of his two sleeves it's from a box of cookies.\"\n\nTo Rob Gronkowski:\n\n\"A lot of people connected me with a saying called 'do your job' and telling people to do their job. Gronk, I've been watching you on Fox NFL Sunday and I'm begging you, please, stop doing your job. Do another job. Do somebody else's job. I loved coaching Gronk. He was the best. Great teammate. Great, great player. Hall of Fame player. Give it up for Gronk, man. Gronk's taken a lot of heat. He's been roasted the third most between Brady then me, and Gronk tonight. But sorry Rob, I've gotta keep going. Rob landed some endorsement deals with some of his favorite foods. Campbell's soup, Dunkin Donuts, and don't forget Tide Pods. One-hundred percent true story: I used Rob's Tide Pod commercial to teach our team that this is when you say no. Just because somebody asks you to do something stupid, you don't have to do it. Say no! That advice was never given by Kevin (Hart's) manager.\"\n\nTo Randy Moss:\n\n\"A lot of you don't know, but I have a big heart. I really do. Seriously. Come on, man. I rescued a dog from the shelter, and I rescued Randy from the Raiders. Listen Randy, I'm really sorry you didn't get a ring. Not sorry enough to give you one of mine, but I'm still really sorry.\"\n\nTo a panel of Patriots players:\n\n\"It's great to have all the Patriots here. You guys were all awesome, really. You meant so much. And Tom's the greatest of all time. There's no question about that. It's why we're all here. Tom's fantastic, but he played on some great teams, and these great players that played with him, they were great teams. We accomplished a lot. So proud to be here.\"\n\nTo Danny Amendola:\n\n\"Danny Amendola up here on the stage, he came with us. Danny joined us in 2014 and got us 200 yards that year. Then in 2016 he picked up another 250. Or to put it another way, what Randy would call a decent first half.\"\n\nTo Matt Light:\n\n\"Matt, I love where you are. Matt Light protected Tom's blind side along with Nate Solder. Two great left tackles blocking Dwight Freeny and all those other guys in the Hall of Fame. Maybe they'll get there someday too. But Matt, I love where you are: Far away from the microphone. In all my years with the Patriots, there's no player I had to say more often to shut the (expletive) up than Matt Light. You know Matt came into the league and I've known about his struggles with Crohn's disease, and that certainly explains (over) all the years why he gave me so much (expletive).\"\n\nTo Rodney Harrison:\n\n\"One man that it's always great to see, Rodney Harrison. One of the greatest players I've ever coached. He was a great, great football player. Great person. Great competitor. He's not in the Pro Football Hall of Fame, and to me, that might be the biggest joke of the night... invite me to your induction.\"\n\nTo Tom Brady:\n\n\"Believe it or not, I've got a lot of nice things to say about Tom but I'm running out of time here. Do I have a couple extra minutes? OK. We've already talked about the cryptocurrency, I'll stay away from that one. But I see your soccer team Birmingham City got knocked down to another tier in the English football league. So for those not familiar with English football and the intricacies to their obscure (relegation) system, just let me put it in English for you: They suck! Not so easy running a team, is it Tom? So, little coaching advice, stick to American football. You're really good at that.\n\n\"People have said that Tom and I butted heads a lot, and in a way that was true, but not really. It was hard to butt heads with Tom because it was so far up Alex Guerrero's (butt).\n\n\"You know, Tom, you had so many clutch moments, so many big plays, so many just unbelievable plays that will live on forever. I remember the pass that you threw to Amendola when we beat Baltimore in the playoffs in '14 -- no, that was Julian that threw that pass to Amendola. There was the pass you threw to (Phillip) Dorsett when we beat the Eagles -- (Philly fan Kevin Hart) you remember that one -- in 2019. No, Julian, you threw that one too. Oh. Tom threw a lot of touchdown passes. I can't remember them, but he threw a bunch of them.\n\n\"Seriously, Tom and I had our differences, but you know it only comes with love and respect about our relationship and we did some special things together. For all of you out there that think about who's responsible for the Patriots' success during the time when Tom and I were there, was it Brady? Was it me? Was it Brady? Was it me? The joke, in full: \"So Tom became a Patriot and moved up to New England, and on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said, 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made... Would you like a massage?'\"\n\nWhile Brady maintained a grin, he seemed to hesitate for a moment before getting up and walking over to Ross and telling him, \"Don't say that shit again.\" While he may have intended it as a whisper, the mic picked it up and the comment was very audible.\n\nRoss, who'd already blown a kiss to Kraft and said, \"I love Robert Kraft,\" responded to Brady's remark with a laugh and another gesture to Kraft, \"OK, OK. He's having fun, look at him\"\n\nWhile the incident certainly didn't look planned, Rolling Stone has reached out to reps for Brady and Ross for any further comment or info.\n\nRoss' joke stemmed from Kraft's 2019 arrest on charges of soliciting prostitution. He was arrested as part of an investigation into a string of massage parlors in Florida and faced two charges of soliciting sex from an employee of one parlor in Jupiter. Kraft rejected a plea deal and entered a not-guilty plea, but the charges were ultimately dropped in the fall of 2020 on the grounds that the surveillance footage used to prosecute him was illegally obtained.\n\nA few weeks after his arrest, Kraft issued a statement saying: \"I am truly sorry. I know I have hurt and disappointed my family, my close friends, my co-workers, our fans and many others who rightfully hold me to a higher standard. Throughout my life, I have always tried to do the right thing. The last thing I would ever want to do is disrespect another human being... As I move forward, I hope to continue to use the platform with which I have been blessed to help others and to try to make a difference. I expect to be judged not by my words, but by my actions. {"uri": "8113682202", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "11:22:33", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T11:22:33Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T11:22:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4588235318660736, "url": "https://www.marca.com/en/nfl/2024/05/06/6638b98a46163f23818b45be.html", "title": "Tom Brady finally comes clean and admits to Deflategate with hilarious message to the NFL", "body": "Speaking at the Kia Forum in Los Angeles, the 46-year-old got up on stage as he tackled several subjects, from his career with the Patriots to mocking their rivals, the Buffalo Bills and Indianapolis Colts.\n\nBut the seven-time Super Bowl winner drew the biggest applause of the night when refering to 'Deflategate', which dates back to 2015 when Brady was accused of deflating footballs to gain an advantage during the NFL playoffs.\n\nWhen the NFL initially began their investigation in 2015, Patriots quarterback Brady initially referred to the accusations as \"ridiculous\", while Patriots coach Bill Belichick denied having any knowledge of it happening.\n\nAfter years of denials, the future Hall of Famer appear to confess to his role in the controversy when he was given the chance to roast people in the show, which was aired on Sunday night.\n\n\"Remember Deflategate? The NFL spent $20million and found that it was more 'probable than not' that I was 'generally aware' and someone may have deflated my footballs,\" Brady said.\n\n\"You could have just given me the $20m and I would have just told you I f***ing did it. You know what I'm saying boys? You know what I'm saying?\"\n\nThe joke may have gone down well with the crowd, with some members of the audience rising to give him a standing ovation. But at the time, there was outrage at Brady's alleged cheating.\n\nThe Patriots were accused of allegedly ordering footballs to be tampered with for the 2014 AFC Championship Game against the Indianapolis Colts on January 18, 2015. Removing air from a football makes it easier to grip, throw, and catch, and teams had suspected Brady was benefiting from this illegal advantage.\n\nThe NFL hired attorney Ted Wells to look into the allegations and after four months, he concluded with a 243-page report that the Patriots equipment had deliberately circumvented the rules.\n\nThe controversy resulted in Brady being suspended for four games, while the team was fined $1m and forfeited two selections in the 2016 NFL Draft.", "source": {"uri": "marca.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "MARCA"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": He was also among the most handsome, with model Gisele Bundchen, in particular, being enamored enough to become his wife.\n\nTheir ensuing marriage would last more than a decade, but it all came crashing down in 2022 amid a turbulent period. And comedians Kevin Hart and Nikki Glaser made sure to reference it in their jokes on Sunday's Netflix roast of the seven-time Super Bowl champion.\n\nThe former even alluded to Bundchen's current partner, karate/jiu-jitsu coach Joaquim Valente, saying:\n\n\"You sometimes got to f-k your coach. You know who else f-ked their coach? Gisele. She f-ked that karate man. I mean Jesus Christ, Tom. One of the smartest quarterbacks ever played a game. How did you not see this coming?\"\n\nThe latter, meanwhile, joked about Tom Brady's rings (his seven Super Bowl rings -- six with the New England Patriots and one with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers -- and his marriage ring):\n\n\"Five-time Super Bowl MVP, most career wins, most career touchdowns. You have seven rings. Well, eight, now that Gisele gave hers back.\"\n\nShe even alluded to Brady's prior relationship with Bridget Moynahan (that produced a son):\n\n\"It's hard to walk away from something that's not your pregnant girlfriend [Bridget Moynahan]. To be fair, he didn't know she was pregnant. He just thought she was getting fat and Tom hates fat.\"\n\nTom Brady's responses to his roasters: Some highlights\n\nOf course, every roast requires a reaction/response/retort. And with so many guests, it would be hard for Tom Brady to respond to them all.\n\nBut he did have some good ones to share, with one highlight being for Kim Kardashian that referenced their parenthood:\n\n\"I know Kim was terrified to be here tonight. Not because of this, but because her kids are home with (her ex-husband Kanye West).\"\n\nAnd this one for Taylor Swift and the Kansas City Chiefs:\n\n\"You say your stadium is the loudest. It helps when all your fans are 14-year-old girls. And in honor of [Taylor Swift, boyfriend of Travis Kelce], let's take a look at the Chiefs 'eras': terrible for 50 years, good for five. Shake it off.\"\n\nTom Brady even referenced Deflategate, sarcastically remarking that he would have admitted to illegally modifying the footballs used in the 2014-15 AFC Championship game against the More specifically, Brady mentioned the tight end position, once manned by standout Aaron Hernandez, now deceased. {"uri": "8113933217", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "14:07:44", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T14:07:44Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T14:07:27Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4431372582912445, "url": "https://www.cbsnews.com/boston/news/robert-kraft-toasts-bill-belichick-tom-brady-roast-on-netflix/", "title": "Robert Kraft toasts -- not roasts -- Bill Belichick during Tom Brady roast on Netflix", "body": "BOSTON -- For the unaware, celebrity roasts are events where a bunch of famous and/or funny people gather in a room so that they can be exceptionally mean to each other for several hours in front of a large audience. It's usually raunchy, unfiltered, and a bit of an odd setup. But more often than not, it works.\n\nThings that don't normally happen at such functions are moments of genuine kindness and appreciation. Yet Robert Kraft felt compelled to try to have one of those with Bill Belichick.\n\nKraft -- who was seated in the audience -- was called up to the stage by host Kevin Hart to share a shot with Belichick, with whom the Patriots \"mutually parted ways\" after last year's 4-13 season. It was an unceremonious end to arguably the best coaching tenure in NFL history, and considering a Kraft-backed docuseries airing in February and March didn't shed the kindest light on Belichick, the Patriots' owner may have felt a need to be overly nice to Belichick when given the opportunity to speak about his former coach.\n\nAnd that he did.\n\n\"I want to say this is the greatest coach in the history of the game that did what no one else has done,\" Kraft said after clinking shot glasses with Belichick. \"And having Tom Brady and him was the greatest honor the good Lord gave me. So cheers.\"\n\nFor his part, Belichick kept a mostly stoic face, as he also appeared unsure of what he was supposed to do up there. But he eventually gave a little smile.\n\nBelichick did joke a little bit about that aforementioned Apple TV series, saying it was a 10-part roast of himself.\n\nThe Belichick-Kraft relationship may need some mending, and Kraft probably tried to work on that with his heartfelt toast at the roast. You're winging it. You're trying to wing it,\" Brady said.\n\n\"So I think when you become a parent, you're trying new things for the first time, you're going through all these things for the first time so you don't exactly know always the right thing to say. One, the jokes routinely seem inappropriate. Two, comedy is subjective.\n\nThat said, the Tom Brady roast \"went there\" more than a few times regarding a topic that perhaps should have been off-limits -- especially if the whole Kraft/massage thing was on the wrong side of the line in Brady's estimation.\n\nThe subject was Aaron Hernandez. His murder(s) and his suicide were fodder for various cracks throughout the night. Even Brady made one.\n\nAgain, that's how roasts are. Also, and again, comedy is subjective. But, man, the Hernandez stuff felt like it went a little too far.\n\nHe killed at least one person, possibly two more (he was acquitted, but still). He killed himself in prison. It was a tragedy for the victims. It was a sad chapter for the NFL and the Patriots.\n\nFor most of the off-color and/or below-the-belt jokes at a roast, the butt of the joke has a voice in the process. That makes it seem a little more fair. Making fun of the dead guy for the circumstances that made him dead was weird at best, wrong at worst.\n\nOne last time, that's how roasts are. I get it. But as Brady ponders how it went last night, there's surely some part of him that regrets allowing the Hernandez jokes.\n\nUnless Brady really is a botox-and-hair-plugs cyborg incapable of human emotion. The only tight end I got going for myself is right here, right in my rear end,\" Gronkowski joked. \"I ain't coming back and playing. No shot, man.\"\n\nFurthermore, Gronkowski was effusive in his praise for Kelce, sharing, \"He's doing a great job, man.\"\n\n\"He's keeping the name alive and he's just dominating, on and off the field,\" he added. \"No doubt about that.\"\n\nThe former NFL superstar also lightly joked about Kelce's romance with Taylor Swift being referenced in her recent album, The Tortured Poets Department -- and how he didn't get any mentions on the album at all.\n\n\"I mean, I'm not upset though. But it would be pretty epic if somehow, someway, I was mentioned,\" Gronkowski quipped.\n\nSince he's not returning to the NFL, Gronkowski has more time to focus on his recreational activities, like his frequent beach party events and getting the chance to support his longtime teammate, Brady.\n\n\"I got the Tom Brady Hall of Fame induction [on] June 12th at Patriot Stadium, so that's gonna be one of the most amazing events,\" Gronkowski marveled, adding that he's mostly focused on that, and his roast of Brady, which went down Sunday night.\n\n\"I'm gonna light Tom up! The former star quarterback subjected himself to dozens of brutal jokes during The Greatest Roast of All Time: Tom Brady, a comedy special aired live on Netflix.\n\nHosted by Kevin Hart at the Kia Forum in Inglewood, Calf., the 46-year-old was the target of roasters including Kim Kardashian, Randy Moss, Sam Jay, Rob Gronkowski, Bill Belichick, and more, who offered commentary on his divorce, alleged plastic surgery, financial decisions, football legacy, and more.\n\n\"I've never seen Inglewood so white,\" joked Hart as the jokes began.\n\n\"You know, Tom, this is crazy because, for more than 20 years, Tom has ruined Sundays for football fans all over the country,\" the 44-year-old joked, referring to Brady's NFL career which includes several unpredictable comebacks, hail Mary passes, and 7 Super Bowl wins.\n\n\"But tonight, well, tonight we're gonna ruin yours, Tom. I'm gonna ruin your fu**ing Sunday.\"\n\nStandout jokes came from comedians and former athletes, alike.\n\n\"I know there's going to be a lot of jokes about me being gay for Tom,\" detailed Brady's former teammate Julian Edelman. \"Well, let me set the record straight. Those balls weren't going to deflate themselves.\"\n\n\"I'll tell you what you deflated, my legacy. I want my ring,\" quipped Randy Moss. \"Drew Bledsoe was in the freakin' hospital, and he has a Super Bowl ring. Nate Ebner... who the f**k is Nate Ebner? He has three Super Bowl rings.\"\n\nAs with any roast, the jokesters were also the victims of comedic outbursts with jokes throughout the affair on Hart's height and movie catalog, Gronkowski's intelligence level, and Belichick's scandals.\n\n\"You really gotta hand it to Kevin Hart -- because he can't reach,\" teased comedian Nikki Glaser.\n\n\"No one works harder than this man. Do you know that every morning, Kevin wakes up at 4 a.m. to make a shi**y movie?\" she continued. \"No, I love your movies. Or, as I call them, short films. I'm kidding, I hate them.\"\n\nAs a good sport, Brady was able to dish out jokes to his stage mates, as well as himself.\n\n\"Remember deflategate? The NFL spent $20 million and found that it was more probable than not that I was generally aware that someone may have deflated my footballs. You could have just given me the $20 million, and I would have just told you I fu**ing did it,\" joked the five-time Super Bowl MVP.\n\nThe comedic event comes as part of the 2024 Netflix Is a Joke Fest, taking place in the greater Los Angeles area through May 12. He closed out the Patriots' attempts for six points 36 times which is very impressive.\n\nThe average gain that he gave Coach Belichick per play was 11 yards. It was a guaranteed first down every time that they attempted to throw the ball to him. All of those added up to three Super Bowl wins for the Patriots with Edelman's help. {"uri": "8114178045", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "17:02:30", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T17:02:30Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T17:02:08Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4196078479290009, "url": "https://www.outkick.com/sports/bill-belichick-rewritting-grouch-reputation-in-time-for-2025-head-coach-search", "title": "Bill Belichick Rewritting Grouch Reputation In Time For 2025 Head Coach Search", "body": "For two decades he built an NFL dynasty that won six Super Bowls and was both the envy of and template for other teams. In that time, Bill Belichick adopted the persona of an unfriendly, off-putting, perhaps even contemptible, grouch.\n\nBelichick as an unsympathetic figure, even with some of his players, became what practically everyone outside New England saw and believed was true.\n\nAnd there was some truth to the coach's unkind reputation after allegations about cheating on the field through the use of video or deflated footballs, and cheating off the field with some other man's wife.\n\nBelichick's sometimes disagreeable attitude toward fans, game officials, and the league is well documented. His apparent disdain for some reporters, trademarked by his grunted answers to the most benign questions, became a caricature in a segment on Scott Van Pelt's Sunday evening ESPN show.\n\nLook, any football coach who thinks so much of himself he hires a consigliere and tries to diminish the team's public relations professionals, is evidence of too much self-importance.\n\nSo, yeah, Bill Belichick has been championship level objectionable at times.\n\nBut Belichick is unemployed now. And that status, either as a coincidence or strategy, has begun to show us a different guy.\n\nAn almost likable guy.\n\nWe're moving along the NFL's calendar that takes us from the Super Bowl to the scouting combine to the draft and suddenly Belichick is on television as a thoughtful, interesting analyst.\n\nHe's on the Pat McAfee show yukking it up with the former punter or engaging the other guys with serious football insight -- even though a couple of months ago he wouldn't have given them the time of day.\n\nHe's on the Netflix roast of Tom Brady Sunday evening and, even if the jokes were scripted, he embraced them like he's a witty, fun dude. Consider:\n\n\"People said Tom and I butted heads a lot. And in a way it was true, but not really,\" Belichick said during the show. \"It was hard to butt heads with Tom because it was so far up [Brady trainer] Alex Guerrero's [butt].\"\n\nBelichick, who is chasing Don Shula as the winningest coach in NFL history, showed a self-deprecating side few knew existed.\n\n\"Seriously, I'm so honored to be here for the roast of Tom Brady on Netflix,\" he said. \"It's not to be confused with the roast of Bill Belichick on the 10-part Apple TV series.\"\n\nBelichick is obviously connected to some Patriots sayings that have become descriptive of the dynasty's glory days - adages such as \"The Patriot Way\" or \"Do your job.\"\n\n\"Gronk, I've been watching you on FOX NFL Sundays,\" the coach said. \"And I'm begging you, please, stop doing your job.\"\n\nBelichick, in power for years as New England's unquestioned authority figure, is now even accepting good-natured ribbing about his current unemployment status.\n\n\"Do your job?\" former receiver Julian Edelman said to Belichick on the roast. \"More like need a job, coach.\"\n\nAnd of course, great-guy Belichick guffawed.\n\n\"You remember when you used to yell at us, 'Look [a--holes], the [expletive] kids at at Foxboro High could make that [expletive] play,\" Edelman said. \"I've been waiting for this for so long: Look, [a--hole], Foxboro High is the only job offer you [expletive] had.\"\n\nBut one has to wonder how much of it is Belichick showing us his humanity, and how much is strategic? You must know Belichick will be paid to be part of the McAfee show moving forward. And if he joins the Manning alternate telecast of Monday Night Football on ESPN, he'd be paid for that.\n\nAnd all that paid fun, insight, and attentiveness might be a way to get paid next season.\n\nYou must know that Belichick last season encountered a little bit of a surprise when the Patriots began to lose. And lose. And lose.\n\nIt was the third time in four seasons the team was under .500 but Belichick was apparently sideswiped by reporters asking pointed questions about his failures and columnists refusing to defend his abilities.\n\nAs one Patriots source put it, he didn't understand how people he'd been mistreating for years wouldn't come to his defense when he was fighting for his job.\n\nBelichick's reputation as something of an acquired taste bled over into his job search. Only the Atlanta Falcons showed significant interest in the six-time Super Bowl winning head coach for their head coach vacancy. Hmmm.\n\nEven when the Falcons' brain trust reportedly voted on who should be their next coach, Belichick obviously didn't win. He didn't even make the top three, which said a lot about everyone involved in the saga, none of it praiseworthy.\n\nNone of what happened with Belichick during the job search had anything to do with his ability to coach. It all had to do with his reputation away from the sideline.\n\nSo what we're seeing now is possibly (probably) an intentional rehabilitation of the way he's acted away from those sidelines for decades.\n\nOh, you don't believe it's intentional?\n\nThe guy has reached 2,030,348 Super Bowls concocting schemes on the field. Off the field, last year he leaked information of a one-year contract extension and his intentions to keep coaching as a way to keep his job. And you wonder if he'd be following a strategy now?\n\nScheme or not, Belichick is, until further notice, a people person. He's a fun guy. Someone everyone can like and appreciate.\n\nYeah, that's the ticket. {"uri": "8113044645", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "02:58:54", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T02:58:54Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T02:58:10Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4196078479290009, "url": "https://larrybrownsports.com/football/randy-moss-deflategate-patriots-tom-brady-roast/632655", "title": "Randy Moss had 1 big question during roast of Tom Brady", "body": "Nov 19, 2018; Los Angeles, CA, USA; Randy Moss on the ESPN Monday Night Football Countdown set at the Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum. Mandatory Credit: Kirby Lee-USA TODAY Sports\n\nPro Football Hall of Famer Randy Moss made his appearance during \"The Roast Of Tom Brady\" count.\n\nMoss on Sunday was among the dais of roasters on the Netflix comedy special dedicated to clowning New England Patriots legend Tom Brady.\n\nMoss and Brady were teammates from 2007 to 2010. However, their iconic four-year partnership failed to yield a Super Bowl win.\n\nThat's why during Moss' roast of Brady, the superstar wide receiver asked one emphatic question.\n\n\"Why the f-k didn't we cheat when I was there?\" asked Moss.\n\nMoss was referencing the 2015 NFL scandal infamously known as \"Deflategate,\" which alleged that Brady and the Patriots deliberately used deflated footballs during the 2014 AFC Championship Game. Deflated footballs are known to be easier for quarterbacks to handle.\n\nThe scandal resulted in a four-game suspension for Brady to start the 2015 season. The Patriots were also fined $1 million and had to forfeit two picks in the 2016 NFL Draft.\n\nThe Patriots, however, did end up winning the Super Bowl during the year of the \"Deflategate\" controversy -- something Moss was never able to do throughout his career.\n\nMoss was a 4-time All-Pro and led the NFL in receiving touchdowns five different times throughout his 14-year career. But Moss's lack of a Super Bowl ring appears to still haunt the 47-year-old at least a little bit.", "source": {"uri": "larrybrownsports.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Larry Brown Sports"}, {"uri": "8113922065", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "14:00:17", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T14:00:17Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T14:00:02Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.407843142747879, "url": "https://www.nbcsports.com/nfl/profootballtalk/rumor-mill/news/tom-brady-makes-telling-deflategate-joke-at-roast", "title": "Tom Brady makes telling #Deflategate joke at roast", "body": "The Tom Brady roast entailed plenty of jokes targeting low-hanging fruit. For Brady, one of the easiest items is #Deflategate.\n\nNear the end of the event that literally was as long as a football game (and, like a football game, had maybe four or five moments that mattered), Brady made a joke about his punishment for his involvement in the scam to take the air out of footballs.\n\n\"The NFL spent $20 million and found it was 'more probable than not' that I was 'generally aware' that someone may have deflated my footballs,\" Brady said. \"You could have just given me the $20 million and I would just told you I fucking did it.\"\n\nIt got a big laugh, in part because it felt like a confession.\n\nWhile Brady could plausibly say he was joking and it wasn't an admission, it sure felt like one. Really, at this point, who cares? He won three Super Bowls with properly inflated footballs. It's a footnote to an illustrious career.\n\nAnd, ultimately, who cares if the balls were in the magical range of 12.5 to 13.5 psi. No one even knows where that rule came from or why it exists. Overinflate, underinflate, who cares how much air is in the bladder of the football?\n\nMaybe that was the mindset at the heart of the joke. At the end of the day, who really gives a shit?\n\nThe NFL did, reportedly because some thought the Patriots didn't get hammered sufficiently for Spygate. It seemed ridiculous at the time. {"uri": "8113908674", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "13:51:14", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T13:51:14Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T13:50:48Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4039215743541718, "url": "https://ftw.usatoday.com/2024/05/tom-brady-roast-netflix-funny", "title": "Tom Brady's roast made him seem like a real person for once, not just a football robot", "body": "This is For The Win's daily newsletter, The Morning Win. Did a friend recommend or forward this to you? If so, subscribe here. Have feedback? Leave your questions, comments and concerns through this brief reader survey! Now, here's Mike Sykes.\n\nGoooood morning, folks. Welcome back to the Morning Win. Thank you so much for rocking with us today. We appreciate you.\n\nDid anyone get a chance to check out Tom Brady's roast? Who knew that he could actually be legitimately funny?\n\nSure, we've heard him pop the occasional joke in the locker room before. But that's a completely different thing than standing up and delivering jokes about himself and others in front of an audience of thousands. That roast was actually good.\n\nREAD MORE: The best of the Tom Brady roast\n\nFor once, Tom Brady seemed like an actual person. We know the book on him. He spent so many years in the NFL playing under Bill Belichick's New England Patriots. The team was quite literally not allowed to be fun. Personality was something that was frowned upon with very few exceptions.\n\nSo, for most of us who didn't live in New England, Brady has usually been nothing but a boogeyman. He was hump you either don't want your team to come across or hope that it can get over. This roast made the boogeyman seem pretty human for once!\n\nIt was funny! Brady was in his bag. His best joke may have been this dig at Kanye West at the expense of Kim Kardashian. There was also this hilarious Deflategate confession that I am absolutely taking as a confession.\n\nPlus, he took some pretty bad ones on the chin. There were lots of Gisele B\u00fcnchden jokes (probably too many for my taste). This Crypto joke really hit home for me. That's good stuff, man. That's really good stuff.\n\nWhatever, though. This isn't really about the jokes as much as it's about as human as I've ever seen Brady be. Let me be clear, I am not a fan of this man. At all. But for one night, he was cool. And that's something I'd never thought I'd say.\n\nGood on you, Brady. Good on you. Still don't like you tho.\n\nThe champs are out\n\nThere will be a new Stanley Cup champion this year, folks. The Las Vegas Golden Knights are officially eliminated from the NHL playoffs.\n\nThat's not really that shocking considering that the Dallas Stars were the better team coming into the series. But after the Golden Knights grabbed a 2-0 series lead on Dallas? It definitely felt like the cards were in Vegas' favor (yes, that's a pun).\n\nThe rest of the NHL is probably thrilled. Everyone hated the way Vegas went about getting Mark Stone back from long-term injured reserve. They'd snagged big targets at the trade deadline because they were able to temporarily remove his salary from their books while he was on LTIR.\n\nOur Mary Clarke wrote about that here:\n\n\"Why is that significant? Because the Golden Knights were able to put Stone on Long-Term Injured Reserve, meaning they could clear his $9.5 million cap hit off the books so they could go after big trade targets at the March 8 deadline, with Vegas netting Tomas Hertl, Anthony Mantha, and Noah Hanifin when all was said and done.\"\n\nThat definitely didn't feel right. Maybe it wasn't. But none of it matters now. Vegas is out. And with that, I leave you this tweet from the Stanley Cup trophy.\n\nThat's the good stuff.\n\nLet's never do that again, NBA.\n\nIs it just me or is a 1:00 p.m. Eastern Time tipoff for a Game 7 kind of wild? The Cavaliers and Magic should feel disrespected.\n\nI mean, look. One in the afternoon isn't necessarily the worst time on a Sunday. But wouldn't, say, 3 p.m. be better? Especially for a nationally televised game with one of its teams playing on ABC for the first time since 2012. That's ridiculous.\n\nNot only did this series have to fight through the attention being hogged online by Kendrick Lamar and Drake, but it also had to fight through afternoon pancake naps on a non-NFL Sunday.\n\nThat didn't feel right. At all. The game was good and exciting. Donovan Mitchell went off to save the Cavaliers' season. But it just felt...weird to be watching such a crucial game at such a weird time.\n\nCan we not do that again, NBA? Thanks.\n\nQuick hits: Nikola Jokic's biggest test yet ... Ranking the 8 NBA playoff teams left ... and more\n\n-- Here's Robert Zeglinksi with Nikola Jokic's take on what is the biggest test of his reign yet.\n\n-- Prince Grimes ranks the eight playoff teams left and the Celtics are not No. 1\n\n-- Tom Brady didn't seem happy about this joke at his roast. Sheesh. Here's Charles Curtis with more.\n\n-- Could J.J. Watt come back to the Texans? It's possible. Here's Robert again with more.\n\n-- The Kentucky Derby set a record for money wagered this year. Here's Ben Fawkes with more.\n\n-- Anthony Edwards completely shifted the odds on the Wolves-Nuggets series with one game. Prince has more on that.\n\nThat's a wrap, folks! Thanks so much for reading. We appreciate you. Tap in again tomorrow! See you then. {"eng-9541551": {"articles": {"results": [{"uri": "8114468749", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "21:27:11", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T21:27:11Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T21:26:44Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6000000238418579, "url": "https://www.arcamax.com/sports/football/s-3233206", "title": "Here's the joke that crossed the line for Tom Brady during his Netflix roast", "body": "He endured jokes about his divorce, his business decisions, his love life, his multiple retirements, his former teammates, his ex-wife, his healthy lifestyle and much more -- all with a smile on his face.\n\nAnd that was just in the first 20 minutes of \"The Roast of Tom Brady\" at the Kia Forum that was streamed live on Netflix.\n\nOne gag, however, apparently crossed the line as far as Brady was concerned -- and the seven-time Super Bowl champion wasn't even the butt of that particular joke. The target was New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft, the man who signed Brady's paychecks for the first 20 years of his 23-year NFL career.\n\nAfter host Kevin Hart opened the show with a blistering monologue -- \"Why didn't we go to the Crypto.com Arena downtown? Well, the reason why we didn't go there is because we didn't want to remind Tom's fans of how much money he owes them\" -- comedian and celebrity roast staple Jeff Ross kept the hits coming. He talked about how Brady was drafted in the sixth round with the 199th pick of the 2000 NFL draft \"when Bill Belichick's dog stepped on the keyboard by accident.\"\n\n\"So Tom became a Patriot,\" Ross said, \"moved up to New England and on the first day of training camp, that scrawny rookie famously walked into the owner Robert Kraft's office and said, 'I'm the best decision your organization has ever made. Would you like a massage?'\"\n\nThe joke was a reference to Kraft being arrested in 2019 on charges of soliciting sex from a prostitute during an encounter at a Florida day spa. Kraft pleaded not guilty, and the charges were dropped the following year after his lawyers prevented video and audio footage from being used as evidence in court.\n\nAs the crowd laughed and Ross blew a kiss in Kraft's direction, Brady could be seen shifting in his seat behind and to the right of the comedian. The camera cut to a close shot of Ross, who said \"I love Robert Kraft.\"\n\nBrady then approached Ross. The NFL's all-time leader in passing yards and touchdown passes had a bit of a smile on his face, but his tone was dead serious when he leaned in and said to Ross, \"Don't say that s -- again.\"\n\nAs Brady returned to his seat, Ross laughed, put his hands up and said, \"OK, OK!\" He pointed in Kraft's direction and said, \"He's having fun, look at him.\" As Ross added some sincere words of praise
